Very fun but takes very very long to get anything done. Small map size, lackluster quests, tiny introduction with no objective whatsoever, impossible to run even on an rtx 4070, and improper placement of textures all take away from the game however. For example the improper placement of textures on the map introduces barriers that exist in places where they should not making it impossible to access areas for any of the "sidequests". Unfortunately the developers have been taking a very long time to try to improve this game as i have been playing for a few years and have not seen any major improvements to the games bugs and errors. So overall, I wouldn't reccomend this game to anyone unless they have a lot of patience to deal with a game that hardly functions and enjoy long boring gameplay to try to get one small task done for goal.

I highly recommend this game! I play a few different farm/ranch type games and this one is by farm my favourite!
I'm very much looking forward to all the features they'll be adding as I'll be a long time player!
P.S I hope sheep and turkeys are added as well as other farm animals because I quite enjoy raising up the chickens, cattle, and goats.

Update after UE5 and full release - not much changed and this is still not a finished product. It's a prototypical indie sim with an actions wheel - this one in ranch flavor. Controls okay except vehicle physics and control are insanely horrible, graphics okay-ish for low end game, sound is okay at best, though often there is none at all and it makes me wonder if it is broken. Building mode is sorely deficient in content and use, especially for a game based around it. Chickens and cows have some wild quirks to deal with. Not being able to pause a single player game and no auto save on exit is mystifying. MP is limited 4 person P2P using Steam, but honestly maybe the most fun part of the game is laughing at the bugs and janky physics with friends. Game crash after a couple hours? Sucks to be you! And it WILL happen... Considering what we get from some other indie sims, Ranch Sim is lacking. I was very much looking forward to it and REALLY wanted to like this game and play with friends. I bought it early on in EA, but am very disappointed at what was released as a finished product. This game is nothing special except in the wrong ways IMO.
my fav rainy sunday game

Love this game so far!

Let us start with what I really like. I like being a lumberjack. I like chopping down trees, sawing them into boards, and sometimes I like building things with those boards. I think it comes rather natural to me. I first discovered this talent when I played Ultima Online fy hunnit years ago. Ranch Simulator really scratches this itch.

My first Ranch Simulator game was definitely real life. I built too much fencing and had to take out a loan, and then my chickens died. So I quit and started over. That was fun!

My second game is not over yet, and you know what annoys me more than milking a cow and ending up stuck against a fence? I built this awesome ranch house, but I cannot paint it any color, at all. I mean, at least my barn is red, but the house? Nope. It's... pine-colored... Better not have to pay money for a DLC to paint my house. I swear to God.

All my chickens, and their chicks, are alive. Except for the ones I turned into delicious chicken salami sausages. Blue cheese is where the money's at. Get you some dairy cows. Milk them for all they're worth. Make cheese. Pigs start small and then they just grow giant. I was afraid the male pigs would eat the young, so I stuck them in stalls in the barn. Do not want to find out by having all my piglets et by a dumb pig.

I love and hate the pickup truck. The handling is atrocious, but you can stack a lot of boards in the back of it. You can also put at least two pigs in the back.

Oh, I almost forgot, I had to WALK my first dairy cow all the way back to the farm because I had no way of transporting her. It was a test of my patience. I almost made hamburger several times. Get a livestock trailer!

I do not have a combine yet, but I feel like I have plateaued somewhat.

If you've ever dreamed of leaving the hustle and bustle of city life behind for a tranquil existence in the countryside, look no further than Ranch Sim. This game is an absolute gem, offering players a delightful escape into the serene world of ranching.

From the moment you step foot onto your virtual ranch, you're greeted with breathtaking vistas, lush landscapes, and charming farm animals that are just waiting to be cared for. The attention to detail is impeccable, from the realistic weather effects to the adorable animations of the animals.

What truly sets Ranch Sim apart is its immersive gameplay experience. Whether you're tending to crops, raising livestock, or exploring the vast open world, every moment feels meaningful and rewarding. The sense of accomplishment when you see your hard work pay off is unparalleled.

But perhaps the most remarkable aspect of Ranch Sim is its ability to evoke a sense of peace and tranquility. After a long day, there's nothing quite like escaping into this virtual oasis, where the only deadlines are set by the rising and setting sun.

In conclusion, Ranch Sim is more than just a game – it's a therapeutic journey into rural bliss. Whether you're a seasoned farmer or a city slicker looking for a change of pace, this game has something for everyone. Prepare to lose yourself in its beauty and charm for hours on end. CRUCIAL SUGGESTIONS : This game have a huge potential, but some features are missing

The features suggestions are in 3 categories :
- short term
- mid term
- long term

The features with a ⭐ are keys features or priority that can allow sometimes other features to take place.

Short term features :

- ⭐ MORE ITEMS :
We need more items (a lot of items are already in the game but I don't understand why we can't use and place them, as usable items or even just as a decoration) there's tons of items in the hardware store like squared water tanks or in the pre-built houses, why can't I build a chair or fireplace or any basic object from pre-existing modeled objects in the game? The items are already in the game ! You just need to make them available for players, is it so hard to just pick like 30 items created for the houses, and make them available for decoration ?

- PATHS
I don't understand that we still don't have the ability to just create a simple path or road, even a tiny ground path to make a clear distinction with grass. Most games of this type or base building games have that basic option

Mid term features :

- INTERIORS
Apart from the gas station, the general store and the hardware store, all buildings in this little city are closed. This is terrible that with already such a small map, the buildings are not even open. The map feels dead.
The bare minimum, should be to be able to visit each store, even if there's nothing to buy, but to make every place open to visit, with a NPC merchant in each store, just to give it more life. Such a "blocks" city feels like a game from 20 years ago. And the effort to just design a few dozens interiors is not big compare to the result and such a different vibe it would give to the city.
A good example : Medieval Dynasty, all the houses and building are open, from any village. And it makes everything just more real.

- NPCs WALKING AROUND
In addition to a few more interiors available, a crucial feature that would change completely the look of the town, would be to add a few NPCs walking outside, just walking around the city. No need to implement something very fancy, with a schedule and complex life for NPCs, we don't need something at the level of RDR2, but just NPCs walking around the town in circle would be a great start and would give much more life to the city. And then, why not making them talk between each other, buying some stuff, walking with things in their hands etc. Do it step by step.
Again, a good example is Medieval Dynasty, the only fact of having NPCs around makes the game more much alive and you don't feel alone in the game.

- WEIGHT SYSTEM
It feels very strange the weight system is completely broken in this game. If you drop even just a little object on a car, it feels like the object is 500 kilos, but some things that are supposed to be heavy, like metal, concrete or even animals like bulls, feels like they don't weight anything. A realistic weight system should be implemented, that would affect cars, animals, materials and buildings.

- ⭐ SURVIVAL FEATURES
Something I really don't understand, is that we spend all our time feeding pigs, cows, chickens, we give them water and taking care about their basic needs, and the animals are even sleeping, but our character... he don't need to eat, don't need to drink, he can work day and night and is basically a robot. It breaks all coherence.
The basic survival features should be implemented in the game. And I mean basic, we don't need something complicate, just start with the need to drink, eat and sleep and it would be amazing.

Also, a good addition would be a stamina or energy system, so the character would not be able to work like superman and would spend energy along his tasks, so it would become interesting to manage the tasks in the day to not burn the energy too fast.
There's a huge hidden potential as soon as you implement that, because we could imagine that doing all manually (feeding with bags, water, manual grinder etc) would take huge amount of energy to the character but would be cheap, and at the opposite, using machines, big tractors and this kind of stuff would be expensive to buy, but it would be even more worth it not just because it's faster, but because it takes much less energy, just like in real life.
And of course the weight system mentioned previously, would directly impact the energy system, the more carry heavy things, the more you get tired quickly.

- ELECTRICITY SYSTEM
I don't understand the concept of having to fulfill all cars and machines with fuel, and having to refill at the gas station (which is realistic and good) but... at the same time, placing a light anywhere, or placing a house anywhere, magically makes electricity appears from nowhere. Is it not supposed to be an off grid ranch ?
There should be the necessity in the game to have some electricity, from solar panels or from the grid, but then we should have to pay electricity bills.
And we should have the choice between using the grid or having our own electrical system, and THEN, the possibility to install everything, the cables, the generators etc...
A good example : Sons of the Forest.

Long term features :

- MORE ANIMATIONS
In consequence of more NPC's walking around, more survival features added and more items (like chairs for example), it should be a normal addition to have more animations, for example drinking, eating, sitting, skinning a prey (even just a basic movement, instead of nothing) and overall, more animations to make the game more realistic and alive.

- ⭐FAMILY & WORKERS
In addition to NPC's walking around the city, we should have the capacity to talk to some NPCs to convince them to come and work on our ranch.
And if we have a good relation with a NPC, we should be able to marry and have kids. That's basic ranch life.
Having some NPCs working for us and paying them, would be awesome and would give us the opportunity to put some NPCs at the most repetitive tasks.
These NPCs could even have a skills system or speciality.
And of course, we should take care of the workers and making sure they have food, they have a bed, and are paid.

- ⭐ BIGGER MAP AND NEW MAPS
The size of the map right now is extremely small. Even a map double this size would already be the bare minimum, right now it's below minimum.
The actual map should be at least 2 to 4 times bigger, even if it's just nature, with forest and moutains and nothing more.
THEN, if you don't want to do just the minimum but actually a good or great game, you should have 2 to 4 maps, with a city for each maps, with different stores and products to buy for each map. I don't think it takes a huge time to design like a big forest and a few mountains, where we could actually go around with our horse or go hunting.

- ⭐ HUNTING
Hunting in this game feels like a joke, no offense, but there's no hunting, it's simply going out of the car, taking your rifle and shooting a deer that is already in the middle of the road. The AI of the animals is non-existent. They just run around with no awareness of the players or cars around. Just adding a basic code to make the animals at least, run away from the player in a perimeter of 50 meters would already be a HUGE improvement to the game and would make it much more fun.
I don't know, take a game like the Hunter or RDR2 and implement just 5% of it, and it will be fantastic.
Just having animals that are scared of us and run away would be good.
Having the ability to carry the animal in our pick-up would be better.
Ability to skin and take the fur of the animal to do something with it would be fantastic.
And also, in coherence with the previous point of bigger map, the animals should not go around like robots, they should remain in big forests far from humans, so it would add a great vibe to hunting, because we would need to go in areas that a properly deep nature, to go hunting.

Wasn't sure how I was going to initially like this game. It was on my wishlist for awhile and I finally went through with the purchase after snagging a deal on it. 

Pros-
1. I like the variety of livestock types the game provides. I
2. The ability to make the ranch exactly how you want layout wise is really nice. I like being able to customize the setup with fences and such. 

Neutral Thoughts
1. The weather system is fine, but it would be nice to have some sort of seasons and/or weather information panel displayed somewhere. Sometimes it is snowing and my character is out there running around in a tank top. 
2. The graphics are fine, but not outstanding. Lower range when compared to other similar games. I don't think this impacts my game as much, but just something to note. 

Cons-
1. My character seems very lonely. There are no NPC's to interact with, besides the limited interactions with some store clerks/quest tasks. I know this isn't what the game it about, but may make it more interesting. 
2. The breeding system is not great. For instance, every one of my chicks born is a hen. Almost impossible to get a rooster. I understand they did this because roosters and valued so much higher in the shop than hens, but not really how nature works. 
3. Limited number of crops available to grow. You also have to use planter boxes for the garden plants. Wish there was a way to till them in the ground. 
4. Limited crop plots. If you have ever played another farming simulator, this will be very evident. 
5. A single log only makes 2 wood planks. So tedious. 
6. The wildlife could act a bit more wild-lifey. The deer just hop around aimlessly waiting for you to shoot them. 

Wishlist Items -
1. Seasonal impacts on crop and garden growth. 
2. When you scroll over a livestock animal, more information such as sex and age would be helpful. 
3. More ranch buildings and items available to build. 
4. More livestock breeds.
5. The ability to chick the chicken that keeps attacking me every time I collect eggs. :)
6. I wish the breeding mechanic was a little more realistic. At this time, a male will only breed with one female a day. If you've worked on a farm, you know this to be quite unrealistic during breeding season. 

Some other wishlist items they already seem to be tackling in upcoming updates, so I wouldn't list them here. 

Overall opinion - The game is worth a buy. If you are in to very relaxed independent (maybe even soothing) gameplay, this is going to be it for you. If you are really into farming, like you have a much higher interest in farming equipment and a bit more realistic crops and farming mechanisms in your game, you will be disappointed here. If you are just in it to make a bunch of money and breed a bunch of animals, and are okay with the relatively lower graphics and realistic features, I think you will enjoy it enough to get your monies worth.

It's a promising game. I'm waiting for a really long time for a game with this idea. The problem is that this game seems a little bit too fresh. The tutorial is way too simple, and doesn't cover exactly what you should do after demolishing all the trashed structures in your ranch. I got lost after that, bought some chickens, hunted a deer...and...that's it. I know that there's a lot of stuff to do like growing crops, extracting oil, transforming the stuff you produce...but since there's no directions given...I felt just lost and lost motivation.

But don't get me wrong. It's a good game, with very interesting mechanics and totally acceptable graphics. I'll just give it some time to revisit and play it in a more advanced stage.

I was a big fan of this game, keyword in that sentence being was. I played this game with 2 of my friends and it was an absolute blast we had fun with all of the games vast mechanics from building to cheese making. However, where the fun stopped was when the unreal engine 5 update came out. We were a bit upset that our old save would no longer work but we were excited to have all the fun all over again. We were even more upset when upon launching the game and attempting to join each others session that either, the game did not run at all or it crashed within 2 minutes of 'gameplay' (by that I mean severely low frame rates with choppy looking textures). We tried several common bug fixes such as restarting our computers and the game, verifying game file integrity we even went as far as uninstalling and reinstalling the game. This was sadly to no avail. This was a massive letdown to us all, we went from being excited for the new unreal engine 5 update to having it robbed us of the game we once enjoyed. I have attempted to play the game every 2 weeks or so since these issues to see if patches have fixed the issues but I've had no success so far. If anyone has any suggestions for fixes that may work please tell me of them I would greatly appreciate them. In summary, this game is AWESOME when it runs.... This game is built on solid mechanics with room to improve but at its core it is a unique interesting game. I hope it gets fixed in the future as I would love to be able to experience again as well others having the opportunity to experience it the way it was pre-unreal 5. Hope it will work again someday

This is a wonderful little game which I have played for 361 hours so far. But there are many things that can drive you insane. The vehicle handling is horrendous and needs sorting out (especially the farm equipment), I was warned about the farm equipment and advised to ignore the farming side. But I gave it a go and almost pulled all my hair out. Since that first foray into the farming I have left that side of the game well alone, as it is anything but enjoyable. For farming I will use other farming sim games. Building and running the Ranch side of the game is fantastic to be honest and very enjoyable. There are a couple of frustrating bits though, animals that don't wake up, a box truck that if you fill it with goods either freezes the game at selling points or just keeps flipping over ( I would recommend using the car transporter trailer, which is great for transporting almost everything except animals). The box truck is however good for transporting the livestock. I would recommend giving the game a try, just expect some frustration mixed in with your enjoyment! As the game was only fully released last November, hopefully the developers will work on this little problem areas. I also hope they introduce more livestock to help fill out your ranch. As you have a large area for the few types of livestock in the game.

Very good to waste some time, especially with friends, but other than that, its pretty much a lackluster, lacking a substantial amount of content, considering the potential of such kind of game. The main problem being simply how little you can do in a Ranch Sim game, that for some reason have farming and... oil prospecting elements?

You are limited to basically taking care of cattle, pigs, chickens or horses, and then use their very limited amount of produce, like eggs, milk, and meat, to be refined into into either cheese, sausage or meatballs, and that's pretty much it, nothing else to do.

I cant even consider farming, hunting, oil prospecting or beekeeping due to how little you can do with them. Farming almost feels like an afterthought due to how limited it is, lacking crop variety, and the complete inexistence of any refining process; Hunting feels like a forgotten aspect of the game, that could easily be removed; Bee keeping and Oil prospecting being basically idle money generators.

I really want to like this game, I bought it several years ago and never installed it due to being deep in Farming Simulator. I decided to try it being that it has been out for several years now thinking it should be plenty of time to develop and work out bugs. I honestly couldn't be more wrong.

I'll start with the negatives as that's what really people should be aware of.

[b]No auto save[/b]
You better make sure to save regularly manually. How you don't implement this feature from the beginning is beyond me. Nothing worse than doing several hours of work to realize most of it is gone when the game crashes. Before the developer blames my computer I can assure that my system wasn't the cause for the crash. AMD 5800X, RTX 3070, 128gb of RAM, 2TB Gen 4 NVME dedicated to games only, no OS on that hard drive. Bought a vehicle and the game crashed.

 [b]Driving Physics are terrible[/b]
You're driving on ice the entire time, god forbid you have a trailer and have to make a turn. The trailer whips like crazy. Both keyboard and controller driving is not a fun experience. There's no finesse or throttle modulation what so ever. Hooking a trailer is a royal pain. The game could really benefit from having gears. Even if it's just drive and reverse that are controlled with the throttle button and braking is done on a separate key. When using farm equipment with a controller the throttle key is the same key to activate the equipment. It's a different key on mouse but make it a bindable key. Nothing about driving in this game is realistic.

[b]No dedicated server support[/b]
Playing with friends is a pain because if you start on your save or someone else's you're SOL if you want to play for a bit alone. I saw on the Steam forums that someone (possibly a person on the development team) recommends sharing save files. Could it work? Sure, however that is the biggest headache to manage if several people are trying to play the same game. The idea behind it is just asinine.

[b]Vehicle bugs[/b]
Vehicles parked dance and float all over the place. It is to be expected in the very beginning of the game but a game that has been out several years should not have this many bugs when you have to use vehicles as often.

[b]No keybind changes for controller[/b]
I get alot of PC gamers use M/KB, how ever with how bad this game is to drive on keyboard a controller aids it to some degree. If the game does change keybinds for controller it was not allowing me to do it.

I'm sure it sounds knit picking and I can go further into negatives about this game but I don't think anything will get changed. These are the major things I noticed that make me not want to play the game.

Now for the positives

[b]Character Creation[/b]
The character creation is pretty good. It's limited but overall good

[b]Building[/b]
The building is probably the best thing about the game. It's interactive without being overly complicated for no reason. It's not the type that as long as the materials are in your inventory something just pops up. It takes the right amount of time to collect materials and plan out your build. The models seem well put together and make sense to the game. Nothing seems out of place with how the models look.

[b]Harvesting Materials[/b]
I've seen several reviews of people complaining about the hunting and guns however it's a good aspect of the game. When you start your ranch it's a bit grindy to obtain starting materials but it's to be expected in this type of game. The process of cutting trees and creating planks is fun. I would like to see concrete and metal be more interactive than buying a prefab bag or sheet of metal. Mixing the cement with water would be a good way. Metal is what it is as I don't see it being a mining sim to dig and melt ore to obtain metal.

If you made it this far thank you for the time to read this long winded rant. Overall the game needs a lot of work and I can not recommend someone paying full price for the game. The amount of time that has passed that this game is out and the amount of basic features the game is lacking makes the game not worth $25. If in the future they implement stuff like auto save, and the ability to create a server without having to purchase a second copy or over pay for some garbage rented game server I could see the game progressing. As it sits today the game is fun for a couple of hours when you're bored. Just my opinion.

Fun and fairly addictive game... preferred it in some ways over the other Farming Simulator franchise, especially the animal husbandry and making money.
If you're into arable farming, it's kinda lame however. Growing wheat in order to feed animals was hardly economically more beneficial than just paying to fill the grain silos themselves, after you've forked out for fertilizer and spent time cultivating, sowing and harvesting the land. I literally grew wheat once and then abandoned that part of the game. Horses, although cool and fun to ride and bid for at auction, have limited interaction capability apart from riding. You can't breed them either. There are also a couple of weird bugs, like fertilized chicken eggs not hatching after a while. Vehicle handling is also a bit on the wild side.
Having said that, I did have fun getting rich selling moldy cow cheese and micromanaging my bred farm animals! And building in the game is good. You can choose prefab farm houses that you supply the material for and then, once complete, spawn furniture and have a nice lived-in feel. Or you can build your own structures, although the lack of ability to repaint or texture the brown wood is a bit disappointing. Definitely recommend though for what the game CAN do

Not worth full price. The map is poorly designed and not realistic. Roads are a bit wonky, and traffic are just empty husks moving at 10mph. There is virtually no AI to speak of. It is a very simple game, but tedious. Moving animals to separate males from females is obnoxious, the animals immediately head for any open door or gate the instant it is opened. You cannot tell gender until the animal is old enough to breed, and they do so nearly instantly. There is a large lake but no use for it, the hardware store is tedious to get into and out of, there is a random franchised burger joint in a small town buying local meat, when it should be a mom-and-pop diner, weird town design and layout that is ultimately pointless and is just set dressing. At $25, it is overpriced. This is a $10 game. Buy it on sale if you know what you're buying. I don't regret the purchase, but I'm glad I bought it on sale.

This game would be improved with more realistic terrain, more realistic roads, rain actually watering crops, and more appropriate set dressing. It would be improved with simple UI fixes, like showing what gender the animal is since birth. Even better would be a more rigid animal moving system, improving vehicle handling, increasing the amount of planks you receive from a piece of wood, removing the grass from underneath placed structures (there is a lawn mower, so we already know grass can be trimmed, do it automatically so it doesn't grow through the floor), and improving the animal behavior so they're less robotic "must go through open door right this instant, stop eating, a door is open," and improving the gunplay and wild animals so the hunting aspect is a little more immersive, worthwhile, and engaging, rather than "drive around until you find an animal and poof it into meat." Also, players should start with a low grade horse. By the time you have enough money for a horse, they're useless. That animal can help work.

Ahh yes, a very delightful game I should say. In the beginning, I went on a little hunting adventure to help make myself money. I also found out that there are people who give out quests  around the map and give you some dough upon completion. There is one man though, who I call Old Man Wrinkle Bum, that gives out the most exquisite quest of them all, Treasures of the Ancients. This quest gives you $2500 and it comes back every so often. 
     After collecting some money I decided it was time to buy some material for two oil rigs. After finding that liquid gold I built the rigs, gassed them up, and let them work for me. Passive income! I like it. There is quite a bit of money to be made with these things. With more bands stacking up in my bank account I went on to build a barn and buy 1 male and 6 female pigs. (Big mistake, definitely should've gotten a little less females. Did not know that the great pig death wave of '24 was gonna happen) These pigs were the best, they were loved. I fed and watered them every day until eventually I noticed something. A pig was pregnant! After a long few days the pig finally had some babies and I got to watch them grow.
     When the pigs started having more babies I realized I needed to make a silo and a windmill to easily fill up the troughs with food and water. I just simply could not keep up with feeding them. While waiting for enough money to buy the materials I saw that I failed myself as a rancher. I neglected to feed the pigs that day. One of the pigs was dead, and then another, and another. Multiple pigs had died because of my incompetence. From that day forward I swore I would never let that happen again.
      I skinned the dead pigs and filled about 6 coolers worth of meat. I went on down to the burger restaurant and sold the meat for 1.9x and got almost $9000. Now that is epic.
     Anyways, I'm really rambling on about this game so I should stop. The bottom line is that this game is really fun to play. I would highly recommend playing with friends because it makes the game easier and way more fun. Yes there are some things and little fixes that I'd love to see but the game is still great considering the fact that it's so new. I can't wait to see what the future has for this game. Thanks for reading my long review.
     Edit: OH MY GOSH. THE FIREWORKS IN THIS GAME ARE INSANE. After I got enough money to live comfortably I bought 2gs worth of fireworks and had an amazing show. The only thing I'd like to add is the ability to hear fireworks from further away.

This is a game I really wanted to like because it really does have a lot of potential to be a really fun game. But, in it's current state I just can't in good conscience recommend it at this point in time - even at its sale price, nor is it in a complete state and chose to ultimately refund it. The controls are probably the jankiest I've seen in a game, there's some very simple quality of life features that aren't currently in game - such as regrowing trees...once they're gone, they're gone? Really? I know it sounds a little nitpicky, but when there's a limited amount around your ranch, not being able to regrow trees or anything is a little absurd to me.  Sure you can purchase what you need from the store, but for me at least that takes a little bit of the fun out. My biggest concern is that at the time of this review I have found no real road map, and the developers haven't seemed to be very active with the community. Multi-player users want love too. Gameplay is glitchy at best when playing as a co-op person. Trailers keep running when player one stops using them. When a co-op person tries to get in, they go flying in the air to land who knows where. I frequently run into objects that aren't there, but if I look at player 1's screen, there is clearly an object there. Just fix co-op players already. These have been issues since day 1.

I don't mind the grind, but the game feels still early access, not full version. I don't regret buying it as I hope it will improve in the future, but am glad I got it on sale. I neither recommend nor don't recommend it, it's a "got potential" purchase.

Some of the things that need improvement to make it playable without frustration:

- an option to turn off head-bobbing. For people with motion sickness, 1st person might be unplayable. Sometimes drastic camera movements occur while driving, so be aware if that is an issue for you
- make at least small objects movable. It doesn't make sense that I cannot move a wall light after having placed it once (you can only destruct and rebuild - without reclaming any material)
- UX needs some improvement. You pick up logs with the left mouse button, but if you want to insert them into the table saw, you need to press E. Accidentalliy clicking will pack up the saw immediately and drop the log. Better continuity of controls would help a lot
- some involuntarily comic situations - there's a store with an (un)helpful lady telling you to use the self-checkout. If the store's closed, she can be seen through the window, sitting and the counter,  same expression, unmoved by her nightly freedom, just awaiting to continue her fate as a one-sentence NPC in the morning
- town feels reaaaally empty
- dialogues are lacking
- if you're playing for the first time, building blueprints is hit and miss. As you don't know (and can't see) which sides need to be accessible, you might end up placing constructions in a wrong orientation. You cannot fix it, you have to destroy and rebuild (with new material)
- radio doesn't seem to work
- it does not make sense that plants don't receive water from natural rain, not even from downpour during thunderstorms. It can rain all day, but if you get home you'll might still see your plants drying out
- lack of item descriptions - you won't know if you buy a package of seeds for 10 tomato plants, or for 100 unless you hold it in your hands (it's ten), same for building, you won't know if a planter box holds one plant or ten until you build it and try to fill it

That said, I did enjoy playing it, but the frustrating bits are...frustrating. I think I'll come back to the game after some more QOL updates.

Positives:
- character customization is great! It's always a big plus if you can play female characters and have the same range of options for all genders
- the landscape looks nice and believable for the setting (albeit a bit empty). "Waking up" to a crisp blue sky almost feels real and is relaxing
- the devs seem very involved and accomodating
- great potential
- harvesting crops and seeing growth is fun, as is getting livestock
- I like the customization options that are there even for chickens, and your car
- driving is hilarious
- being able to do everything yourself (sawing logs, collecting them, building, having to drive to the store  to sell your wares)

If the devs keep on working on it, this game definitely will be great in the future. As of now, it doesn't feel like a 1.0 version, but like early access. I hope future updates will adress the remaining issues and fill the game with life.

Game's generally a 5 or 6 out of 10. Handling feels like you're driving on ice. It also feels like there's a delay from the moment you press to drive forward to the moment you actually get going. Driving with trailers is a nightmare as they're really skittish.

Apparently, trees don't regrow and I didn't see any way you can replant them.

Quests seem very limited, and there's no real guidance on what you should do first - like I don't know, achievements that earn you cash as you progress through them such as "build your first coop, get your first egg, hatch your first egg, sell your first egg" so on so forth... 
Once you're done with the tutorial, you're on your own - I mean I like that in a lot of games, but sometimes just a small idea of what you should do would do it good.


For now that's all I can think of, but I'll probably update this as I play more/it gets more updates (hopefully!).

This game is a masterpiece of (probably intentional) poor programming. It has the same physics as GTA 3. The deer fling themselves into traffic with reckless abandon and hitting them is like running into a brick building. Animals can breed through the walls of the barn and fencing. When you load the bed of your vehicle, everything you put in is basically super-glued down and you can do a triple barrel roll down the side of the mountain with no hard feelings and everything still in place (including animals). Once, I bought a car trailer and the rear quarter of it clipped through the edge of the building. Nothing I did could get it out so I spent the rest of that game just going around it to get in and out of the store. I got mauled by two bears at the hardware store in the tutorial. You can't pause the game even if you're playing by yourself. Every time you open a gate, every animal in the pen turns to face you and starts zombie-shambling toward the opening. When you skin an animal (especially pigs) they EXPLODE like a meat landmine and chunks of pork get flung EVERYWHERE. It's HILARIOUS. 

It's incredibly satisfying to build your ranch empire up from nothing, breeding your stock and processing animal products into cheese and sausages to sell. I've only played single player but I think having a friend and dividing farm chores would make for a fun evening or three. I'm reaching the point in my second save that I have a solid production line and predictable income, and at this point I am at a bit of a loss for what my "next objective" is- after the tutorial you're released to do your own thing and build up the ranch as you see fit. I've built what I want and my trajectory is clear- I suppose at this point it's a matter of amassing a fortune. 

I love everything about this game. Its programming quirks have given me several good chuckles, but it's nothing game-breaking and I'm still having a lot of fun. I may have just about run my course on it unless I find some other thing to do or build that I missed (or if I can con a friend into playing with me), but I think 60 hours is a fair amount of gameplay for the price.

I really enjoyed this game.  I built a huge ranch with a greenhouse full of grapes, hundreds of chickens, etc.  It was fun.  And I really liked the hunting aspect.  As an avid player of similar types of games I can say that I hope the developers of this one will continue working on it.  The interactions with objects in the world were much less complex than I have seen in other games.  That is a plus.  But some improvements still need to be made.
Some of the major things that still need work include, vehicles behaving as if on ice.  Kinda fun when you are just playing around, like drifting almost.  But, when you really need them to drive correctly it can be very frustrating.  Also, the vehicles need a low gear.  They take off like a rocket and stop on a dime.  Hunting is way too easy.  Animals make no sound as they approach most of the time.  Maybe OK for deer or rabbits, but bears are not stealthy.  There seem to be no seasons and it rains every day.  You can't make roads or do any landscaping.  Prices on things are illogical and have no basis in reality.  I could go on.
Bottom line is that the game has potential but needs some real work to be recommended.

Only buy on sale & only if you're FULLY AWARE this is a far from complete game with many issues. Plenty of UE cut&paste elements do not make a game, there's a decent "idea" somewhere here but the execution is quite poor to be honest. Early grind is looonnnggg so be aware you'll miss the 2hr Steam refund window. I don't actually mind the grind like others who've posted reviews mention, there's some satisfaction about chopping down 12+ trees and manually sawing all the planks needed for example but co-op would help with this as well. There's only 4/5 NPC's & only a couple have a very limited number of quests for you to complete. There's no shopkeeper interaction as all transactions are via a self-service till (like you get in McDonalds). Physics of the game is all over the place. Running is like trudging through syrup, driving using mouse & keyboard is a task in abject patience as its like driving a rolling skate on ice! The building is solid but uninspired, if you've played other UE built games such as Stranded Deep etc you'll know how all this works. If you just want a really chill game to waste a couple of hours with I can recommend Lake by Gamious but that has no building at all so if you want a really basic game with very limited content to just build a farm with...I'm sure there are games out there with much more content. Depends what you want but buy with all eyes open as there's not much here to engage a player for very long unless you enjoy long, laborious tasks, maybe skip this one until its closer to being "finished" (though its been in development for a while now?) oh! Almost forgot the audio... its virtually non-existent & just has some very basic, cheap sound files.

Pros:
-Tons of fun if you get some buddies to play with you
-Building mechanics are easy to use and fairly easy if you've played games like Rust.
-The Ranching is easy to pick up and get busy fast if you don't pay attention to your animals.
-Since I bought the game devs have made updates regularly and listen to feedback.

Cons:
-Vehicle physics make driving a pain at first.
-Not very many side quests so it gets repetitive once you have an established ranch.
-Chopping trees doesn't give enough wood IMO.
-Shooting mechanics are a little weird but you don't need them all to often anyway.

Overall if you're looking for a game to play with your friends while relaxing and drinking some beers, this is a 12/10 game for about a couple weeks or so at a time (like that minecraft urge you get once a year)

As someone who's not typically a fan of the farming sim outside of the occasional exception (i.e. Stardew Valley and a brief stint with Rune Factory) I went into this game thinking I wouldn't really enjoy it. I had tried my hand at Farming Sim 22 after watching a LGIO video about it, but I found it a bit too farmy for my liking. That said, my wife thought this game might be a fun experience for the both of us, so I decided to give it a whirl. After a few hours I can honestly say I really enjoy it! My wife and I have been having a lot of fun with the game thus far, and as the game is in Early Access I can only assume it will (hopefully) get better as updates roll out.

PROS:

- Large Open Sandbox-style farmland to build on to your liking.
- Fun base/farm building mechanics akin to ARK?Valhiem?similar
- Decent prefab building options for players not interested in custom base building
- BEEKEEPING!

CONS:
- Very little direction after the tutorial
- Very basic quest system that can be exploited for easy money
- Janky physics at times resulting in frustrating, allbeit funny item placements
- far too easy to pick up placed tools, leading to the player replacing and restarting production.

I'm sure I'll have more to love/hate as we play more of the game, but most of my gripes could be fixed with a patch in the future. All in all really loving this experience and enjoying the casual gaming time with my wife.

The game is fun, makes you think outside the box. You have many options to choose from on how you want to make money, I would suggest to stay away from the chicken at first and just focus on the pigs. But also keep in mind that the pigs can get out of hand, I speak from experience on this. I had started out with only 4 pigs and then in no time I am up to about 78 of them. They make good money, but make sure you buy the auto grinder and sausage maker and lots of Ice-chests. Also do not put your water or feeders in the fence as the pigs or any other animals will climb them and they will escape from the fenced area, and that is a pain to deal with. 

I have spent so much time on this game so far, and some of it's been great learning lessons and some not so great but that is part of the game. Just stay focused and understand that this is still in a process and can not wait to see what else is in store. 

FYI, if there is help that is needed please reach out, I have currently about 60 plus hours on this game and still building and growing.

As a fan of survival games, I'm really enjoying my time with this one. Being an early release, I understand there's still work to be done, but I believe it has the potential to improve significantly. Here are some specific suggestions for future updates:

Sound Effects: The game could benefit from more sound effects, especially for dialogue.
Player Needs and Health: Introducing player needs and the risk of death would add depth to the survival experience.
Economic Options: More ways to make money would enhance the gameplay and add variety.
Radio Fix.
Inventory Improvements: Allowing players to carry more items, like logs and animal products, would improve resource management.
Melee Weapons: Adding melee weapons could diversify combat strategies.
Interactive Objects: The ability to interact with objects while holding a gun would enhance realism.
I hope these suggestions will be prioritized in future updates, as I find them crucial for the game's development. Looking forward to seeing the game evolve and improve over time!

I liked it. I was good at it. And, I was really... I was alive.

The building/blueprint system is annoying. If you misplace a blueprint your only option is to build whatever you place and then tear it down. There's no option to cancel a build, which makes setting up fences annoying, even if you know the correct angles (hint, it's 5 degrees for every snap angle)

The mouse smoothing is super annoying, as well. The devs have come out and said in the Steam forums they're unable to fix it without redoing the entire movement system. 

Vehicles have very little traction so no matter where you're driving or what you're driving on (pavement, mud, dirt, etc) you'll be sliding around like the car is on ice. 

I'd refund it, but I'm already over the 2 hour limit.

Way too many technical issues. When you unhitch farming equipment, it can roll into a location where you cannot get it hitched again. the steering is damn near impossible and very annoying. When you try to accelerate, it'll either go full throttle or be stuck. You cannot gently ease into hitching equipment. Forget about turning, same thing—either 180 or nothing. Also, the fences WILL NOT MATCH UP! No matter how hard you try to do make a full connection, it will not end up at the same location. YOU WILL HAVE A GAP. You can't remove roofs unless you are somehow in an elevated location, which is never. The list goes on and on when it comes to frustrations. :(. oh, and there's no quests so you literally have to figure things out through trial and error which is double difficult when you have all these glitches. I wouldn't mind it, if it actually worked.

2.5 out of 5 stars
Look, I REALLY wanna love this game! I really do! It has so much potential to be better than farm simulator, but I can't. There's too many things that need fixed, or changed. I've only got 15 hours on record, but, I think that's enough time to make a semi accurate review. For starters, the driving needs a complete overhaul, especially for keyboard users. The fact the vehicles are almost "brake locked" until you build up a high rpm, makes its almost impossible to accurately hook up to a trailer, or similar equipment. I just spent almost 10 minutes trying to hook onto a trailer I just bought! I wasn't able to do it, which is when i decided to save, quit, and come here to review. Secondly, the trailer handling UI is terrible! If you have to use brakes on your vehicle while moving, even in my full sized pickup and the small trailer, the trailer shoots to the side and almost always spins me out. Not to mention, when driving through the woods, your vehicle is like a heat seeking missile to any rock, tree, or deer in the area, always stopping you dead in your tracks. Your vehicle flips way too easy. If you get it pinned between 2 things or you land on a guardrail? Have fun getting it off!!! You can flip your vehicle, but, it just sends your vehicle straight up then back down in the same spot! That needs to be fixed. When it rains, it should fill any water buckets, troughs, and gardens/fields but it doesn't. Make the targeting with guns more fluid. It's too jumpy and hard to aim accurately. Even when changing view, your character doesn't look down the sights, they look to the side of the gun. You have no way of knowing where you're shooting. One of the most important things in my opinion, is resource re-spawn. The trees should grow back after a certain period of time. I'm on day 18 in game and the trees I cut down on day one, still haven't come back. I believe they should if you haven't built anything there. That's all i can think of for now. If any, or all, of those things happen, my rating will go up accordingly.
Interesting simulation game, worth to play !

*Original review below*
Now we finally got the long awaited 1.0 release with the big switch to Unreal Engine 5, and i still sit with the feeling that this game could be so much more. It could be that I hyped up the 1.0 in my head too much and was therefore unreasonably dissapointed that it looked exactly the same as it did when I last played it. The only upgraded visuals i noticed were the sunrays at dawn.
The upside is that the performance is noticably better, at least when it comes to number of animals on the farm. If you dare to try farming the game slows right down when you go to harvest. 
When it comes to farming it feels like it's just tacked on and not really thought out enough. It's really annoying to cultivate, plant and harvest with the vehicle physics being what they are, wheat is really not worth it to grow as feed for your animals, since when you get to the point where you have granaries on your farm then money is not really an obstacle anymore. The sunflowers look nice so I just plant them and let them stay there, not sure if they wilt after a time or not and if the do I'm not replanting.
The world still feels kind of empty, there are at least random cars and campers on the road now, but the game is still completely dead silent, there is no ambient sound unless it rains. And right now the radio is broken but that is a known issue and will hopefully be taken care of.

Like I stated in my original review below playing multiplayer really helps out with the pacing in the day, Playing this time around with my gf we could pretty quickly grow our farm to the point where we had everything and more money than we knew what to do with. It would happen fairly often that her game just shut down so there is obviously still kinks to work out in the multiplayer.
What the game lacks now is replayability, I want the ability to decorate my farm, especially I want paths and roads to layout my farm better. 

That was a lot of negativity, and while i keep my Thumbs Down, I want to press the fact that the devs are very much active, the game will improve and I will definitely come back to it again after a while!
===========================Old review=========================================
All in all I really like this game and once the kinks are worked out I can see myself sinking many more hours in it, but in it's current state I cannot recommend it, I would however watch out for updates, because there is a lot of potential and the devs do seem to listen to the community!(the snow was a mistake)!

cons :
- The optimization is pretty bad, if you have 10+ animals there is quite a bit of lag.
- The vehicles handle bad, and they really like to flip over, which can be quite amusing, but ultimatley annoying.
- The world is empty, there are a few building spread around the map, but they are empty and dead. In a hunting cabin in the mountain there's a man sitting with two guns, I assume in an update he will say something or be useful for something?
- There is very little to no sound
-Getting water from the well is really really annoying, there is a perfectly good sink in the house, why can't we use that?
- You can build your own house, which is cool, but there is no furniture so there isn't much point in building it
- The barn only has one big door and you can't build a wide one so if you put stalls in them it becomes very cramped

pros:

- The animals are well made, and the babies are very cute!
- The pacing of the day is good, I only played miltiplayer though and I can see there being to little time in the day when you have to do everything yourself.
- Character customization is good and have a lot of options
- You can color your cars pretty much any color you want

While this game has come a long way since its release and from when i first played there are still some things that i believe still need work. Still the cars. Attempting to accelerate or back up at a slow enough speed to hitch a trailer is extremely annoying as no matter how gently or briefly i push the excel/reverse i still go from 0 to 10 resulting in going to far forward or backwards ending up usually running over the hitch of the trailer and pushing it out of alignment. Next are the livestock, it would be fantastic if when i open the door or gate to an enclosure that all livestock within didnt B line straight for the exit. The goats... well i dont know if i just dont have a high enough system to see the full graphics or if infact the goats are mildly demonic with only the white space where there eyes should be....they have no Iris or even a pupil. Just an even more blank look in their "eyes" then their usual blank look. And lastly it would be nice to know the genders of each animal by their names, the little symbol, mainly for unmatured offspring that way one could seperate the males from females before they mature and breeding gets out of hand while youre away on a mission or tending other things. I know i said the last thing was last but this one is lol. The logs!! when sanding them down they are plenty wide enough that in theory one could get 4 out of each log. Its easy to lose interest in the game when so much of it is spent cutting down trees and sanding these huge logs to get only 2 thin planks per one. i do hope that with the animal/ pets we get in the future they are useful, such as if you take it out hunting with you it alerts of nearby predators or perhaps can be trained to herd the livestock or guard the land from wandering predators. Also being able to put down straw or bedding in barns would feel more realistic and immersive. Cant wait to see what comes next. I do enjoy this game when im not focused on logging. The building and blueprint layouts are really cool and i do like that i can place down the silhouette before building, makes it easier to decide locations and designs of buildings. Has loads and loads of potential and i hope it keeps going in the direction it is.

TREES... i HATE the fact that we cant go anywhere to chop them down anymore.

IDEAS THAT COULD BE ADDED TO THE GAME;
i would suggest allowing us to get licenses so we can chop trees anywhere, allow trees to re spawn/regrow back, allow us to plant normal trees & start and orchard! All those would surely make a lot of people happy.

As for adding licenses, this can be applied for killing deer/bears/wolves or even the idea of fishing in the game. 

Gravel to make paths or drive ways. 

WAY MORE FURNITURE. we have the ability to build a home or shed but not a lot of furniture to put in our buildings making them less homey & sad. 

Character customization... Maybe more hair options and longer hair for females? More clothes as well.

I dont mind the idea of eating & drinking, going to the bathroom & sleeping to maintain your character. It would give the houses more of a reason to be used and make the game more real. 

i have so many more ideas but idk if these comments even get read by the creators. I like this game so much and im girly af but the idea of marriage & having a partner who helps you farm would be interesting.

I wish I could give this game a positive review - it has so much potential - but given the state of the game as it "exits" Early Access, I simply cannot. The game feels incredibly incomplete. The building and decorating tools are *extremely* limited and the landscaping tools (planting trees/shrubs, placing paths) are non-existent. The lack of angle tools for fence-building leads to major frustration. Manually stacking dozens of items (which needs to be done constantly) is a tedious chore because there is no snapping. There is no progression path, there are no money sinks, there is nothing to spend your money on once you have everything up and running, the economy is grossly out of balance. You cannot pause the game, even in single-player. The vehicle handling is awful and making even slight steering adjustments can send you spinning out of control. The game doesn't save the state of the lights, so every time you load the game up you have to go around and manually turn on each individual light. The farming is pointless because you can just refill your feed silos with a single click and the return on investment for the farming equipment is poor. The horses are pointless, because you can't breed them and training them does not yield enough money to be worth the time that it takes. 

Honestly, I could go on for quite a while, but these issues already far exceed what should be able to be said about a game that has "exited" Early Access. The devs say that more changes are coming, but all I've really heard about is adding the ability to keep cats and dogs as pets, which I think is a significantly lower priority than these very basic game components that are sadly missing. I hope things get better in the future.

Ranch Simulator is a game that lets you build, farm, hunt and trade in a large open-world environment. You can play solo or with friends in co-op mode.

Pros:

- The game offers a lot of freedom and customization for your ranch. You can choose what animals to raise, what crops to grow, what vehicles to buy and what buildings to renovate or construct.
- The game has realistic graphics and physics, as well as dynamic weather and seasons. The animals have different behaviors and needs, and the environment is full of wildlife and resources.
- The game has a variety of activities and challenges to keep you engaged. You can hunt deer and bears, fish in the lake, trade with other ranchers, explore the map and discover secrets, and more.
- The game has a friendly and active community, as well as regular updates and patches from the developers. The game also supports mods and Steam Workshop, allowing you to customize your experience further.

Cons:

- The game is still in early access and has some bugs and glitches that need to be fixed. Some players have reported issues with the multiplayer mode, the animal AI, the vehicle controls, and the performance optimization.
- The game can be repetitive and grindy at times, especially in the early stages. You may have to do a lot of chores and tasks to earn money and resources, and some of them can be tedious and time-consuming.
- The game can be challenging and unforgiving, especially for beginners. You may have to deal with harsh weather, predators, diseases, accidents, and other threats that can harm you and your animals. You may also have to learn a lot of mechanics and systems by trial and error, as the game does not have a comprehensive tutorial or guide.

Overall, Ranch Simulator is a fun and immersive game that lets you live out your ranching dreams. It has a lot of potential and room for improvement, and it is suitable for fans of simulation and sandbox games. If you are looking for a relaxing and realistic game that lets you create your own ranch, you may want to give Ranch Simulator a try.

Ranch Simulator - A Budget Buy for Casual Rural Sim

Rating: ⭐⭐✩✩✩ (2/5)

Ranch Simulator presents a mix of building, farming, and hunting activities, but its overall execution leaves much to be desired. For those intrigued by the concept but wary of its shortcomings, it's advisable to consider this title only during a significant sale.

The building mechanics offer a basic foundation for constructing your ranch, but the lack of depth and limited options may leave players wanting more from this aspect of the game. While it provides some initial enjoyment, it fails to evolve into a truly engaging experience.

Farming in Ranch Simulator is straightforward but lacks the complexity and variety found in more established simulation titles. The limited range of crops and basic agricultural features may appeal to casual players but might not satisfy those seeking a more immersive farming experience.

The inclusion of hunting adds variety, allowing players to explore the wilderness and track wildlife. However, the hunting mechanics lack the depth seen in dedicated hunting games, and the repetitive nature of these activities may not hold the interest of all players.

Graphically, Ranch Simulator falls short of delivering a visually striking experience. The rural landscapes lack the polish and detail seen in more refined simulation games, contributing to the overall feeling of mediocrity.

Considering the game's limitations, it would be prudent to wait for a sale if you're interested in trying Ranch Simulator. While it may provide some casual enjoyment, the lack of depth and innovation makes it difficult to justify a full-price purchase. With an emphasis on budget considerations, Ranch Simulator earns a modest 2 out of 5.

Ranch Simulator is a simulation game that allows players to experience the challenges and rewards of running their own ranch. The game typically features open-world gameplay, where players can engage in activities such as farming, animal husbandry, and managing their ranch infrastructure.

One notable aspect of Ranch Simulator is its emphasis on realism. Players often have to tackle tasks like planting and harvesting crops, taking care of livestock, and maintaining their property. The game's graphics and attention to detail contribute to a visually immersive experience.

I wish I could recommend this game but...

You can craft and buy everything day 1. You only need money.
So the game is just about finding the way to get money efficiently and unfortunately, the best way to make money is to construct two derricks and get a passive income of 1K per day. (For instance if you hunt all any animal on the map which takes a significant amount of time, consumes bullet and gas for the car), you get around 200 or 300$ a day. 

DO NOT TRY TO PLANT TOMATOES. 
You basically handpick tomatoes one by one and you can imagine how much you sell a tomato...

There is no goal except making money to buy things that help make more money (not all the time tho)
And in the end, the money is only used in order to buy horses but there is nothing you can do with them, except try to train them and make a profit. Spoiler alert, read a guide cos the system is broken. 

To train a horse, you need to run in a circle and jump over obstacles.
If your horse is too slow, then it is not possible. High end horses are too fast so you can't turn enough to jump properly.


You can build a barn, did not find any use for it. 
You can build a house, did not find any use for it. 

You basically just build things to make your ranch look like a ranch but any building is entirely useless which is quite unfortunate. 
Ho and be prepared to spend hours in front of the saw to make planks.

I wish the devs put a little more effort into the game and its progress curve as after a couple of hours, it simply feels like you already saw everything and there is no point in keep playing the game.
Definitely a super slow burn as far as feature updates. Probably mostly intended as a quick buck asset flip, but it has a fun little gameplay loop and can be great fun with a buddy or two.

I've enjoyed Ranch Sim for some time now. Its very fun to play with friends for a while. If youre just starting out I would suggest taking out a loan and starting a pig farm, pigs are cheap, but they will be able to give you tons of money in a short period of time. Let them breed like crazy and sell the larger ones. In no time youll have enough money to do whatever you want. To increase profit turn the pigs into sausage, or salami if you cure it. All of my farms started with pigs, they are just easy and very profitable.

The time just goes by!

I got this at about 60% off, and this game is uhhhh... interesting?

The things I like. I like the gameplay, what you can do for your little farm, and the various ways to get money and just have fun. You can raise livesstock, grow crops, chop trees, hunt wild animals, keeping bees, make animal-based products, even drilling for oil! This is definitely the number one reason to get this game, and I've noticed that it hasn't changed much for a year from earlier Steam guides. 
It all feels extremely chill, with lots of save points across the maps, and you can easily change the daylight cycle to make days longer or shorter. Some of the controls and "feel" might be off, but I was used to them after about 5 hours into the game. A lot more explanation to the players would be nice, especially the prices of produce and what to expect. Hemorrhaging money for lack of knowledge is not fun.

The things I don't like: plenty. The Unreal Engine the game relies on does three things, one is overheat my laptop extremely easily, and two is that it's very poorly optimized. I have a Geforce GTX 1650 Ti, and I have to turn it down to the lowest settings just to play the game. I know it's below the recommended specs, but not everybody has time and money for a high end graphics card, especially when my CPU and RAM goes above and beyond that.
The third is that the actual engine itself doesn't even run well, because I just spent about 10 minutes dealing with my buggy UTV that flies, glitches out, and does all sorts of things a motor engine should not do. Even the "roll over" feature just doesn't fix it. It's an example of just a lot of bugs with this game that can get really annoying at times, and I hope the devs fix them in time.

Yet, I recommend it because it's just fun. I sank 15 hours into the game, and want to play yet more. I can't wait to revisit my money-making bees and oil drills, because the core gameplay is that good! So, get this game if your hardware supports it, and I think it'll be fun with friends because that's what I nominated it for in the Steam Awards.

Hi there, o/ 

First, thank you and congrats on the game, I love it!  

Great depth ranching life, lovely landscapes.

I would like to leave my feedback on some things that I think would make the game even greater if you are interested.  

Lovely in-game houses, but this game makes you want to build your own, that's why I've customised a whole house, but there is not enough furniture to make it feel like a home.  Could it be possible to add some more furniture, for example, kitchen, chairs, double bed and a bathroom?

Also, thinking about who plays solo, would it be possible to give us the option to hire employees or have children, to help with the work around the farm? There's just so much to do (not complaining).  

Another thing that playing for so many hours I noticed would increase the quality of the game play, an inventory, or be possible to carry anything inside the coolers lol. That would come so handy for building, carrying the planks, paint etc...  

One more suggestion. I miss physiological needs, such as hunger, thirst or dirtiness. 

Talking about dirt, would be lovely if where the pigs are there will be mud (or is it shit?!) :D Imagine.... <3

Another thing that would be so helpful, animal enclosure (fence) that is ready in square and round shape, that could be increased as we wish. That would save so much time, especially because I find it difficult to work with the fence we have right now. 

I have many more suggestions, like wardrobe change in-game. But I know it might be too much xD 

Anyways, finally, what about an auto save? 

I recommend this game, it's so good. Definitely has so much more potential.

Picked this up on a whim, and I was not disappointed.  Milk cows and goats, hunt wild animals, make cheese and sausage, collect eggs and honey, and much more.  While it is still in development, the game is very playable, and lots of fun.  I particularly love starting a ranch with my friends, and work together to build our homestead.  Even some fun little quests hidden easter eggs to find!

A little bit farm simulator little bit quest finding and above all animal husbandry with productive processing power to fuel your ever changing ranch to suit your every need, from Bee keeping to cattle ranching to pig farming all the way into hunting and gathering meats wild animals (Deer, wolf & bear). With most of the game giving you free reign to do as you see fit this game welcomes everyone with instructive options to build from. 

Overall the game is great and there is plenty more to explore in this ever changing game.

Good game but still feels incomplete, after a bit caring it can shine like a star on the Steam main page. I listed some of the problems/suggestions of/for the game down below:
1-FPS problem makes the game insufferable, especially when you build a large farm with a lot of animals.
2-They should add more npc for more different quests and interaction.
3-On the multiplayer side pings on the map should be seen by everyone to communicate easier.
4-After you reach some point you feel pointless and bored of the game, at least thats how i felt like. Maybe new quests, animals, crops can fix this issue. Also planting crops don't pay the effort you give they sell to market too cheap.
5-Trees needs to regrow after you chop them, or when you left the log at least.
6-The river at the map is unusable, you can't even get close to it. Maybe they can bring fishing system, boats and a fisherman as a new npc to sell the fishes. 
7-Map feels a bit small after a while maybe they can add another town. When you reach the end of the map a tunnel leads you to a new town with new farm, new npc and new biome. It can have different weather conditions, crops, animals also.
8-It definitely needs a better ui asap, this ui feels so primitive. For example to check your budget you need to go the escape menu. It should be seen on the main game screen. Also they should add health bar.
9-Guns' mechanic is horrific, They need a better ADS and hipfire system.
10-The game needs either autosave system or a save system when you buy/sell something. It feels too bad when you see all the things you made for hours didn't saved.
All in all i still have good time while playing it with my friends, thumbs up.

This game WAS a fun, if janky to play, ranch / building sim. The update to the new engine removed all the goodwill I had by making it pretty but nauseating to play.

The awkward first person view that had some issues when picking up / placing items when carrying something has become a serious chore because the new pretty boxes make it harder to see around. Looking around is slow and clunky, and for some reason you can't aim down the sites of the rifle in first person, so you have to switch to third for an aim indicator. This was funny before, now it's just annoying.

Driving in 3rd person feels like you are not in control of the camera. When (when, not if) you flip your UTV, the camera goes into some weird direction. All the NCP cars look like they have hydraulics (bouncing up and down the roads), and your own car feels that way over just about any terrain.

The new town looks cool and has a lot of potential, but right now is empty. They also removed the ability to take multiple quests from one NPC, which is annoying.

I like the combinations and food crafting; it's easy to get into a nice daily rhythm (wake up, milk goats, milk cows, make cheese, etc.) with enough styles / ease of making money that you can probably find something you enjoy doing. I like the variety of vehicles; there is a surprising amount of non-farming vehicles for a farm / ranch game.

The music was pretty great, if strange. Of course, the update broke the radio, so there's that.

Hints for new players: Buy a lot of coolers (you can put almost anything in them) and several pans. Trailers are great for logging (if you put the tailgate down, the UTV works in the early game). Honey / bees are good for early game cash. Animals will try to escape pens and barns so you might want an "airlock" to keep them from getting out. Pigs multiply like rabbits. Go to the settings and change the day length to longer, otherwise you end up spending early game sleeping more than doing anything else.

I really hope to get back to it and give it a recommend, but the new update makes me really dislike it right now.
Yes its fun with friends but some things are annoying, we said it felt like a strawberry planting sim. Tuck forever.

This game isn't great.  I bought this during early access and kept hopping back in when they'd put out an update.  I kept waiting to see it evolve, but I never felt like it did.  The upgrade from UE4 to UE5 DID make it look prettier and run better (great decision). 

There's maybe 15-20 hours of content if you take your time. And that's playing it solo.  I actually expect you would spend much less time if you played with friends because it's honestly so limited in what you CAN do.  There are basically 2 types of farming: container and tractor.  Nothing in between. 

I spent most of my time raising pigs and goats.  Once I built the premium chicken coop the chickens were just... there.  Eggs and chicken sausage were a nice little supplement I checked every few days.  

I just described about 70% of the gameplay.  In two paragraphs.  You can hunt deer, bears, and wolves.  You can do a few quests for a handful of the folks around town.  MOST of your "interactions" with the world is through computer terminals with an NPC standing nearby staring past you. It ends up feeling pretty flat and dead as a world. 

And for me, the fact that single player doesn't allow me to pause... it grates on me because it's such a basic feature that is just ignored. When I went looking I found where it was said "well, the game was meant as co-op and you can't pause in co-op."  Like that is the only way people SHOULD play their game.  

I wanted to like this game so much.  But honestly, there is neither lore to keep me interested or enough variety in game play to keep me coming back.

One of the aspects that needs to be improved is the game’s economy system. The prices of animals, crops, and items seem to be arbitrary and unrealistic. There is no clear logic behind these numbers, and they make the game feel unbalanced and unfair. It would be better if the game had a more realistic and dynamic economy system. 
  Another issue that I encountered is the vehicle handling. They feel too heavy and sluggish after mounting something in the front or back. 
  Also building system is not very user-friendly or intuitive. It is hard to build a more regular shape when building a fence, it would be much better to snap the fence posts to a grid or align them to a straight line. Manually adjust the angle and the position of each post, which is tedious and frustrating. I wish the game had a smarter and easier building system.
  Despite these flaws, this game still has a lot of potential and charm. However, it is important to recognize that the game is still in development and the features may change in the future. There may not be a lot of playable content at the moment, so it is best to wait for an update before getting into the game.  I hope the developers will continue to work on the game and make it better and more enjoyable.

After over 100 hours into the game, this is my takeaway:
• Freedom of Play Style: You can be a profitable ranch regardless of the type of ranching you want to do (pigs, dairy, garden/crops), although time until profitability will differ between them.
• Freedom of Building: You can design your ranch however you see fit using prefabs and blueprints. Has a decent selection to choose from. 
• Interactions: The interactions between player/animal or player/environment like collecting your own eggs, capturing your own wild bees, and milking your own dairy animals are one of my favorite aspects in this game. 
• Scenery: While it doesn’t live up to the RDR2 vibe, the rural mountain landscape is beautiful in its own way. I miss the deciduous trees though from the original UE4 map. 

Cons:
• Limited Progression: Only 2 “tiers” of progression - beginner equipment vs updated equipment (no actual automation). While this will not really affect the imaginative builders, for those of us looking for a challenge or progression-led ranching game, this doesn’t quite scratch that itch at the moment. Hopefully future updates will remedy this. 
• No Server Hosting: Max of 4 players in co-op, no permanent server ids or server renting/hosting for additional players. 
• Wonky Animal Models: I was hoping they would be polished up before the actual release. Pretty sure they are free downloads. Chickens are decent though with the recent rework. 
• Too Easy: Easy money (pigs or oil), few challenges, and very few ways to spend and/or lose money. 
• Grind Heavy: Due to a lack of automation, most systems (even the updated ones) are very grind heavy, especially any meat or wood production.  
• Quick Gameplay: If you’re only looking to run a profitable ranch, it takes about 2-3 hours at most with minimal infrastructure and input. 
• Oil Rigs: The addition of oil drilling doesn’t make too much sense to me, as it is a cheaper and more efficient way to get money than anything else in game. No point in farming or raising animals if you go that route.

TLDR: Despite the con list, Ranch Simulator is worth it for those that enjoy interactive farming/ranching games. I wouldn’t say it’s worth $25 yet until there is more content, progression, and overall bug fixing BUT it’s definitely something I’d recommend trying if it goes on sale. :)

We both got good fps 30-60+ in UE4 before 1.0. It is literally unplayable in 1.0 in UE5. They put the good old blue filter over the whole game making it look like a FPS from the late 2000's early 2010's, and now has frame rates like other "simulators" that are just demos.


They had no real reason to rush everything to UE5, and if you are going to play this, play it on the latest version before 1.0 through the beta options in your game properties. It's truly sad, this game had so much potential and a solid bases, but they decided to rush 1.0 and switch to an engine they had no idea how to use.
