[b] Ranch Simulator [/b] is a game that has shown [u] great potential and improvement [/u] since it came out of beta a few months ago. However, there are still a few main problems that need to be addressed.

Firstly, the game [u] still has some bugs [/u] that can be quite frustrating at times. These range from minor glitches like items disappearing, to major issues such as the game crashing unexpectedly. While the developers have been actively releasing updates to fix these bugs, it's still a point of concern for players.

Another problem is the presence of [u] flying vehicles [/u] , which can sometimes disrupt the immersion of the game. Seeing cars flying through the air certainly breaks the realism that the game aims to provide. It would be great if the developers could find a solution to this issue in future updates.

Lastly, there is the peculiar occurrence of [u] animals made of bricks [/u] . While it's unclear why this happens, it can be quite comical to see bears , wolfs or dears made entirely out of bricks roaming around the ranch. This might seem like a minor issue, but it does detract from the overall experience of the game.

Despite these problems, there are some positive aspects that make the game enjoyable. The potential for fun gameplay with friends is a major highlight. The game allows you to team up with your friends and work together to manage a ranch, which can lead to hilarious and memorable moments.

Additionally, the sales system in the game is well-implemented. You can raise animals, grow crops, and gather resources to sell and earn money. This adds a layer of strategy and economic management that keeps the gameplay engaging.

In conclusion, despite the bugs, flying vehicles, and animals made of bricks, Ranch Simulator is a game that is recommended to all lovers of this type of simulator. With its potential for fun multiplayer gameplay and a well-implemented sales system, it promises an enjoyable ranch management experience. [u] As the developers continue to update and improve the game, it has the potential to become an even better simulation game in the future. [/u]

It is silly to pretend that this game is done, I am not even sure it is ready for early access. I am guessing that the devs just wanted to get it out and move on to something else. I do not expect that they are going to spend much time fixing this. There are some MAJOR problems with core functions of this game. I have been a homesteader (raise goats and chickens and grow some crops) for 12 years, grew up with a farmer grandpa, ride an ATV almost everyday, a UTV frequently, and haul a myriad of trailers for work; it seems like the dev of this game has never been on a farm, never driven off road, never pulled a trailer, and never played another modern game. Vs.

At the time of this writing I only have 2.5 hours of time, so bear that in mind. 
If I was told I can only play one more game, and when I was done I would die, I would choose Ranch Simulator. It may have only been hours, but it felt like forever. 
I know everyone talks about the driving, and it DOES need a lot of work, but the building and demolition... That's where things fall apart. 
First, to finish the tutorial, you are instructed to tear down the old house. To do this, you have to begin on the roof, and remove every block before moving down.
Every. 
Single. 
Block. 
Windows have to be removed from their frames before the wall can be demoed. Doors too. The handrails have to be taken off the balcony separate from removing the floor.  Did you miss a piece of debris on the floor? Too bad, because you can't remove a block of floor until the entire floor is 100% empty.  
The building is almost as tedious, but at least it's broken up by long stretches of harvesting resources. You'll chop down trees for 3 logs, that you saw down to 2 boards a log. You'll need 6 boards per foundation. 
And remember, you have no inventory. You can carry a single item at a time. Need 3 logs? You're making 3 trips. Yes, you have an ATV, and there are trailers to buy that would make it take fewer trips... Honestly though, other reviewers have covered exactly how bad the driving is. It doesn't make it any easier, it just takes fewer trips.
Most of the 2.5 hours of time I've spent playing this game was in the tutorial, and I can't say I'm looking forward to spending any more time Simulating a Ranch. The game has potential, but the mechanics all seem to need work. 
There's also player hosted multiplayer, and much like everything else, it needs work.
 
I really wish steam had a "Meh" button.  I can't recommend this game as it is, but maybe someday.

Fun, mindless game for the most part. You can build an ever expanding, customized farm with things to do to keep it running. The graphics are great and the weather effects add a nice, moody ambiance.

There are issues. The biggest ones are polish of basic game mechanics. Driving is very poor. The physics do not make sense and it's almost as if the vehicles are driving on ice with no traction. The trailers swing in a fashion that's quite ridiculous. If you run into deer, they are stronger than the most expensive pickup trucks. If you hit a deer, your truck will come to an abrupt halt, and the deer will continue eating off the ground and go about their business. There are also odd clipping bugs in the game where your vehicle will inexplicably get stuck on an invisible object. You cannot turn venison into jerky or sausage. 

The relative cost of things is also a bit unusual which leads to an overall imbalanced game in terms of progression. 

When building things like fences and buildings, there is no easy way to align structures without having to place an object, tear down the mock-up, and start over. 

You cannot build sheds even though the game starts off with a shed. 

The hunting isn't actually hunting. A single handgun shot to a doe, two for a buck. 4 for a bear. There's no actual stalking or need to be quiet or approach animals slowly. They just run around in erratic circles. If they run away, they invariably turn around right back toward you.

I think there are a lot of small improvements with basic game functionality that would make this such a better experience overall. That said, as it stands now, it's worth purchasing. It is fun, just with many annoying quirks.

So, I got this over a year and half after it entered EA. I'd been unsure if I wanted to dive in because it seemed incomplete. But then there was a sale and it seemed like there was enough to do to try it out. 

It was/is fairly simplistic. You can raise chickens, pigs, cows, and goats. You have to build pens and can build some structures but the offering is simplistic. They have fully furnished farmhouses you can "build" (which consists of delivering wood planks you can cut and other materials you have to buy). There's a small selection of cars of which most are not really worth grabbing with low, low prices (I'd love to buy a pick up for $2k).

As EA progressed, they added some interesting things (greenhouses and small crops) and basic farming (definitely will not compete against Farming Simulator). Then they decided they needed to upgrade the engine from UE4 to UE5. They told us it would take a lot of time but it would be worth it. They also threw in the idea of adding...oil wells you could make money off of?!

Six months or so later, they released that UE5 release into an unstable branch. Some visuals were updated but it still looked...average. But now, we had oil rigs to make passive income from!

Meanwhile, the upgrade to UE5 introduced a new physics engine and a bunch of weird issues (cars feel like they're running on ice, many things will go flying, cars can drive up trees). Everything else was the same (including bugs from the previous version like the fact that eggs laid by chickens that were fertile would "forget" they were fertile when you reloaded your game.

But the weirdest thing was that they announced they were going to exit EA and go gold...with bugs and all. They promised more updates but instead of fixing glaring issues which make the game LESS playable than it was under UE4, they want to give us pets.

This game really should be still in EA or treated like a beta game release. It's just not worth $25 in its current state. There's stuff to do but it's grindy and it's more because you just want to set up your ranch than it is about completing an objective. Instead of the above (odd) decisions with recent and future updates, they could do a quick bug pass to fix the outstanding issues and satisfy all of us who helped fund them through EA while ensuring new players won't have as weird an experience. Instead, they're trying to get pets to work in-game. 

I would steer clear until they sort out those issues or else catch game on sale for $10 or less.
The optimization sucks, I get 20-30 fps at the worst settings. If the optimization problem is solved it will be a truly perfect game.

Hello,

I've had my eye on this game for some time and have managed to just miss the sale prices... until this week. After playing for a couple days I can see why there are such mixed reviews of this game. It has a truly casual feel but lacks a lot of refinement.

 PROS:
- Casual play style
- Diverse Livestock & Farming
- Building: preset structures or customize
- Learning curve isn't too steep

CONS:
- Vehicle physics is comical at best
- Market: prices aren't well thought out.
- Economy: prices are fixed and don't change
- Quests: there are some but barely a days play worth.

GAME NEEDS:
- Vehicle: Physics & Pricing reworked
- Objectives: Time based (daily, weekly, monthly...) orders to fill for rewards.
- Quality: poor to excellent crops & livestock with scaling values.
- Depth: There is nothing driving this game other than one's desire to play.
- Property: Defined lots & expansion options.
*I could go on and on with ideas on ways to make the game better but... in the end it's their vision.

I miss the days of a game being released to the public when it's finished and when Beta's were play tested for free. This game is clearly in beta and not worthy of retail sales. With that being said, I could justify maybe paying up to $5.00 (USD) or less. I can not recommend buying this beyond a cheap curiosity.

Making salami sausage is a traditional and time-honored process that requires careful attention to detail and food safety. Here's a basic recipe for making salami at home. Keep in mind that the process involves fermentation, which requires strict adherence to food safety guidelines.

Ingredients:

4 pounds (1.8 kg) pork shoulder, coarsely ground
1 pound (0.45 kg) pork fat, coarsely ground
1/4 cup red wine
2 tablespoons kosher salt
1 tablespoon sugar
2 teaspoons whole black peppercorns, crushed
2 teaspoons fennel seeds, crushed
2 teaspoons paprika
1/2 teaspoon garlic powder
1/2 teaspoon curing salt #2 (sodium nitrite)
Natural hog casings
Instructions:

Begin by mixing the coarsely ground pork shoulder and pork fat in a large bowl.
In a separate bowl, combine the red wine, kosher salt, sugar, crushed black peppercorns, crushed fennel seeds, paprika, garlic powder, and curing salt #2. Mix these ingredients thoroughly to create a spice blend.
Pour the spice blend over the meat and fat mixture. Use your hands to mix everything together thoroughly. Make sure the seasoning is evenly distributed throughout the meat.
Cover the bowl and let the mixture marinate in the refrigerator for 24 hours to allow the flavors to meld.
After marinating, prepare the casings by rinsing them thoroughly under cold running water. Soak them in cold water for at least 30 minutes to soften them.
Stuff the seasoned meat mixture into the casings, ensuring that there are no air pockets. Twist the sausages at regular intervals to form individual links.
Once the sausages are stuffed, tie off the ends with kitchen twine and prick any air bubbles with a sterilized needle.
Hang the sausages in a cool, dry place with good air circulation, ideally at around 55-60°F (13-16°C). Allow the sausages to ferment and dry for about 4-6 weeks, depending on the desired level of dryness.
Check the sausages periodically for any signs of spoilage, such as mold or off-putting odors. If you notice any signs of spoilage, discard the sausages immediately.
Once the sausages have reached the desired dryness, they can be stored in the refrigerator for up to several months. Slice and enjoy!
Note: Maintaining proper sanitation and food safety practices throughout the entire process is essential to prevent the growth of harmful bacteria. If you are unfamiliar with the fermentation and curing process, consider seeking guidance from an experienced butcher or charcuterie maker.

Played as a three man team for three days and basically finished the entire game. Got a couple of laughs from all the jank, but ultimately a fairly boring game. The thing that kills it for me is that it has no sense of humor about itself.

The fun things about the game were the pretty smooth progression and expansion. But as you expand, the terrible optimization makes the game run ungodly poorly. When the game runs poorly, some items can't be interacted with, the car physics go absolutely crazy, and the driving isn't any good even with the game running smoothly.

Just disappointing, but if you go in with the 1h = 1€ idea, it is tolerable enough.

Edit: The audio design is also probably the worst I've heard in a long time, if not ever. There's absolutely no ambient sound. You can switch on the radio in vehicles, but it does nothing since you can't listen to music in them. You can hear cars crashing across the map, but firing your revolver makes almost no sound.

Game concept is great, but it's just a janky mess.  Driving is horrible.  Walking and running has control issues, most of the time it feels like I'm just suggesting that my character should do something and he'll get back to me some time next week.  Even just turning your camera view to put something down is met with a weird movement from the character on a weird delay that throws off your point of aim to shoot or put something down.  Don't even try the combine, header will get hung up on a blade of grass.  

The visuals... at times it looks ok, but most of the time you are looking at low res textures that you would expect to see on a game from around 1994.  

There is nothing here worth 25 usd, it's a 8 usd early access title at best.

Nope. Refunded because of excessive motion sickness caused by ridiculous amount of head bob and movement inertia that cannot be disabled or reduced. This was discussed on the forums years ago by many people but the developers have ignored it. Also a janky building system makes it difficult to connect basic fence pieces together. Shame, it looks like there's a decent game in there.

Don't bother.

It still tags itself as Early Access in-game despite a supposed full release, but honestly it should still be in EA.

It nags you on every launch to sign into an Epic Games account and makes it a pain to dismiss.
This is Steam, not Epic. If you want to force a sign in for Epic, then release on Epic.

It took me two attempts to even get through character creation as every time I would confirm I was done, the UI would disappear and my character would soullessly stare back at me until I force closed the program.

Oof. Where to start with this one...

There's almost no audio in the game which makes it feel hollow.

Driving is BEYOND horrible.

Getting Multiplayer to work was a nightmare (took the majority of my 'play time' to be able to connect to my wife's game) and the integration with steam is quite bad.

Chopping trees is dumb. You press E, the entire tree falls over, press E again and it instantly turns into perfect logs. Then you chop it into planks. Chopping a single log into 2 planks takes longer than felling the entire tree. This in particular was an extreme disappointment to me, as most similar games have far more in-depth logging/forestry options.

Building is extremely basic for a SIM game, it feels more like an arcadey survival game (Grounded, Valheim, Etc), but without the functioning systems that make those fun. In Ranch Simulator, it's slow, boring, clunky. --- I do want to acknowledge that the end result can look good though.

The movement animations are so bad. When you jump, you flail around weirdly and your legs kick straight back. It looks weird. 

Opening the build book with the flash light on is like getting flashbanged IRL.

FOV Scaling makes some stuff impossible to read.

Shop menu/navigation is terrible. Things that should be in certain categories are absent. I.E. buying the chicken egg basket - this is only visible under 'all', and is not considered a 'tool' or 'farming item'.

The font for quests/completing shopping purchases does not fit the game at all...

For a simulation game, the systems are barebones (and even that doesn't go far enough  to describe how empty everything feels IMO), not engaging, boring, and plain. There's a gross lack of actual simulation to begin with. Everything is just Press E Simulator. Also, it is the opposite of immersive, which is a problem for a sim.

***No horses.*** - EDIT - I am incorrect here as per developer response.

Gunplay is bad. Reloading is unresponsive. Wasn't really expecting something in-depth like theHunter, but I was expecting more.

Most of the stuff in this game is done better in the Farming Simulator series, theHunter, or other similar sims.

I could go on about I encountered in this game rubbed me the wrong way, but I think I've described enough.

Edits - Softened some of the harsher language that resulted from being extremely disappointed, and focused in on review points. I play several sims that do each element far better and was hoping for some sort of incorporation of them all with fun gameplay elements. I simply feel let down by nearly all of the mechanics in game. They exist, but they're not fulfilling (in my opinion).

I would have loved to get lost in the game, particularly since co-op exists and I love these style of games with my wife, but unfortunately this one (in its current state) is not for us. And unfortunately I do not have confidence that every system will be reworked, so I will not be purchasing the game again.

They say "Don't say anything at all if you don't have anything nice to say." and I don't have anything nice to say about this game, sorry.

This game crashes and crashes OFTEN. With no auto-save feature, this is a MAJOR issue with the game. I've tried various fixes and none have seemed to work.

Additionally, the game lacks quite a few major features that you would think would just be an easy add to the game. For example, you rely heavily on wood (obviously), yet it limits you to only be allowed to cut the trees down on your property. To make matters worse, trees can't be planted and they don't auto-regenerate. This means once you finish off the trees on your property, your only option is to pay a crazy rate to get lumber from the store.

Other key features that it's lacking- There's no way to see your property boundaries. It's all a guessing game. The best way I've found around this is just to see which trees you can cut down and which trees aren't allowed. There's also no way to expand your ranch, no new plots of land to purchase. I'm hopeful though that this is something that will be added in later releases.

Hunting options are limited. You have only 3 animals to hunt- Deer, Wolf, and Bear. For a part of the game they hugely advertise, it's crazy how lacking the experience feels. You also have only two options for weapons- a revolver and a rifle. There's no difference in ammunition types, no difference in types of weapons... Just a revolver and a rifle.

The building isn't terrible. The worst part is that you can't move or edit items once they've been placed, so if, for example, you build a trough in a place or position that you don't want or like, your only option is to destroy the trough, lose half of your materials that you put into it, and move rebuild it where you would like. For a game that feels limited already on the available materials, this is a huge issue. 

Honestly, I feel like the game is passable for the price and probably would be a recommended from me were it not for the crashing and lack of auto-save. At this point I've put in 20 hours total, but after the total amount of work I've lost, I'm probably more around the 12 hour mark, which is VERY frustrating.

Developers: Add auto-save and I'll gladly change to recommended.

Original (as of Jan '23): Very buggy. I've fallen through the world multiple times while driving, game has crashed on my 3090 a number of times, and randomly got launched out of my truck and teleported to the corner of the map. There's also a point near the farm where driving a vehicle would instantly teleport me under the world and then crash my game regardless of settings.

- Lighting in this game makes no sense. A candle gives off light equivalent to super maxed out flood lights. 

- No clear indicators in the world of where your co-op people are without opening the map.

Gameplay gets stale quick. Combine that with all the bugs, I don't suggest this.

Update (as of Nov '23): Overall it looks better and plays smoother than it did, and I didn't get randomly teleported through the universe. That's great. The world is still essentially empty - there's the handful of store NPCs that are useless since everything's through the computer screen anyway, and that's it. There are rabbits, bears, and wolves as the "wild life", but there's only at most, 5 of each... in the whole map. The quests are short and basic. The gameplay loop here is largely focused on cut tree > get wood > make planks > build > repeat.

It's alright but severely lacking. For a game that supposedly came out of EA you'd expect something better.

The following are some of my observations & problems with the game:

- The town, buildings etc DO NOT have any lighting at all. When it's dark out, everywhere is completely dark. No street lights, no interior lights. The workers and townfolk are all sitting in complete darkness...

-Driving is horrible, it is no different than driving on legitimate ice all around. The NPC cars are super weird as well, as they will spawn nearby and jump on the road, drive very slowly.

-Character animations are incredibly bad and robotic. Your movements are stiff, the animations are janky. There is no fall damage and horrible physics. Cars don't get damaged or give damage when you hit something.

-Furnitures in built homes don't work or don't work as they should. The double bed doesn't allow another player to sleep together with you. You can't break these furnitures as well as it will also destroy the house...

-The map and town feel desolate. There is no thought given to their design and purpose, everything is just made with premade assets and slapped together. UI is horrible and far too simple, most often also broken.

-Worst of all, it doesn't let you play without making or linking Epic account.

Game is alright enough to play despite these flaws but they severely drop the enjoyment you could get. I hope and pray developers will take heed and continue to improve the game but as it is with most games, likely will never happen.

TLDR:
DO NOT BUY... Why because it says "1.01 Release" on their promotion and all but when you enter the game you release the game didn't take down the "Early Access: 1.01" in the top left corner of the screen. Mind you this might change with a patch but that's the LEAST of the issues.


DETAILED:
To explain why I say do not buy in detail, literally from simple systems like quest fulfilment, clipping, and goofy inconsistencies with mechanics. When you finish the tutorial you can see NPC with two quests, first one giving him 8 meat and the second one giving him a rabbit. The issue is that you can't drop off any meat until you talk to him about the second quest. 

Clipping in the context of cars, where you and other objects are fine but when you flip your car because the first one you get from the story/tutorial is horribly unstable for driving straight. Thus leading the car to be upside-down which you get out and hold 'r' to flip the car but if you are too close to a tree, the car climbs the tree by clipping its body/frame through it. This just shows they haven't tested ANY of this. Plus at this point there isn't a way to get the car back. No parking space or going to the car shop to recall the car from what I understand, maybe there is but there is a guide inside of the game warning you when your car gets flipped upside-down but nothing on recalling/respawning the car.

Even with in the tutorial, you need to break down the old house and for some odd reason they made the breaking down animation play with maybe half of the building. Why this is annoying is you go from literally running through and left clicking things to break them down but then you get stuck in animation for the same object/part of the house you just broke down...

Overall, I ask was any of this game tested? Its systems are terrible since they feel in Alpha stage, and I truly hope this game grows since its ideas are interesting. At this point though, I'd suggest anyone looking at this game to just play other games that scratch the itches from other games.

So after 27 hours between the Original Version and Unstable Branch I have to recommend this game. Alot of improvements came with the upgrade and Unstable Branch, has a much smoother feel overall. I will list the positives and negatives and my personal thoughts. 

*** POSITIVES ***
1. Very Relaxing and chill game.
2. The animals are thought out well, you actually have to care for them in order for them to become healthy.
3. Alot of fun and different ways to make money. 
4. Graphics with the Unreal 5 update are awesome. 
5. Crops are very thought out as well, takes time, and care to get the best healthy yield. 
6. Very stressfree, no hard or painful puzzles or quests. 
7. Allows you to actually run your own Ranch and interact on a personal level with the animals and land. 
8. Much better and more personal than farming simulator in my opinion.
9. Different Stores and Sell Points depending on the items you want or the items you are trying to sell. 


*** NEGATIVES ***
1. Vehicle Handling is absolutely horrible, every vehicle almost feels it is on ice skates. 
2. Small Trailer slides from side to side like its literally on ice and that causes you to loose control and wreck sometimes. 
3. All trailers have similar issues. 
4. Wild Animals act as though they have severe ADHD. Very predictable and spawn in generally the same areas. 
5. Map is very small
6. Tree cutting animations are very simplistic. 
7. Economy is mildly broken and fixed.
8. Limited amount of Vehicles and Trailers. 
9. Hunting Rifle which I assume since it shares the same Caliber as the Revolver is a Henry 357 Lever Action has a very weird First Person animation.
10. Some of the movement seems buggy at times. For example when you are trying to pick up eggs or clean up chicken poo your character sometimes does a shuffle dance when your trying to focus in on the object. 


*** MY SUGGESTIONS ***

1. Re-work Vehicle handling metas
2. Re-work Trailer handling metas
3. Add additional Vehicles/ Trailers 
4. Smooth out Player Movements
5. Fix the very dark lighting inside some of the stores
6. Total Overhaul and re-work of economy. Prices should fluctuate off of simulated supply and demand.  For example gas prices should fluctuate and in turn the price for oil will adjust accordingly. 
7. Shotgun should be added
8. Fishing would be really neat if thought out and done correctly 
9. Increase map size by 2 or 3 times its current size. With that add additional properties or buisnesses you could purchase such as a restaurant, butcher, garden center, ect. 
10. Add more AI owned businesses and AI people. 
11. Add Vehicle Damage. I feel some people drive around recklessly because there is no consequence for doing so. 
12. Increase Vehicle Prices. 
13. Add a Employee Management System that allows you to hire and manage Employees. (PLEASE dont make it like the travesty another Farm type game did) 
14. Improve tree cutting animations 
15. Increase Wild Life Amount thay spawn and have them spawn randomly around the map so it can not be telegraphed. 
16. Animals should die if hit by a vehicle.... currently you just bounce off them. 
17. Add ability to make Wine, Bourbon, Vodka, Moonshine.  Would be really cool since we already have grapes in there.

I have about 45 hours into this game. I bought it during early access.  This game has a lot of potential but after playing the new beta for an hour or I am disappointed with their decision to leave early access.  This is not a refined game but a very complete demo showing some great ideas and showing what "can" be done and a vision for a good game.

I assume that by leaving early access the developers have decided to release this version and move on.  Regardless of what the developer might say about their intentions I have witnessed too many times game that leave early access and are abandoned shortly thereafter.

This is why I can't recommend it at this time.
1. The vehicles and driving mechanics are quite unstable.  
When the game first came out the developer added a "flip" option in case your vehicle turned over.  I assumed this would be a temporary fix until something more permanent was developed.  With the beta the vehicles are even more unstable than they were before the beta.  In fact the ATV is constantly flipping and is very difficult to control.  In the previous version the ATV would not flip unless you did something stupid.  Now it flips all the time.
2. The map you see in the beta and will see in the full release has been improved to give the appearance of a town.  It adds some character but this seems like a "lipstick on a pig" effort to make the game appear like it has more content or "world" than it really does.  Certainly without this, the game is a very good demo in my harsh opinion. 
3. Lack of "things to do".  There are some production chains that seem quite well thought out like cheese production or sausages.  But there are no production chains for the immense farming and gardening.
4. Lack of quests.  there are only half a dozen quests to do. There is no variation.  There is no purpose to create a complex production chain for the purpose of fulfilling quests.  The basics are there but there is simply no "Content".  For example a good quest is granny likes bacon and eggs in the morning.  great. But the restaurant has no quests?  How about something like deliver 1000 sausages.  Give me a REASON to keep playing.
5. Oil wells? What random thing does an oil pump have to do with ranching?  This was a random and incomplete addition to the game.  I feel like there could have been something you could do with the oil like maybe an interactive POI that lets you refine the oil or something.  Again doesn't really fit with the theme of the game but at least make it more than just a money making feature.
6. MOTION SICKNESS.  If you suffer from motion sickness avoid this game.  There is no way to turn off head bobbing.  I would call this "drunken rancher simulator" even though there is no alcohol involved.  The camera dips left and right.  Don't drive vehicles in first person or you will have a headache even without motion sickness.  I have been drunk and this is the best drunk simulator there is.  This is my beef with all gaming developers.  They try to make things feel natural but real life is not a gopro attached to your head.  in real life our brains smooth things out.  I have driven ATVs in very rough situations and never does my vision flop around like it does in this game.

Summary

Is the game fun?  Yes it is a very fun "EARLY ACCESS" game but it is not ready to leave early access and NO I don't recommend it. (I would recommend it if it stays in early access).  If the game continues to get updates and new content after a year I may change my recommendation.

Although the concept for the game is an amazing one, the implementation of basic systems just isn't there. I have tried and tried to give this game the benefit of the doubt and tried to be understanding given that the development team is small. However, the core systems of the game are just as broken today, roughly two weeks away from FULL RELEASE, as they were when I first got the game. The vehicle system still feels like you are skating around on skis, even though they have "improved" it multiple times. The physics engine is absolutely atrocious along with most hitbox locations. When you look around in first person view it still feels like you are drunk, the camera whips back and forth just like the vehicles do. The farming system isn't even working as of the last time I checked and the gardening is pointless. All you can do is sell your produce for a small profit. The animal husbandry is bare bones at best with very little to do with the "products" you gain from the animals. You can make beef or pork meat products and cheese. The goat meat is still not able to be used and the wild meat from deer is just sold as is. Why not have summer sausage? I have enjoyed playing this game with my wife in co-op for many hours, but the idea that the developers are going to release a game that is so still early in it's development cycle is absurd. They just switched to UE5, that engine alone has many of the systems they want to use built into in when you use it. If it took them a year to switch over to UE5, why not use the tools the engine gives you to help improve your game so that you can make good on your promises. Now, I am an indie developer myself, and I know how hard it is to make a good cohesive game so I feel for the developers. However, leaving early access is just irresponsible when you don't have the basics down let alone a cohesive experience. I'm sorry, I do like the game but I cannot recommend anyone pay full price for it in its current state.

UPDATE: The devs are releasing '1.0', and doing exactly what I hoped they wouldn't.  This game is going to remain a janky mess, and I cannot recommend it.  Fucks sake.  Another early access game ruined.

Alright devs, I hope you read this because I came into this blind and I want to give you my first impressions.  This game definitely gives me the hands-on farming experience I was looking for, hatching my first chick felt like a genuine achievement, and tearing down all the old buildings to build my own was fun and rewarding.  You've also been doing regular content updates and fixes, which is great.  Overall, I would recommend this game to people....HOWEVER

First thing I noticed (and something that I haven't seen mentioned on other steam reviews strangely enough) is the lack of sound in a lot of areas, or just bad sound design in general.  It just sounds far too quiet, there's no ambience, if you walk five feet from the sawing table it goes dead silent, and the sound of your own car is just a constant flat droning noise.

The general handling of small objects can be a little painful at times, especially eggs, making it so your selection 'snaps' a little would help, but there's also the problem of the camera swaying sometimes when you turn (which makes sense realistically but my god is it annoying).  On a side note, LET ME TURN OFF WHATEVER MOUSE ACCELERATION AND SMOOTHING YOU'VE LOCKED ON PLEASE FOR THE LOVE OF GOD.

Fence building is just a bit shit, there's no auto size-adjusting final piece to complete a paddock, so you just have to kind of...get them as close as you can, which is irritating.

Driving...I don't think I need to explain myself on that one.

Accessibility - as someone who is visually impaired, there are some things in this game that need serious improvement.  Like finding BEES dear god its impossible.  And the one time I did find one I got immediately mauled by a bear.

There's also a ton of quality of life improvements that could be made to the game in general, and yes that's how early access is, but I've seen a lot of early access games 'release' into '1.0' and they're still just as janky as they were when they started.  Please don't let this be one of those games.

So yeah, I'd say a solid 6.5/10 at the moment,  I look forward to see what you add and improve next!
Great game where you can rebuild your grandpa's ranch the way you want and choose your own way to your fortune. Raise a variety of animals, grow crops and horses too.

I've really tried to like this game.  I WANT to like this game.  But I don't like this game.  It's like some executive who never plays video games heard that Stardew Valley was a hit but that it was in low-tech pixel graphics and hired some programmers with the directive to make Stardew Valley, but 3D and realistic.  They even directly ripped off the basic premise of Stardew, with you inheriting your grandfather's old, rundown ranch because you decided to get away from the grind.  But they never bothered to check what it was that actually made Stardew Valley endearing, and just decided to nix any story or NPCs.  The only people you run into are lifeless mannequins who all work at places like the real estate office or the store, and have names like Real Estate Agent or Store Employee.  No dialog options, no story.  You guys all your merchandise from a computer terminal.  The streets of town are devoid of life except for dreary cars that drive slowly down the road with darkened windows, presumably to hide the frozen zombies inside.  Honestly, driving through town feels like the setting for a horror movie.  I've rarely felt more lonely.

Soulless lack of story/setting aside, the game mechanics are rather clunky.  You're stuck in 3rd person view, running is kinda drifty and awkward, for some reason I carry my chickens by the throat like a demented 4 year old, the hunting is nothing more than point and click, the animal animations are...well, let's just say the animals in the old claymation Rudolf the Rednose Raindeer move more realistically.  Oh, and the driving is so floaty and drifty that you might well be on the moon.  Just moving around and doing stuff is a chore, even when you're not actually doing chores.  And there's no real progression to the gear or technology, just a price tag, so as long as you're willing to grind you can get anything you want.  That can be nice, I suppose, but it removes any incentive to progress or feeling of accomplishment. 

I dunno; it's a pretty game, but everything just feels so sterile and soulless.  I like the premise, and I have played all sorts of games in this genre, so it isn't like this just isn't my kind of game.  Maybe if they update it enough to make the controls feel good and bring in some characters with backstories we can get to know or something I'll give it another go, but as of right now it just feels like lifeless and clunky.

The game has a lot of potential. It takes a little time to build up, which isn't a bad thing with the early stages of development in the game. The town is pretty sparse and empty. The driving takes a bit to get used to, and as a farm girl there are some things lacking in the current state such as proper names for animals, and waking up at 8am to start the day, I wish! Don't buy this if you're wanting a more developed game. There simply is not a lot to do yet aside from butchering animals and making meats and cheeses etc, but if you're the type that enjoys farming materials, the game is a fun play through in it's current state. Excited to see where this one goes and I've been tagging along for each update for several months now. 

Things I'd like to see: 
Difference in animal breeds - One breed for meat production, one for milk production or egg production, etc. to make it more realistic. Like, you'd rather have a holstein for milk production than a hereford.  **Has been added
The ability to castrate your male animals for a fee, or have a veterinarian office
Breeding Cattle **Has been added 
Breeding Horses
Proper animal Names - piglet, boar, sow, (and when it gets there cow, bull, gelding, stallion, mare, filly, colt)
Traffic *has been added & roaming NPCs (*Quest NPCs were added)
Rodeo and/or Racing
Some sort of small plot farming, so you can grow veggies and add them to your recipes when you're cooking *has been added 
**UPDATED REVIEW** With the new UE5 Update, things are coming along so well for this game. Things have been added which do make it more realistic. There are still some odds and ends to be addressed with vehicles.

This game scratches an itch. Assembly line style tasks, wearing a bikini, shooting bears, naming animals after your middle school bully knowing full well that animal is going to be slaughtered in a few days. THAT'S RIGHT MELANIE, TRY TO TAKE MY MARKERS NOW THAT YOU'RE SALAMI! - anyways!! It's fun, it's fun alone and it's fun with friends. You literally take care of animals, make sausage, cheese, curd, meatballs, sell eggs, veggies, animal products. You get to customize on your land any type of building you want to do! You can build a house for yourself or move an air mattress into a barn and sleep with the cows!  

Have you ever died from a hen attacking you because you touched her fertilized egg?  You can in Ranch Sim!!!  You can also kill your friends!! [b] In the game! [/b] 

Also if you don't want to rush, you really don't have to. There are no bill collectors except for the food and water for the animals, and gasoline. If you want to just go hunting for a few days and stockpile wild animal meat outside of the hamburger shop in order to sell for a higher price, no one is going to tell you that you have to play the game a different way.  You really can build how you like, you can build the premade barns, houses, chicken coups or you can design something that is easy for you to manage and you can even paint it!
It really feels like a sandbox sometimes and you have so much you can do at all hours of the day, that you really don't have to change up the game times in order to have things to do!  

My only downsides are I wish you could skip the tutorial sometimes.  After playing for almost 900 hours, I understand how buy a chicken and put the car together. I'd really like to skip that part.  (although I have created a bunch of saves just after finishing the tutorial for this, i wish you could just do it in game.)  

These next ones are just ideas and not necessarily cons to the game as is. 
Being able to lift and move tables/beds/etc after you place them down as they're smaller objects, instead of having to tear them down.  

An easier way to kill chickens. 

I'd love to have the wolves/coyotes? try to get to your animals if you don't have them properly behind sturdy fencing.  

It could be cool to grow herbs and add vegetables and seasonings to meats and cheeses.

I really do love this game. I'll soon be chopping down every single tree in game to see what happens!

If you get pigs and you kill them for meat, make sure to have lots of coolers. I've spent the past half an hour just turning meat into sausages, and I'm not even halfway done, and I don't have enough cooler space for this shit.

Really great game- LOADS of stuff to keep you busy. Graphics aren't the best but also not the worst. Me and my buddy spend HOURS on Ranch Sim doing lots of different stuff. It can get a little repetitive sometimes tho. Things we would like to see changed/ added (I am just going to list as many things as we, my buddy and I, can think of in case the devs see this haha): 

- The ability to move and or destroy the tent
- A better system for placing items down so that items can align better (if you have OCD or just like things aligned and straight... be prepared to spend hours on placing objects down) 
- A count for the materials we need- for example if we place foundation for a fence it would be cool if we could see what we need and how many of that item in the top corner or something
- A system that allows us to connect the lights so we can turn lights on all at once or in groups
- A little description when buying things that says what the item can be used for 
- The ability to pet the animals lol 
- The ability to lead multiple animals at a time 
- The ability to carry more than one log at a time 
- Recipe book of some kind 
- Increase in speed of harvester 
- The ability to move objects once placed 
- The ability to move outline of object once placed 
- A option to "quick place" logs and planks when loading them in vehicle 
- More people for multi player 

It may seem like a lot but the reality is the game is already great. Its not like the game is unplayable- these are just things we feel would enhance the game quality! We cant wait to see what else is added!! 
Highly recommend!

It has some good elements and I'd like to see it grow, I do have a few suggestions/complaints though.

EDIT: As of 8/29/2023, I have to change this review and not recommend it. The game has become so buggy it's practically unplayable. I haven't been able to get it past the start screen without it freezing my entire computer, often forcing a restart, and my computer handles much more graphically intensive games quite easily. This game has become a train wreck. 

Vehicles sometimes get stuck on fences and such, and if they do flipping them often won't free them so they're stuck forever unless you go back and reload the game. This can also happen to trailers. 

The day/night cycles are WAY too short. The day isn't nearly long enough and the nights last too long and are too dark, the days should be longer and nights shorter. In the weather vein, I've had a thunderstorm and fog every single day cycle, which is just too much. Those need to be spaced out a LOT more, maybe a thunderstorm once every seven day cycle or so. 

Two planks per log is too few, I think five per log would be a decent number. You have to completely deforest the entire ranch to build much of anything. 

Metal and concrete are too expensive for the small amounts you get and how much you need for basically everything, especially when you're starting out and money is hard and takes a very long time to earn. Maybe make it easier to earn money doing odd jobs or requests for people in town or at other ranches? The ability to auction off some of your livestock maybe?

I would like the ability to unsaddle my horse and let them roam around without a saddle on in their corral. A saddle stand/wall mounted saddle tree would be a neat building project to add to the game for their barn. Horse breeding for better stats would be neat too, especially if you could auction off the horses you bred. Different horse breeds would be nice, especially if you could add donkeys/mules to the game. 

Ability to paint the barn/buildings - as much as I do like the weathered barn look, it doesn't make sense for something just built and some of us would like to spruce it up. Also the ability to put down flooring for the barns would be nice, or add wood shavings or something as bedding in the stalls. 

The car controls are wonky. As. Heck. 

Slightly more fun stuff: I would like to see sheep and goats in the game, especially the ability to shear the sheep for wool and either sell the raw wool or refine it into wool cloth to sell or craft various things out of, such as making your own bedding/unique clothes, perhaps with dyes bought at the general store. 

The ability to raise and train calves as working oxen would be awesome, especially if you had carts you could attach them to so they could help you haul lumber and such around the ranch. Draft horse breeds, mules and donkeys could also fit into this category or simply be variations of it. 

Smokers to create smoked sausages/jerky would be nice! I love me some good jerky. 

Cats would be nice to have, especially if you could occasionally find a stray cat in town to adopt and bring to the ranch, and of course things for the cat that you could add to your ranch/house, such as cat trees you could build and beds, feeding dishes and such. Especially if they implemented a mechanic where rodents could get into your granaries or other areas, having cats around to keep them away would be handy!

In a similar vein, dogs! Different breeds of dogs for the ranch to perform various tasks, like warning you of approaching predators by barking, helping herd other animals and just to be a companion by your side, and of course the ability to build doghouses, beds, bowls and other things for the dog, maybe even handcrafting leather collars out of hides from your slaughtered livestock? The leather from the hides could also be used to craft things like custom saddles, harnesses for working animals and such! 

I know the entire crop system hasn't been implemented yet so I don't have much to say on that front until I see some of what they have planned. 

A way to level the ground for better building/planting would be nice, I don't like having weird gaps under part of my barn wall because of the hill. 

Ducks/geese would be a fun addition, and the ability to build a pond for them. Maybe raising meat rabbits too? 

There's lighting issues and other fixes that need refinement but I think those will come with time.

This game, is so good. It has SO MUCH potential that i've considered changing my entire life to become a game developer and beg to be in on this development somehow. Enjoy constantly holding friends at gunpoint while running a ranch.

SULY SULY! Hi im Rems and this is my opinion on this game. 
Super fun, grindy, and a relaxing game. If you don't like grinding for money, building, farming, and gardening then this game is not for you. If you do then you are in luck. This game has SO MUCH POTENTIAL and pray that it continues to be updated as i genuinely enjoy playing it on my downtime. I would also like to recommend some things to add to this game or be updated in the future which would be.....
-stats for hunger, sleep, bladder, and maybe stamina
-more decor items for the homes and/or outside items
-the mechanics of animals body's walking as well as wild life. 
-being able to place the middle part of the barn without back or front (so I can park my tractors and trailers under them.) 
-Horse training jobs
-types of breeds of horses
-maybe even catch and tame wild horses? 
-swimming as of right now you fall through the water and can drive through it. 
-make roads and pathways
-passive ways for income 
-option to plow anywhere on the map to farm
So for now this is where I am at with this game I may edit this later after this update coming in September to review the changes as well. I do wanna say that some people do and don't like the fall damage and no damage to cars, trailers, trucks, ect... but for me i don't really care, but for the ones that do maybe a option to turn this on or off kinda thing? either or I totally recommend this game to ANYONE. SHOOT if you get it lmk, I could definitely use friends to help with my farm and theirs. I hope this helps with your decision!

Alright, I have sunk more time into this dude. And...this is what I think.
It is a good game. It is also an addicting one. Waking up every day to tend your fields and livestock has a good "wholesome" feel to it. I know. I put air quotes because...sarcasm. You absolutely slaughter animals in this game. You have to, because they will die otherwise. I suppose you could play this without delving into animal husbandry but you'd be cutting yourself short. It's more than half of the entire concept of farming.

Now to the things I dislike/need to change/be added: (<---I would gladly pay for these things)

- Fencing. Oh my gawd. FIX. IT. Getting stuck inside, on top of and a few feet from fences is gut wrenching when you haven't saved since you last slept. The work around is to save frequently. That's...just not good enough guys. Fix it. Also...the placing of fences should work like...how places walls/fencing work in games like The Sims 4. Simplified toggles, drags and clicks.

-Destroying things. There should be a prompt: Are you sure you want to destroy this? This would work better if you could click and drag to select multiple objects, because that would be intentional but when it comes to switching tools and accidentally deleting a whole building...man. Or a more simplified idea: have the option to redo/backspace/undo your last action when building.

-Pigs....should not ever be able to climb on things like they can in this game. How in the world would a 650lb swine be able to walk up the side of a table and then over a fence? They wouldn't.

-Castration should be an option: because pigs. I'd pay for this service in the general store or even the tools to do it myself. Only drawback? It's not reversible.

-Horses should be able to breed and they need their own buildings. The barn is suitable sure, but we need one or two building options specifically for them. If you choose to forgo a horse barn, you could build a horse shed in the pasture for them. Would be nice to have tack options to buy, even premade designs. Then just a little page for selecting your available tack in their profile page. Or having an object tied to your horses that names them and tacks them up all in one go.

-Chickens: The mechanics of chickens needs a revamp. They are able to sometimes walk through walls. Which, is not good man, not good. The egg basket should have the option to deposit the eggs into the ovoscope to fill slots and then to deposit them all back into the basket with a button/command. Remove their ability to stand on top of the chicken feeder. They poop in one spot and you have to physically move each of them out of the way to get to the poo. There should be more breeds/colors. We get three options. I know the work around is to place the feeders outside of the fence/area but how realistic is that?

-Poop: There's a lot of sh** in this game. A service that would clean this up would be easy but awesome to have. Or, the composter should work like the silo/windmill and auto suck up the poop in a certain area, which you could toggle on just like the silos/windwill. Then pick it up and rotate it around your animals or...put on in each area. Boom.

-Driving mechanics. This is wonky. Ya'll know it. Work on that.

-Weapons. We don't have enough options.
-Quests: We don't have enough quests.
-Maps. This map is okay. But having two more options from the start would be fantastic.

-Lumber - The option to sell logs like planks at a discounted rate. Obviously unprocessed lumber would be worth less. The wood cutters need something to auto feed them, either another buyable option or a setting on the more expensive one. Also, automatically shutting off after a few moments when not loaded would be nice. I know that last one might be asking a little much but...I'd like that a lot.

-Build/Map/Terrain: We don't have the able to change the terrain on our property. Again, like in the Sims 4 you could add the option to paint the terrain, even with just three or four options: gravel, grass, dirt, concrete. Having pathways around your property would be super amazing. Grass should not be able to grow through concrete/gravel/dirt options. 

-Buyable Objects: There aren't enough decorative options, nor are there enough shelving, meat drying options, etc. I would like to be able to purchase a home furnished or unfurnished with the option to buy and place things in the rooms. Big ask, but seriously. Would be AMAZING.

I would pay for any or all of things in a purchasable DLC as I know several of my friends and family would as well. Heck, I'd gift it to some of them myself. This game has a ton of potential just laying there waiting for the devs to make bank off of.

Thank you for your time.
And thank you...for this game. Even in the state it's presently in. ;)
amazing for exploration-

First, game has lots of potential. Fun and engaging.
Second, it's pretty dry and empty BUT I get it's Early Access and things are still being worked on.

So, to the Devs:
- Night time is SUPER DARK.
- Lights (car lights and player's headlamp) SUPER BRIGHT.
- BluePrint Book - text is super small. Impossible to read at night with lights.
- Not enough wildlife to hunt. Economy needs a buff because I need to sell things but that requires to have things to sell. 
- LOVE the physics and the fact there is NO FALL DAMAGE! Leave that alone as well as vehicle takes no damage! That's ok! Being able to drive off the highest mountain and take no damage is fun.
- ADD AN INVENTORY PLEASE!
- Have a "bulk-apply" when building. Having to individually select items for building is annoying af.

That's it for now. Will be doing a stream and recording season with some friends this week for the MP aspect.
Overall, worth getting for sure!

The game is too clunky for me. Got to the point where i could finally build my granary so i could plant and harvest wheat to feed my animals.
After the massive cost of all the equipment ( around 6k ) and growing the wheat and then harvesting it with a lot of clunkyness ( harvester getting stuck and tractor reverses at 0,01mph with the gran trailer attached), and the finally getting my full trailer  to the granary which awaited to be filled, i couldn't find a away of unloading my trailer and then noticed on the granary i could fill it with a cost of only $200.

To add insult to injury after i returned with the wheat that i could not unload ( but i could sell at the shop ) i found all my animals bar 1 cow dead , all starved to death even though they had full water and full troughs before i set off to collect my harvest.

The game could be a lot more fun if it wasn't so clunky, I already mention about the harvesting and harvester getting stuck on the smallest bump but the driving aspect is a lot to be desired too. 
Reversing of trailers is a nightmare as they soon jack knife without giving you time to recover, The steering is way too sensitive and you can soon find yourself on your side or doing a full 360 with all the bumps in the road.

I know i have only payed for 40 hours but that 40 hours was enough for me to quit the game and wait again for more updates with the hop a lot of the clunkiness is taken away, I play mostly Farming Sim and wanted a break from it which is why i got this game but as it stands at the moment finding another game  is my only option.

I do hope that the devs do take on board the players concerns and fixes them because this game could be a ton of fun to play without the clunkiness.

I have played this game with my husband. It is fun, up to a point. When we play these types of games, our play styles are very different. I like the building aspect of it, while he likes dealing with the animals (hunting, etc). Because of this, when I play alone, I tend to use a "creative" mode. That mode doesn't exist in this game. It's a simulator only. The animals are always on. There is no peaceful mode. Most survival games with animals, or mobs include one, these days. It just extends the audience for the builder types. If you like a 'peaceful' mode, don't buy this game. It's not there. If that's not your style. I would say, definitely buy this game, but not at $25.  I grew up on a farm. Animals could be a problem. But there were never bears at the hardware store. I also like games where modders can be active. These days the modders add all the things, we wished the original developers would have included. That also doesn't seem to exist for this game.

I think this is a very "closed" game. Niche ONLY. The developers had an idea of how game play would proceed, all other ideas, dead in the water. So, no modding community. No peaceful mods. No settings to tweak. So, what do you get? You get a game without a hot bar. So, when the bear comes to kill you at the hardware store you have to hit the tab key and find a weapon on a wheel. Wait, what?

****IF YOU ARE CONSIDERING BUYING THIS GAME READ THIS POST FIRST PLEASE! ****

I wanted to spend a decent amount of time playing this game before posting my review. 

I was looking for a game where I could cut down trees, hunt, build and farm. No people to kill or zombies (just dangerous animals)...there is shooting.....driving cars.....Jump Button...No fall damage...No eating....No Drinking....No harm from elements...

From the looks of it, that was this game, and why I decided to purchase it and give it a try. I only read a few comments before purchasing, and I do not regret spending the money on this game by any means. 

In the beginning, it definitely does start out slow, so just go in with that mindset and expect to GRIND. It took me a little bit to figure out what I could sell at the stores, and where to put my goods when I want to sell them. Part of that was just because I was rushing and not really looking around. If you need any assistance with selling items or item prices - you can find info on trusty old Google. Also, I thought it was horrible at the beginning because I didn't realize there was a flashlight ( press 'L') :D Nights were horrible once it was pitch black for a little bit...but the sun does always rise :)

BUILDING/CRAFTING ::
The building system is pretty easy to get the hang of. I like that you can setup the blueprint first and then build using the wood. This way you can see the idea before wasting the time and using wood. When removing, you only remove the blueprint then. Comes in handy when you have to cut and then use the wood saw, over and over and over and over and over again. 

Items usually snap (somewhat) and then you can rotate them.....I will agree with the post I read....it is extremely annoying that I cannot make perfect square fences, so I decided to go for rounded fences....so far it's doing all right :) 

Besides not fully snapping, there could be more items to craft...


HUNTING ::
Hunting is pretty easy and bullets are low enough cost to be able to purchase quickly in the beginning. Selling meat is one of the quicker ways to make money. 

My biggest issue is that I can't find predators easily....are they hiding from me!?!? lol

It sucks when you get killed by a predator and haven't saved recently..... HINT:: buy a camping blow up bed from the hardware store and keep it in your car so you can save frequently without having to go back to the ranch. 


I think they should add fishing ;)

FARMING::  -- haven't gotten to that yet. will update in the future


DRIVING::

Driving is tough to get the hang of...but it is nice that you can flip the car whenever and wherever.
Maybe I just suck at driving? haha

More options for upgrades would be nice.....but its not the focus of the game so I get it....I don't have enough money to spend to be able to buy more cars or upgrades yet anyways...LOL

Also regarding the cars...... don't make the same mistake I did and sell the car your g-pa gave to you....you will get it for 1/2 what they sell it for....



OVERALL::

This game so far has everything that I was expecting. Definitely blew my expectations. SUPER excited for the updates coming.... THERE WILL BE PETS!!!


If you get this game, don't expect to quickly get through building homes, barns, coops, etc.... focus on buying bullets and selling meat. Go to the hunter and get the hunting rifle. Also, if you take out a loan to buy animals, make sure you have a barn or coop ready to go for them...otherwise they will die outside. 


But seriously, get this game....it's worth the money and time :)

EDIT: It was bad, got better. Original EA thoughts below. ----------------------------------- I understand it's early access, but it's a chore to play. The main reason being you don't get any materials back for demolishing objects. That means you can't build for fun. Everything has to be planned and prepared exactly, otherwise if you want to change something, or the last section of fence doesn't fit or you want to move or even rotate a chicken coop you need to start over from nothing, and it's TEDIOUS. I spent way too long planning and preparing to build a fence than I did making it, and that shouldn't happen especially in an early access where your (i would hope) wanting to get people interested in the actual gameplay aspects. Making construction so punishing if you make a mistake just put me off building. And if I'm not building how much of the game am I missing out on? 50, 60, 70%? The animations need a lot of work, but generally everything else looks good. Hit a deer with my car and it T-posed 10 feet in the air and just dropped back down. VERY micromangement heavy. You have to cut trees, chop them to logs carry each individual log to the workbench to turn it into only 2 planks, then manually carry the planks to your building. So tedious. Tutorial is confusingly short. Repair your car, visit the shops, buy chickens, demolish your grandfathers house, tutorial over GLHF. Like I don't want hand holding for the entire game, but what now? No survival stats so sleep, food water for your character doesn't exist but does seem to for the animals - never explained. Other animals?, hunting?, farming? no explanation. Can't recommend it at this time, but hopefully it will get some QoL improvements and be ok.

So much to do, and I haven't even scratched the surface yet!  I really love this game and wish I didn't have to go to work or sleep so I could just keep playing.  For actual game-play, it is fun and enjoyable. Chopping down a tree (which there is a lot of) is not annoying, because it only takes 1 swing to chop it down, and another to make logs.  This makes a tedious task less repetitive like what other games have done.  Again, although I have played for over 20 hours at this point, I only have chickens and honey production and I just get excited knowing there is so much more to expand on!
All that being said, it is pretty clear it is still in early access, but I am so happy I saw the details for the upcoming update they are planning on to enhance and add even more content! If the developers are reading this, I would like to say my 2 biggest updates ideas are 1: The lighting at night.  It is PITCH BLACK without your head lamp on.  Maybe have the other cars have headlights/brake lights? But again, an update will be dropping within a month or two, so maybe this has already been addressed. And 2: more options for building our own freestyle buildings. I LOVE the barn and how there is the front, end, and you can pick how long you want it by adding middle parts.  I Am trying to build a large garage that I can park all my vehicles and trailers in, but I cannot make something where the door is wide enough for the trailers to fit!  More options and variety would be amazing.  (P.S. I also really like the greenhouse parts... nice open windows to let in natural light!)

Hallo, also im großen und ganzen gefällt mir das Spiel sehr gut. Bisher spiele ich es nur im Single Player. Meiner Meinung nach ist es schwierig alles unter einem Hut zu bekommen. Es sollte im Single Player sowas wie einen Helfer geben der sich um dir Tiere kümmert. Die Silos mit 200 Kapazität sind meines Erachtens sehr gering.  Eventuell die Kapazität unendlich machen beziehungsweise es so machen das am Tag Geld abgebucht wird und das Silo sich automatisch wieder befüllt . Was mich sehr stört sind die lichter die man alle einzeln anschalten und wieder ausschalten muss . Wenn es da die Möglichkeit gäbe  das die Lampen ab einer bestimmten Uhrzeit angehen und morgens um 8 wieder aus wäre das viel angenehmer . Was mich ebenfalls ein wenig stört ist der Stall . Man kann ihn unendlich lang aber nicht in die Breite bauen . Mir persönlich fehlt es das man ihn auch in die Breite erweitern kann . Alles in einen ist es ein mega Spiel mit sehr viel Potenzial spiele es auch sehr gern aber halt im Single Player . Wäre schön wenn ihr das ein wenig leichter gestalten würdet für User die gern im Single Player unterwegs sind.  Achso eine Hoftankstelle wäre auch was schönes Bauen ->Tanken->bezahlen.  Hoffe das das spiel weiter entwickelt wird , denn es hat wirklich sehr großes Potenzial und in meinen Augen macht das Spiel auch sehr großen Spaß.

I am obsessed with this game. It’s exactly the sort of game I enjoy, I’ve inherited a farm from a deceased family member and have to build from almost nothing to get it running strong. The graphics of this are fantastic and a lot of the mechanics feel very true-to-real-life. Like how costly it is to raise animals vs the return on investment you get. And ESPECIALLY the cost of farming holy cow. It’s one steep bill to get all the equipment needed to get going. 

A few things I feel can be improved on is the controls. Right now it’s pretty darn impossible to drive around with a controller joystick, which is what the official steam deck layout has you use. It’s just telling the game you’re using wasd and it makes turning and such an all or nothing endeavor. The game needs native controller support IMO 

It also needs a PAUSE BUTTON. What if the baby starts crying? Can’t just ignore the baby, that’s frowned upon by the government. (And ya know bad for the baby) but if you don’t go back to your tent to save and then exit the game (which can take like 5 minutes depending on where you are), time will March forward and oooooh boy if you need to pause in the middle of hunting have fun being murdered by a bear and losing the entire days progress anyway. So please, developers, a pause button.

I am loving this game so far!  I love building and improving my ranch, taking care of the animals, etc.  I do hope the final game will include an option to hire ranch hands, because I'm not interested in multiplayer but I can already tell that taking care of a full ranch will probably be too hard in single player.  I also agree with another player that having quests to do could help the game from getting boring once you have completed your ranch.  I'm also hoping that the final game will allow you to interact with the furniture in your home (in addition to just the bed), let you delete the tent you start with and change up the furniture and decorations in your home.  The only bugs I've noticed are that my fencing sometimes raises or lowers itself, allowing smaller animals to escape.  I've also tried turning off the lightning storms, but they still come on randomly.  Sometimes I can switch between first and third person views, but most of the time I'm stuck in third person.  All in all, I'm having a blast and can't wait to see what the full game brings!

It's pretty much a mess. 
Not fully a thumbs down because it still kinda makes fun but i don't want this to get a thumbs up neither.

As long as you play alone it's quite fun for a few hours as long as you don't plan to explore the map.
Many people experience their livestock getting stuck and starve in front of the filled trough and you don't want to be too far away when this happens.

In multiplayer you need to pay extra attention because every player besides the host might fall through the map or be launched into the sky making you lose your expensive car. 
Tractor indincluding machines fell through the ground? It's gone! 
You accidentally drove into an invisible alpha wall and the car - loaded with thousand of dollars of equipment - glitched through? Well... that belongs to the void now.
Someone wants to remove some placed deco stuff inside one of the house presets? Better hope the game stays in sync or thousands of dollars material and everything inside just vanish. 
Some objects just disappear others spawn out of sight after paying a shit load of money for it.

BTW don't think there's actually a guarantee to get support when reporting bugs.
Multiplayer bugs are always blamed on the player's internet connection (eventho no other game has this problems), if you get help it's mostly just an annoyed mod posting the same pre-made bot command over and over no matter if it actually fits the problem or not and if you don't know english you better screw yourself or you'll get banned for not using english.

If you're really really lucky you get yorself to talk to the publisher's staff or the one mod that actually does more than posting commands or delete random posts for no reason.

Maybe the port to UE5 will help at least with the bugs.

I dont know about single player, but this game is a blast with my friend. Perfectly scratches that farming/ranching itch that we havent been able to get from other like games. The act of raising cows and goats has been the best for me. 

Milking actually takes effort, its not just click and done.
Making cheeses and meat products equally takes effort (and for some ALOT)
Animals gradually grow, they dont just hop from baby to adult. I love this so much as i love watching my livestock grow up.
Has a few bugs with desync in multiplayer but thus far it has all been hilarious, and thus far only occurs when someone who isnt the host drives into the ranch with a car (and even then its not all the time, but having trailers hitched to vehicles makes it much more frequent, so un-hitch trailers that arent in use!)

A few things i would love to see in the furture is the ability to breed and raise your own horses, play with a genetics system to breed the best. You can buy horses and train them as it is right now, but ive found more often than not you actually lose profit when training them up to full and selling them. So having the ability to breed our own horses would be so much more rewarding and worth the effort that goes into training.

Another smaller thing, the ability to make butter. I think playing with a mechanic to churn butter could be fun, at least until working up to something more automatic once you tire of it.

Elsewise, for early access this game has been everything my friend and i have been looking for in a game. 10/10 recommend and cant wait to see what future updates bring!

I liked how the game had a lot of different ways to make money even if you weren't even on the ranch and some items were expensive but not so much so that you can't ever get it. I don't have anything really negative because it's fun to play and sometimes can get a bit grindy but not so much so you completely quit the game.
This game would be amazing if not for all the bugs. It glitches out everyday and makes you reset your progress.

Still early access so there is alot which can be improved, however considering it is very early access the game is really enjoyable. you can build from scratch or use the prefabs though limited are pretty cool. the horse mechanics are not aweful and they have said there will be updates coming to improve many aspects of the game.

So Ranch Simulator is not a bad game but it's also not really a good game either, it's just okay. sadly it still suffers from a lot of bugs ranging for minor to more major. The game just feels VERY unpolished/refined. this game came out in 2021, we are now in 2023 nearing 2024 and this game still feels like a mess. I have played a lot of EA games but this game in my opinion does not even feel like a EA game, it just lacks so much and has so many balancing issues along with other stuff. The games does a good job at giving the allusion that there is more to it than what there really is, most of this game is a money grinding simulator that has a bad economy and many balancing issues. I can not recommend this game at it's full asking price as it is just not worth that amount of $. This feels like a 10$ game maybe 15 at best.

FYI: the more animals/structures you have the more and more the game will start to lag, at some point it will be unplayable.

Really fun if you're playing with friends, can feel like endless chores if you're on your own but its a relaxing game to put music on and play at your own pace.
Livestock can get demanding fast, even with the timescale set to its slowest setting.
Performance is OK on my RX 6750XT, but the framerate is choppy and gives my headaches if I play for a long time in one sitting (and I'm an Arma player, so I'm not usually picky about framerate!).
The driving is wacky but can be really fun for all of its quirks - I strongly recommend building a ramp off the cliff between your ranch and the restaurant.
Building barns and paddocks is what I got the game for, and it is very enjoyable. Not as in-depth as some games, but everything seems to fit together pretty nicely and I haven't had to demolish anything because animals couldn't figure doors/waterers out in a certain place (I'm looking at you two, Fallout 4 and the Sims...)
So far I've also been having an immense amount of fun (to my friend's anguish) cutting down every tree on the map that is NOT within the bounds of our ranch. TBD on whether the trees ever grow back...

First, please understand, this game is very early access. Due to the price I wrongly assumed it was closer to full roll out than it is. For right now, expect to grind out limited resources for a very low profit margin. Keeping livestock, which is the point of the game, is cumbersome and expensive with high loss due to death and again, very low profit margins. It falls flat as a simulator since no animal will graze or forage for food cutting the cost of feeding and raising the way real animals do. At least, on my IRL farm goats and chickens browse. The tutorial is well made and the game play is casual and relaxing or boring depending on the player, I guess. One day this game may become worth the current price but as of May 2023 it is not. Wait for it to get a few updates before spending or expect to have limited play-ability.

Okay, where do I begin? 

I absolutely love this game. True open world, a bit of a grind, but relaxing and the graphics are gorgeous!
I have played about 6 hours so far, and have been progressing along slowly, but mostly due to playing solo. I have since invited a friend to play (I bought them a copy of the game) and it's a lot more fun playing with a friend.

Things I enjoy: 

-The building system. It's actually fun to bring wood to different places to actually build the structure, and see it go up.
-UTV. The all terrain vehicle you get when you start is SUPER handy! It's actually decent on fuel as well and can carry quite a bit of cargo
-Music. The music is very nice. I don't mind it at all!
-Overall gameplay. Honestly I like everything about the game, my only complaints are just small things to make the game a bit more polished
-Growing system is pretty simple to understand

Things I would love to see improved upon:

-At night when you go to town, the other cars have no head or tail lights. I would love to see this added to the NPC vehicles so it's easier to see them and not crash head on at night
-PC vehicle lights. I find the light are VERY bright on the PC vehicles, which can also be an issue. I'd love to see the intensity of the lights turned down a bit to chill on how bright it makes things.


Overall rating in my personal opinion is 8/10 as I eagerly await more content for the game, I swear I am not addicted
