A very fun farming game to play with your friends. But it would be a lie if I said that the current state is very satisfying. It's missing a lot right now. I hope these shortcomings and problems will be fixed as soon as possible. The servers are not very good and sometimes they don't save when you save and exit and all your efforts that day can be wasted. Vehicles can be bugged and lost, or vehicles can take off into the sky. When the vehicle is lost, you have to use the money you have forcibly saved to buy a vehicle again. It's not very realistic in design, it's slightly amateurish, but it's okay. The game logic is very nice and enjoyable. As I said, if the problems are fixed, it can be much more beautiful and enjoyable. I think the price is expensive, but wait for the discount. System requirements are above average. If you have an average laptop, it may make it difficult for you to play the game and there may be a heating problem. I do not recommend it for now because the problems experienced are discouraging and affect the continuity of the game badly. I'll reevaluate if the issues are fixed.

Pros:
Fun to mess around
Cool bullet physics, they sometimes bounce off which is something I truly love no matter how unrealistic it is time to time.
Worth the 1.25 USD I've spent on it thanks to being a Turkish citizen. They've also increased the game 2.5x in my region for some reason.

Cons:
Absolutely zero QoL in every aspect.
Everything is bound to E key so... bad.
If you accidentally try to demolish something, no way to cancel.
Bad gun mechanics in every way. Can skip reload by changing weapons.
Somewhat bad animations
Awful purchase UI but compared to other games with similar layout, not too much different (House Flipper is a bit better in comparison)
Empty world with empty houses, like there's no furniture in it.
Game loop is literally; gain money, buy things that make money, sell the product and buy again.
I remember playing this game when it first released back in 2021 and I can certainly say that nothing feels like changed. I bet someone with adequate skill can do everything they've done in 2 years in just a week.

Super fun game to play with friends - just make sure to buy lots of bullets because they will kill each other a lot. Lots of features have been added over the years since original release which is great. It's a sandbox type of game so you can really do whatever you want. Hunting is a fun thing to do on the side of farming. Car physics are comical but sometimes leads to unfortunate bugs of vehicles getting stuck in the air (and never coming down). Quests from NPCs offer helpful monetary starts at the beginning of the game when you're clawing for a dollar. 

However, as a crazy horse girl, I was hoping the horses system would be a bit better. There's no breeding and the horse is constantly trying to run away. The auction system is a bit funky in that horses always get bid up by the NPCs to be overpriced. By the time it takes to fully train the horses, you will still sell them for either a loss, or maybe a max profit of $200. Given how expensive the horses are and how time consuming and repetitive the training is, it's not worth messing with the horses unless you're me and want them for the aesthetic.

I play a lot of different games and been on a few survey groups (Final Fantasy online, WoW, Secondlife, Roblox, Hayday, Farm Simulator, Dual Universe, Guild Wars, Valheim, Minecraft, Creativerse, Star Stables, etc.) and always look for games to do fishing or building with co-op to enjoy the company of my friends or play offline alone.

I Love the way this game is going and how the mechanics to start working and figure out. 

Fence sizes would nice to complete a padlock, some more options for house building plans (also furniture if building on your own) as well as maybe premade Animal padlocks plans to build also. Terra-forming the land options? Could add in breeding options of animals to throw off different colors....I think I'm getting way ahead of myself, but I listen to what others look for and communicate what we would enjoy better in the gameplay. 

The Burger joint has maybe little more you can do, specially if any meters are added to keep yourself alive is in the future. Options to build in town with other town buildings, or plots that one of your friends can buy and build their own farm that can add in or out of game to connect with possibly to help or hang out while online. 

***With that said should have options for anyone playing the game to save and also enter with a server that the other player doesn't have to be online to continue building, feeding, etc with password to get in as I was always getting kicked out and everything I did was gone that I worked on several times which became frustrating.***

Adding more towns to visit maybe different themed areas to venture to as doing the same quests over and over gets repetitive. (More expansions to do this) More recipes for cooking. Could also maybe add in mining caves to mine to build? Butcher shop? Craftsmen shop to build things like buildings, furniture, etc. More equipment choices. Options with planting that give you a feeling of achievement to what your working on, maybe level your planting up with doing this. 

I play with a farm on something called a G&S system on another game that I love that is like this in a way, as other try to create more that is like it but this old way of working your way up gives you more pride in what you do.

 I see great potential for this game to expand and build out into something amazing. 

Fishing with leveling would be great to be added into the game with a fishing boat and recipes to cook it. Give little more options to character clothes or options to make them in game, sheep for wool, spinning equipment to make yarn and dyes. 

People love to connect together and build, play, farm together and its hard to find good co-op games to enjoy along with the realistic feel of a game to decompose, or strive to work together to build a great place.

All in all I would pay a subscription to this game if a lot of these added features would be added in to create more content for others to enjoy as well and bring in endless options.

I have been playing this for a few weeks, it's a nice distraction, but seems very limited.
The in-game help menus are very thin (how to...)*.
Your player gets stuck a lot (usually on top off something), and unlike other games there doesn't seem to be an "unstuck" option, which means if you are stuck on a fence, or a cow...you cannot save the last day's activities, which is very irritating. Similarly, buying multiple vehicles/equipment often and rather stupidly places them on top of each other at the shop area goods bay, and it can take a while to drag things apart from each other. Very clunky.....not good.
 *e.g. planting crops in fields, making cheese

Also, building fences seems very complicated to get the ends to match up.
Mysterious chicken deaths....not sure why as they seem well fed and watered 

The biggest 3 problems (for me) are the player getting stuck on top of things, lack of quests/side quests and lack of farmhands...it should be possible to hire a fruit picker etc/....it's a very lonely game with no humans to interact with.

Multiple ways to play and have fun, graphics are amazing, all around its a Good game.

though multiplayer needs some loven, when joining another players world there is a good chance vehicles will glitch out/ break until the player hosting the game gets in and moves the vehicles, some times but not always when the joined player is running around they will have items (normally small from what I have seen) teleport into their hands even if the item was just sold.

After playing this game for a few hours (like 81) I have to say for a game that seems like not much to do in it, The game is very well made and keeps you busy. Time just fly's by while your cutting down trees, building animal pens and house, out hunting or catching rabbits smoking bees from hives or at the auction buying horses. 
A few things I would really like to see would be more Furniture to making a custom house, flowers  for the garden beds and garden fencing, food you can actually eat. Kinda feels weird having to feed my animals but not myself. Possibly fishing in the lake???? Being able to paint the garage (if you keep it) and the well. More crops to grow, and cooking recipe's to use them in so instead of planting and harvesting lets say tomatoes you can now make sauce and use your wheat to make spaghetti or pizza. Also allow the pig meat to be made into small sausages or pepperoni that would be cool ahhahahahah. 

One big issue I have been finding while playing multiplayer is sometimes when i go to get out of my truck i will get superman'ed across the map and end up on the edge while the truck is where i flew from and have to run all the way back to it, As well as the truck slightly moving on it's own making it hard to put things in, and if you leave the trailer attached I hear them banging together and sometimes see it.
 
All in all, This is an amazing homestead game for anyone looking for a getaway to your own ranch. I would highly recommend this game to everyone, and look forward to seeing where this game goes. Hopefully with some of my suggestions.

It's really great and if it wasn't for this glaring issue I'd recommend it, but there's a game breaking bug where vehicles are launched into the upper atmosphere, along with yourself, seemingly at random with no way at all to retrieve them. Vehicles in this game take a good bit of effort to unlock and are absolutely essential to the progression and navigation of the game as a whole. This has been an issue for over a year and many (even temporary) solutions by the community have been suggested (such as a simple vehicle reset with prerequisites to avoid exploits). 

The developers have been responsive about awareness of the issue, with in depth methodology about their testing, but the lack of any attempt to implement a way to actually play the video game has yet to happen. They're working on an engine update (from Unreal 4 to 5) and some mechanic rewrites to fix it, but until it's fixed I can't recommend an effectively unplayable game.

Here's a good thread highlighting the issue:
https://steamcommunity.com/app/1119730/discussions/0/5739253211821924936/?ctp=4

This game is great! A lot of potential for where this game can go. You can tell it’s still an early access game based on the way the terrain can go from super detail grass to  chunky-graphic rock terrain. 

Some things I would suggest:
-fruit trees and maybe flowers
-more wildlife and biome diversity to create a more immersive ranching experience.
-a town: right now the area is spread out with very little interaction with any NPCs outside of just shopping which is done on ATM style machines. 
-ability for dogs and or cats on your farm. 
-making the UTV less reactive and touchy when going over hills so you don’t fly all over 
-ability to pet your animals or interact with them more then just milking and watching them get pregnant. 
-more decorations for your home to make it more customizable instead of cookie cutter repetition. 
-NPC traveling and maybe visiting your ranch with some conversation dialogue

I appreciate the game and have a lot of fun as is but would definitely love to see some more features in game to make the experience more immersive and encapturing. Keep up the great work!

Ranch Simulator is an incredibly fun and immersive game that will keep you entertained for hours. The game puts you in the shoes of a ranch owner, where you must manage and take care of your animals, crops, and property. You have the opportunity to breed animals, cultivate crops, and build and upgrade structures on your ranch. As you progress through the game, you'll be able to upgrade and expand your ranch, as well as purchase other animals and crops.

The game has a great variety of features that make it unique and extremely enjoyable. For example, you can customize your ranch with different decorations, like fences, trees, and statues, which can make your ranch look absolutely stunning. You can also build a variety of structures, like barns and stables, to house your animals and store your crops. Additionally, you can upgrade your structures and animals to make them more efficient and powerful.

The game also features a variety of missions and activities that you can complete in order to earn rewards.  The rewards you earn can then be used to purchase new items and upgrades for your ranch.

Overall, a great chill game.

I'll start with the positive part... This is EXACTLY the kind of game I would like to play for hours and hours... Farming, raising farm animals, animal products, hunting, light logging, etc.

However, this is probably the glitchiest game I have ever played in my life. And I don't mean just annoying glitches, I mean glitches that make the game unplayable. 

For example, while trying to seed a farm plot, my tractor and seeder freaked out and started flailing and crashing into things and nothing I did would fix it. 

Additionally, I've purchased items like the water tank that just decided to stop working. I try to connect a bucket to it, and it just won't fill up. Other water tank worked fine, but the second one just stopped.

Chickens die left and right with no rhyme or reason to it even when they are in the coop, food and water troughs are full, and I regularly clean up behind them. 

Really hoping this game is fixed and improved soon.

Well howdy, partner! I reckon it's time for a review of the latest game that's got us city slickers talking: Ranch Simulator!

Now, let me tell ya, this game is the real deal. It's got all the trappings of a true-to-life western ranch, from corralling cattle to chopping down trees and building fences. The game puts you in the boots of a rancher trying to make it in the rough and tumble world of the Wild West, and let me tell ya, it's no walk in the park.

The graphics are mighty fine, with gorgeous vistas and realistic-looking animals that'll make you feel like you're out there on the range. But it's the gameplay that really shines. There's a real sense of satisfaction to be had from growing your ranch, from buying new equipment to taming wild horses and breaking them in for riding.

But don't let that fool ya, partner. Ranch Simulator is a tough game, and it'll take all your grit and determination to make it to the top. You'll need to manage your resources carefully, plan out your days, and stay on top of your chores if you want to keep your ranch running and make a name for yourself in the frontier.

All in all, Ranch Simulator is a rootin'-tootin' good time that's perfect for anyone who loves the Wild West and wants to experience life on the range for themselves. So saddle up, grab your hat, and get ready for a wild ride, partner!

I tried to get into this game two different times because it seems so relaxing and has a lot of potential. The early game is just far too grindy with not much to do -- to the point where I looked up if I was missing something. All there really is to do to make money early game is wander around looking for (sparsely available) wildlife to shoot, or wait for your few chickens to lay eggs. And god forbid if the things REFUSE TO EAT the food that's there and just die on you, at which point it seems you just need to restart, haha. It's just much too slow, unfortunately. I'm definitely going to give this another shot in the future, though!

This game is a good game so far, play time is about 30hrs at time of review. From an overview the game is decent from taking care of live stock to hunting and of course building your ranch. As with all games there are a few bugs and the development team does update an fix some every so often which is a plus. This game also supports controllers (Xbox - PC types) although since the normal buttons can not be changed adding the controller can add aggravation because of the overlapping of buttons. (as a side note if you do use a controller you have to assign each button since its not auto assigned with a template in game) I don't know if a wheel works or not might be something to try to make the driving a bit easier. 

I like the building aspect of the game from logging to building. The hunting aspect needs a little work and a good hunting rifle would help a great deal and adding of an icon "scope" at the end of the mouse point to see what you are aiming at would be helpful as well. a down side to hunting wolves and bears is that you can be mauled and killed if you shoot an miss... Then the game says "you've died" reminds me of the 1980's games "Game Over" lol. Then you have to exit the game and reload it because at the time of this review the "go to main menu" button doesn't work. Taking care of animals is a bit of work since the food an upkeep goes fast the more animals you have. The animals can die if you don't keep up with them and if they do die you can then process them for meats an cook with other foods grown in your greenhouse or gardens to increase or decrease the value of profit when you go to sale the final product. 
I would rate this game 5 stars and say Thanks to the Creators for a cool Ranch Simulator game!

I picked this up on a whim in my quest for the ideal farming game for myself, and honestly this is the game that’s scratched that itch the best so far. Its early access is simple so far but incredibly promising.

I assume I’m in the minority, but one of the major criticisms I’ve had personally with Stardew Valley and other similar games is that in addition to farming, it expects a bunch of other unrelated tasks and interacting with NPCs ad nauseum, and god forbid locking progress and features behind these tasks. Those games are still good and have their purpose! But I have been searching long and hard for my “weird little freak hermit that occasionally descends from their mountain hideaway with a chest freezer full of sausages to pawn before scuttling back into solitude and nobody questions this serial killer behavior” simulator, and I’ve finally found that.

That being said, I fully support the devs in whatever vision and ambition they have for their game, even if it includes quests and NPCs, but I would be extremely charmed if they kept it possible or at least left in a mode to simply free-farm as the game is basically presented now.

The game is not without its flaws, the driving in particular being the most egregious. Inputs are delayed and the vehicles are incredibly floaty at any sort of reasonable speed, but this is somewhat reasonably compensated for with a quick way to unstick yourself from a predicament as well as having no damage system to the vehicles. Still, in a game where there is a lot of space to roam around and a lot of stuff to haul, it sticks out.

My other gripe is that opening gates is like opening the Walmart doors on Black Friday. It seems like every animal in a ten mile radius makes a beeline to go through it, blocking you and whatever it is you might be trying to move through it and escape. I’ve had to basically fashion airlocks for my larger pens and it kind of breaks up some things I’d like to build and operate.

But with a grain of salt, it's early access, and overall I love the game so far. I look forward to seeing more potential crops, animals, and products! I have only played solo as of now, but I can only see the experience being enriched by like-minded friends and there’s plenty of space to spread out. I’m reviewing this as someone who was looking desperately for a no-frills farming game, so if you’re looking for a story or grand experience or lots of world interaction, this is probably not the game for you (yet!!). But if you just want to shut your brain off and hit the ground running (or more likely, hit a bump, backflip, and slide 200 feet on your front bumper before smashing directly into a deer), then I can definitely recommend it.

Played for a few hours to test it, this game uses a lot of free assets, seen them in other games like Mist Survival. Vehicle handling isn't good, gotta hold in the acceleration direction key (back or forth) for a few seconds before a car moves, and then it practically jumps in that direction. No precision allowed.
The barn we can build ourselves looks old and weather-worn.
Modular assets look nice, the roofs would look nicer tiled.
Movement is a bit wonky.
Don't get me started on the radio.
Gathering resources is terrible. 2 planks from each log, seems like a waste of wood. 2 tablesaws, cheap one is slow, "luxure" saw is faster but uses so much more fuel. Fuel economy is terrible, good thing gass is cheap ish.
All in all. Make more of your own assets, get somebody with experience to give you a hand with vehicles and character movement and animations otherwise your customers will feel ripped off. 2 out of 5 stars.

I bought this game on sale thinking I could refund it if I didn't like it. I wanted something I could jump in/out of that would be low pace, low stakes and still have fun.

Ranch Sim absolutely scratches the chill vibes itch I need. There are guides on how you can max your income etc but at its core Ranch Sim is designed to be whatever you want it to be. 

Playing with friends is a huge bonus. No dedicated servers (yet or probably ever) but if you got chorin to do you can ask for help. And when a friend asks for help, you help em.

There are early access bugs and annoyances but with as much as there is to do already this is certainly worth the price of admission on sale or not.

- More lighting in builings and shops that turn on at night

I wanted to like this game; I really did. I've played and completed Farming Simulator in the past on XBOX and wanted something similar but a bit more in depth. This game sounds promising, but the execution needs serious improvement. Driving a vehicle is infuriating. The camera swings and changes according to... I'm not sure what.  Steering and accelerating is tedious using a keyboard. Combine that with the ever-changing camera angle and I'd rather walk than drive! Controls are also tedious to learn. They just don't seem intuitive. Sometimes "E" picks up an item, sometimes it's the left mouse button. Why is it not consistent? As another reviewer mentioned, it really is too quiet in the game. There's no ambiance... no birds or traffic noises. No music other than the annoying sounds that come from the old radio your character finds. Overall, I didn't enjoy my first experience. I stopped playing mainly because of the frustrating controls. Please don't stop improving this game, though. I do believe it can become great.

For early access if I were to speak on it now, I Would say at this point it has some issues with instances not matching every time, also the object when sawing pop off of the saw machine, but they still cut. The game definitely has the feel of an early access but at times it feels like a well put together game. More to come...
***UPDATE***
Game devs and publisher have little motivation at developing this game at this point and show the same effort all other devs under the same publisher have shown. Half ass development with disjointed gameplay mechanics. Scripting seems to be weak and thrown together. One last piece on this game, the devs seem to care more about their DISCORD server than their game or making it work on steam or any platform TBH. Sad how this game went from shining star to crap.

Right off the bat, I think it would be awesome to be able to save some of the materials after demolishing an entire house. Would be nice to be able to gather natural resources aside from wood, like picking up the rocks all over the place and being able to use those. I also desperately wish that I could move things once placed down, or at least be able to gain all the materials back after demolishing. I built the chicken coop backwards by accident and had to demolish it and redo all the resource gathering. I find driving so difficult that I actually found walking to and from places was easier, despite only being able to carry one item at a time. Some more barn designs would also be nice, I don't need the massive one that comes in three different blueprints. Would also be fun if we could name our animals, and maybe even have a farm cat or dog. I look forward to seeing what the completed version will look like as there are so many great aspects to this game and I haven't been playing for 9 hours because I didn't like the game, it's weirdly addicting and time consuming but in a good way!

The game is fun, however still quite a few bugs to be fixed to make the game much more enjoyable.
- More missions would be fun
- Pigs not escaping from pens 
- Option to have your wheat, etc farms where you would like, instead of the pre-designed ones
- The way the tractor works to change, instead of having to get in and out of the vehicle to change the driving speed restriction
- A larger area of the farm for you to play with, mainly the road leading up to your farm, would be nice to have a building there 
- Vehicles that you are purchasing to not be reflected in the current weather conditions, aka if it's raining and dark, you can't see the vehicle
- More options with the bank? seems like a wasted building if only needed (if at all) in the first few days
- Making money is too easy.
- A handheld wheelbarrow or something for moving multiple small items around the farm would be nice, instead of having to use a vehicle, or one by one manually moving
- Driving the Harvester up the road to your ranch, it can get stuck
- Falling through the world sometimes, but at least it realises this and respawns you back on the Ranch.

The game overall is decent, needs more content, more features, etc. If the price was more to the £10-£13 price range, then 9/10 but at £20 more like 6.5/10

It should be fixed that the items placed on the car stay in the air when the car leaves. A motorcycle carrying apparatus and motorcycle must be added to the game in order to attach it to the cars. We cannot make the walls in the dimensions we want, this needs to change. When we build a tall building, an easier way, like a crane or elevator, should be added to move things up. It's ridiculous that a big wall and a tiny trough and-or a lamp cost wood equally, this needs to be fixed. When the foundation is laid, the grass rises above the foundation and we have to mow constantly, this should not happen. We should be able to use things such as kitchens, fireplaces, cabinets, tables, sofa sets that exist in ready-made houses when we make our own house. We should be able to load the horse, at least if the sleeping bag could be carried, it would be enough. Horse carriage added. We must be able to tame wild animals and transport them without skinning them. More than one sign should be placed on the map and these signs should be named. A minimap should be added. The size of the trees and the amount of wood that comes out of them are disproportionate, this should be made proportional. Add the ability to save more than one character. It would be nice if a fire and fire mechanics were added to the game. Fighting fire on the farm will add a new challenge to the game. Since the number of NPCs that can be interacted with in the game is very few, you are left alone at one point. This loneliness should be eliminated by increasing the RPG elements, in this way, trading etc. will be more fun. Lockable day-night cycle. Lines can be added to use animals as guides during construction. The road must be built. Seasons and seasonal items should be added.

Arabanın üstüne konulan eşyaların araba gidince havada kalması düzeltilmeli. Oyuna mutlaka arabalara takmak için motorsiklet taşıma aparatı ve motorsiklet eklenmeli. Duvarları istediğimiz ölçülerde yapamıyoruz bunun değiimesi gerekiyor. Yüksek bina yaptığımızda eşyaları yukarı taşımak için vinç ya da asansör tarzı daha kolay bir yol eklenmeli. Büyük bir duvarla küçücük bir yalak ve-veya bir lambanın odun maliyetinin eşit olması çok saçma, bu düzeltilmeli. Temel atıldığında otlar temelin üstüne çıkıyor ve sürekli çim biçmek zorunda kalıyoruz bu olmamalı. Hazır evlerde var olan mutfak, şömine, dolap, masa, koltuk takımı gibi şeyleri kendimiz ev yaptığımızda da kullanabilmeliyiz. Ata yük yükleyebilmeliyiz, en azından uyku tulumu taşınabilse yeterli olacaktır. At arabası eklenmeli. Vahşi hayvanları evcilleştirebilmeliyiz ve derisini yüzmeden taşıyabilmeliyiz. Haritada birden fazla işaret konulabilmeli ve haritaya konulan bu işaretlere isim verilebilmeli. Bir mini harita eklenmeli. Ağaçların boyutlarıyla içlerinden çıkan tahta miktarı orantısız, bu orantılı hale getirilmelli. Birden fazla karakter kaydetme özelliği eklenmeli. Oyuna bir ateş ve yangın mekaniği eklense güzel olabilir. Çiftlikte yangınla mücadele etmek oyuna yeni bir mücadele ekleyecektir. Oyunda etkileşime girilebilecek NPC sayısı çok az olduğundan bir noktada yalnız kalıyorsunuz. RPG öğeleri arttırılarak bu yalnızlık giderilmeli, bu şekilde ticaret vs daha eğlenceli olacaktır. Gece-gündüz döngüsü kitlenebilmesi. İnşaat sırasında kılavuz olarak kullanılacak çizgiler eklenebilir. Yol yapılabilmeli. Mevsimler ve mevsimlere uygun eşyalar eklenmeli.

I've chatted with the Dev a bit about this "Desyncing" issue with regards to Multiplayer.

I'm a HUGE Multiplayer! (Bought this game 5 times for my kids etc so we could play together.)

The Desyncing seems to be an on going dragged out issue with no end in sight of being fixed. I've read posts from a year ago that were complaining back then.
Anyway, this "desyncing" causes Major issues to Multiplayer. Logging in and out constantly to avoid the loss of cars, farming equipment and so on. By constantly I mean about every 2 to 3 game days to avoid issues.

"Desyncing" of the store bought items between the multiplayers is horrible. IE: Milking machine for the cows, parts on the machine disappearing for friends invited. 

Using the Blueprint option to build items on your farm also causes more issues. Whether it causes "desyncing" or not has yet to be proven.

I'm not suggesting that you don't buy the game or play the game. I am suggesting that IF your plan is to play with family or friends that you hold off and see if this "Desyncing" is actually something that is going to be fixed. 

I have a brand new pc along with upgraded video card and a wonderful proc. I also use Fiber Optic and should not be running into this issue at all. ESP. with a sandbox game. I did lower all the graphics even though I run smoothly at EPIC and no change was found. (Normally, I run graphics on low in Early Access to discourage these types of issues from bothering me but this "desync" is beyond tolerable.

Things I did to try and fix issues:
Updated Graphic Card Drivers (No brainer)
Window Updates (No brainer)
Steam Updates (No Brainer)
Changed settings on Graphics card to allow me to choose settings rather then it automatically setting things up.
I even reset my modem before login.
I had friends log out around 18:00 game time. I slept in the tent then did morning saves. (I originally thought maybe they were spotty saves.) That didn't make a difference either. 

Again, single player go for it. Occasional hiccups can be tolerated. For hardcore Multiplayer this isn't the buy right now. I myself will be watching to see if the Dev's figure it out. I am also hoping the Dev's build the game they want to build and do not stray to far into the thoughts of gamers, As that can make for a crap game sometimes.

I have to say no to this game.  I've played it again and again trying different things but its just bad.
1.  Optimization is horrible yet the devs would rather add content than work on that.  They say they are now porting to UE5 but I seriously doubt that will help any.  
2.  About that content:  I agree that early access devs should get some ideas from the community, but these devs went overboard with that.  They have put so many community ideas in the game that its made the game a cluster____.
3.  Economy:  No matter what I do I always basically have the game "beat" by day 10.  The economy is extremely overpowered with very little to spend it on so you end up owning everything very quickly.
4.  Speed of things:  Animals breed at 2 days old, have a litter every other day, and only take a few days to grow to maturity.  Crops grow from planting to harvest in 12 in game hours.
5.  Quests:  Repeatable daily quests that reward too much money in a game thats suppose to be a simulator.  Not to mention one of those quests involves finding 3 things that the "ancients" left behind.  I guess the ancients revisit us every couple days to leave their treasures laying around.
6.  The devs:  They dont respond to criticisms of the game.  You guys didnt respond to any of my criticisms on the forums so dont respond to this review.
7.  Not a simulator:  I know that word is in the name of the game.  This game is not a simulator, the things Ive mentioned in this review kill any thoughts of the game being a simulator.  It's more of a fantasy game in which you raise animals.  Name of the game should be Fantasy Ranch.

It is a detailed realistic ranch managing game. You need to take care of your plants & chickens & cows etc. (milking the cow, watering the plants e.g.) Then when you earn more money, you can upgrade your ranch by buying better equipment, building bigger barn, buying bigger truck etc. 

It is a good farming simulator if you like chilling game but one of the problem is you can only carry one log / one stack of wood plank at a time and building a door needs like 10 planks so to build a house I just have to run back and forth to carry one piece of wood at a time which is so frustrating.

I really hope the game can add in a skill tree like what we got in RPG to level our character. Thus, when we are newbie, we can only carry 1 log but as we level up by purchasing more skill points, we can carry more/ have better driving skill/ run faster etc. to add more in-depth customization to the game. 

Moreover, it will be awesome if we can cook the ingredients that we harvest and sell it in our grocery store in the farm. e.g. processing the wheat into breads, milk into butter, fruits into juice, beef into burgers. Thus, we can choose to sell the raw meat or processed final product for more income. We can also be a cashier to ring up the customer or can hire employees to work for us. 

Hopefully later on the game can add in more outfits & furniture to let us spend our hard-earned money. For example, when we are rich, we can buy a luxurious bed/ expensive stereo/ paintings to decorate our house. That will open up a lot more options for the players.

Though there are somethings that makes me want to recommend Ranch Simulator, just at this stage of the games development, the cons outweighs the pros. 

Which seems like the devs are using assets similar to other games like  Farm Dynasty or Stranded Deep, which worries me to see. As it shows these devs might have certain limitations on what they can offer and are developing the game just for a profit, not out of passion or a desire to offer something truly unique. 

Only the devs can prove me wrong in time I suppose. So I’ll patiently wait to see the end results once the game has been fully released in order to change my recommendation.

What I want to see in future updates for Ranch Simulator :

1. Light Improvements for vehicles and buildings.
  
2. Animation improvements for chickens,deer,bears,character,etc.

3. More varieties for the environment like boulders, plants, parks, trails,statues,etc.

4. More NPC’s and some that are doing activities (jogging, cutting grass, etc.) 

5. Bars with activities for players at night.  (Darts, pool,etc.)

6. More homes for the town.

7. Better parking areas for some stores.

8. Custom pathway/ Road way for the farm.

9. Trophies for deer,bears and wolves. The game revolves around three elements of Building,Farming and Hunting. Yet I don’t see an option to collect the racks from a buck or being able too decorate your farm with trophy mounts of animals you had hunted.

10. More animals to be seen like ducks, mountain lions,etc. 

11. Build log cabins.

12. More ways to custom build/ pieces.

13. Survival elements like Hunger and Thirst.

14. Hidden items to collect - I really enjoyed going around looking for hidden treasure for a quest line. Wish you can do more of it. Eastern eggs or something
.
15. More resources to collect and use for crafting like metals.

That’s all I can think of. At the moment the game seems like it’s pretty bare bones despite being able to craft a decent amount of stuff and animals you can raise. Even though you can see vehicles and NPC’s in the world, it is just boring to go through and it easily breaks my immersion.
As the vehicle’s driving around are going nowhere but in circles.  And the npc you can see are just sitting around doing nothing while their homes are empty. There’s really no meaning to the world other than to work on your farm that can be a bit of a drag with the amount of grinding you gotta do.  While there’s nothing else you can do in game to take a break other than shutting it off and start playing something else.

Ranch Simulator has truly changed my life in ways I never could have imagined. When I first saw the game on Steam, I thought to myself "Oh boy, another farming simulator - just what I need." But little did I know, this game would lead me down a path of self-discovery and ultimately result in me purchasing a real-life ranch.

As soon as I started playing Ranch Simulator, I was hooked. The graphics are stunning and the gameplay is incredibly immersive. I found myself lost in the world of ranching, managing my crops and livestock with precision and care.

But the best part about Ranch Simulator is the sense of accomplishment it gives you. There's something truly satisfying about watching your ranch thrive and grow under your careful management. It's a feeling that I just couldn't get from any other game.

As I continued to play, I found myself daydreaming about what it would be like to own a ranch in real life. And before I knew it, I had put in an offer on a small piece of land in rural America.

Now, I'm a proud ranch owner, living my best life and thanking Ranch Simulator for giving me the push I needed to make my dream a reality.

If you're a fan of farming simulators or just looking for a new game to sink your teeth into, I highly recommend giving Ranch Simulator a try. You never know, it just might inspire you to start a new life on a ranch too.

[h1]A lot of potential[/h1]
This game has a lot of potential, but still needs quite a lot of improvements. I look forward to play it when it is more polished, because as of now, I find it a diamond in the rough. Here are some of the things I found by playing just 1h:

[b]The player character[/b]
The character moves too fast in normal speed, so it looks like I'm rushing everywhere instead of normal walk speed. Imagine you want to pee but the closest toilet is close enough not to run but far way enough that you need to rush to it. That's what it felt like going around doing the tutorial tasks. Then the sprint looks like you could beat Ussain Bolt in the Olympics! :D I would prefer a much more realistic character movement speed to immerse the player in the farm life. 
When doing some actions, like [spoiler]demolishing the house[/spoiler], the character accomplishes a lot with a single swing of an arm. I think it would be more realistic if the arm swing affects a smaller portion[spoiler] of the wall or object you are trying to demolish. It took me just 5 minutes to demolish an entire 3 floor house.[/spoiler]

[b]The vehicle(s)[/b]
The initial vehicle has a weird behaviour. When I press the accelerator button, it takes half a second for the vehicle to react and then it goes in a forward burst of movement really fast. It's not a smooth acceleration from the start. I'm not sure if this is intended behaviour or not but it makes it a bit annoying when trying to park in a specific place. Reversing doesn't have this problem though, it's smoother. Also the turning of direction is too fast! I struggled to control the vehicle in the road because it turns too fast. I'm not sure if it's because I'm playing with keyboard and mouse, but it's very challenging to keep the vehicle in the road lane. Also the lights at night are super bright, especially the breaking light casts a really strong red light!

[b]Other game mechanics[/b]
I was sad to see that a HUGE tree only yields 3 logs and each log only yields 2 planks. I was left with a feeling of "where's the rest of it?" :)
The wild life does't seem to recognise some buildings. One time a stag was trying to go in the vehicle store.
The store UI needs some polishing but it's usable. I would like to see it more user friendly.
The access to the hardware store is on a side that has no road (unless I missed something).

[b]Overall[/b]
Overall it's a great game in the making. I didn't experience it to its fullest because the current mechanics break the immersion and that puts me off. But the visuals are good and I can see the potential. Congratulations to Excalibur Games and Toxic Dog (publisher and developer).

Ranch Simulator is a fantastic game that provides endless hours of enjoyment. From the moment you start building your own farm from the ground up, you'll be hooked on the endless possibilities that this game offers.

One of the things I love most about Ranch Simulator is the freedom it gives players to build and design their own properties. The inclusion of blueprints for walls, windows, and other structures allows players to truly make their farms their own. My wife and I have had a blast playing in co-op mode, working together to design and build the farm of our dreams.

But what really sets Ranch Simulator apart is the dedication and care that the developers have put into it. They are constantly releasing updates and listening to player feedback, which has resulted in a truly enjoyable gaming experience. I can't wait to see what they have in store for the future of this game.

In short, Ranch Simulator is a must-play for any fan of farming games or anyone looking for a creative and immersive gaming experience. Do yourself a favor and give it a try!

This game is super relaxing and fun! It took a little bit to figure out how to get going, make money, and set up the ranch. Playing with the length of the day cycle (and taking full advantage of selling wild meat to the burger joint) was a game changer! This is definitely a game that needs to be co-op. It is WAY easier when playing with others.

The only glitch that makes the game tricky is you can get yeeted across the map and loose your vehicle. :( Aside from that, it's a fun game!

Excellent game even in early release. The graphics are lush, detailed and look gorgeous. The game-play economics, prerequisites for crafting and overall freedom to what tech/farm branch to develop is refreshing and does not get boring or tedious. Developers have a game that has endless replay ability. A+++

Running a ranch
Very well done and immersive experience.🐎
fun multiplayer experience. Game runs quite smooth for an early access game, still a few bugs but not bad at all

Very well done and immersive experience. The economy could be balanced and some advanced processing could make it more effective to actually process food... you will make more money just selling pork than processing anything into sausage or cheese, or than you would make with farming or eggs... you kind of have to want to do the other things... they make money, but if you are driven by profit vs time spent, just kill pigs... it has some glitches, nothing even remotely game breaking... the building and seeing your designs come to life is very satisfying. The mechanics are a blend of a lot of games... some Car Mechanic Sim, some Hunter Sim, some House Flipper... a bunch of management games... it takes what works from those for doing what this game needs to do, and it really works... the driving takes getting used to but if you manage your speed and steer with the terrain, it becomes enjoyable... offroading is well done... the immersion is fantastic.  You really do feel like you are running a ranch. The inventory system is outstanding and different from any other game... everything has a real world representation and storing stuff is a matter of stacking actual items and not just filling a database with names... pretty much every complaint I read about in these reviews is addressed in the game, the game does have a solution, but it is not always easy to find and the game could use more "help" descriptions or an intuitive tutorial... The daily chores give a solid sense of accomplishment every evening. But it is a bit of a grind, and could use some late game automation to make a large ranch viable for  a single player... it needs a balance of economy, money is too easy to come by and never drained... it has quests you can repeat which make you so much money that ranching becomes unnecessary... it needs some kind of financial drain that makes you have to go get more money. But as far as a relaxing, immersive experience that is exactly what the title suggests, it's a home run. The devs are responsive and seem to care about the players as much as their product. This is a real gem, already... well worth the purchase... and I fully expect bigger and better things to come.

This game is alright. It's a co-op game, you can build, and you can gather wood. It feels like it has the bones of a good game but stops there. For example, the only resources in the game are wood, concrete, and metal but you can only gather wood. You have to buy the other resources. This essentially boils the game down to 2 resources; wood and money. But you can also buy wood planks so the only actual resource is money. You get money by growing crops, raising animals, or just repeating the same pointless quest every day. The town and world are devoid of interaction and it makes it all feel empty and useless. Overall, it's a fun game but I would not recommend unless on sale and you have friends to play with.

I am a 45 yo father, probably one of the oldest people playing this game. I am a single farther to my Son, who is 14 now. I loaded into the game, picked my character and started playing but I was stuck on what you where supposed to do. I asked my Son for help and he hosted a game for me to join. I loved it as it was the best time I had spent with my Son since my wife had died. This game has ever since brought me and my son closer again and now we actually spend time together outside the house together as well. This game reminded me that there's fun to be had in everything, and it has brought both me and my Son many happy memories.

This game is super fun so far and I definitely think the full game will be GREAT when it's ready. There are quite a few small critiques that I've come up with for the developers to consider while I've been playing. They're things that can be improved on or changed if the devs see fit. If some things already have plans for future updates/the full release, then they can just be ignored lol. I also just don't want to seem like I'm back seat game developing ToT
These aren't in order of importance, just in order of what I can think of. 

1) To start, the layout of the map is huge! Especially for all that's there currently. I spend a lot of time going to and from places, especially when I need to go the gas station, then the hardware store, then the general store, maybe back to the hardware store when I forget something, then back to my ranch, etc. I can see where if more things are going to be added in the empty spaces this can be ignored, but if not, these kinds of buildings should be closer together. Especially since they're retail locations, it just makes sense.

2) I was surprised to see the gas station was completely empty on the inside, and almost completely run down all over. Again, I can see if the devs have a plan for it saved for later, so it's another thing that can be ignored, but I think adding some extra details around it would make it feel less convenient. Also, making that second gas tank usable would be a great help. It would speed up the process when I have multiple jerry cans to fill. My first critique is also applicable to the gas station because it's kind of in a weird spot, away from everything else.

3) The speed of the cars driving around is insanely slow. My character runs faster than the cars drive lol. I think making the cars a little faster would be nice to see.

4) I know this would be some work to add, but adding neighborhoods for said cars to drive around, pull into specific driveways, etc would be cool too. I joked to friends when I first started playing that it felt like the game took place in some sort of rural purgatory, and these cars were destined to just constantly drive with no beginning and no end for all eternity lmao.

5) The hardware store doesn't have a parking lot, or an entrance that makes sense for vehicles to enter. Driving into the back entrance on dirt doesn't really make sense to me. It would makes sense if the large door next to the pick up area was connected to a easily accessible parking lot. I've gotten stuck in that back entrance (which honestly is kind of a skill issue on my part LMAO but still) and have had to clear out the trees in that area to get stuff like the vehicle trailer out of there. An easy fix would to just be taking away that fence by the road.

6) This is kind of small, but adding logs to be bought would be nice, because sometimes I like how some trees are placed and want to keep a tree for the aesthetics but I need the wood. So either adding buy-able, unprocessed logs, or adding a feature to plant trees anywhere would be a nice feature.

7) A creative mode would be fun! Unless I've missed it somewhere, I think it would be fun to add a creative mode with unlimited supplies and make it quick and easy to demolish things.

8) There are quite a few rocks/trees I've found that sort of float in the air. There is one specific rock that I got stuck on on the hill to the hunter's cabin. I swerved to not run into a wolf, drove off the road, and got stuck on top of the rock. I couldn't back up off of it, couldn't drive forwards, and the "flip car" option didn't help. Fixing some of those rocks/trees would be nice.

9) The very start of the rancher's driveway has a bump that makes my car fly into the air and flip over if I drive normally over it. I have to slow way down to avoid flipping. Flattening that bump out a little would help with that.

10) The pieces of ancient treasure are in strange spots to me. There's nothing of importance in those areas, and the helmet and dagger are so far away that I, at first, thought those areas would be off limits since they're more up in the mountains. I just assumed there'd be an invisible wall stopping players from going up there. The goblet not so much since it's right off the road basically, but the other two are in super weird spots.

11) Being able to get rid of the tent after building a house would be nice. I like to build a garage near the entrance, and it takes up space near the entrance of the ranch.

12) Adding people in the burger place or just in the retail shops all together would make the cashiers seem less desolate. It's weird walking into those stores and the cashiers are just... there, not doing anything. More people would make it seem more realistic.

Tbh these things don't make the game unplayable, they're just things I think will improve the overall game play. Like I said, if any of these things already have plans, then the devs can just ignore them lol
If anyone has anything to add or wants to discuss my ideas, feel free to comment anything :) I'm fine with critiques about my critiques lol

I am giving this more of a 5/10 review as Steam does not have that middle review option. My initial impression of the game is underwhelmed at this time due to the following reasons. Perhaps more will unfold as I dig into it more. But I just wanted to point out a couple of things so that the devs and potential players can be aware of a few particular points about this game. 

Honestly, 4 hours in and I don't really think this game is ready. I have a pet peeve with games like these that release the concept of immaculate building designs that have 2 roof pieces where you can't even create a normal looking roof system. The fun for me is in the design and construction of the building. I can only do a gable roof then when I create a foyer entrance I have a gap in my roof because the gable doesn't connect to the main portion of the roof. They have pre-designed structures but that's boring to me. I think that they really need to invest a lot more focus on the building aspects of this game. Add the appropriate roof pieces. 

I do enjoy the resource gathering, chopping down trees, then cutting them into planks using the power saw. They did well to place a stacking system so that you're not just moving around one plank at a time, which I thought was the case at first. 

The graphics are mediocre which you know whatever. That isn't that big of a deal to me if I can have fun building stuff. Also, controller support would be a most welcome feature on this game as there is a lot to do in it and it gets tiring using the keyboard and mouse. 

I don't really have much more to say about it at this time except that it's not really drawing me in as some of the other reviews gave me the false impression that it would do. But I will follow it and try to put some more time in it and update my review once some updates have come through. It is early access, so I get that and I understand not having a perfect looking roof in a game might be considered a little nit picky. But the design/build mechanic is supposed be one of the defining features of the game. Ultimately, not bad, but in dire need of some polish. And I understand that game design is more complex then cooking eggs and bacon. So, it's not an easy job. This is a pretty ambitious concept which I can appreciate. Therefore 5/10 not all negative.
Its a pretty fun game, would like the cars to have lights so we can see them driving down the roads at night though.

I enjoy this game and appreciate the work the devs have put in thus far! I find it to be relaxing and fun to play with friends. (I have bought it for a few of mine just to have someone to play with)

I have a few notes/ suggestions that I would love to see implemented to improve the general experience of the game

1. It would be so nice if we could get a buildable light switch to actuate every fluorescent light the player has built! (Or even if it actuated every light in the game that would be a huge time saver) If I want to turn on every light in my ranch I will end up spending an estimated 15-30 minutes each time I load up the game

2. If possible I would love to see the farm fields be creatable instead of the three fixed plots we got in the last update. Whether that could be implemented through the build menu or just tilling up dirt with your tractor so you could have as much farmable land as your heart desires

3. It would be nice to have a header trailer for combine headers. Combine is damn slow (as it should be) but I spent a whole lot of time driving my combine all over gods creation to get my three headers from the hardware store up to my ranch (or if this isn’t possible I would also be happy with a trailer that could better accommodate the new farming equip (tractor with implements attached get super stuck on the car trailer and the combine doesn’t have the clearance to fit and either gets hung up or high centered when attempting to lid on to trailer)

That being said I love how this game is a sweeet spot between simplicity and complexity. I wish I had a game like this as a young man as I could see myself living in it for days at a time. Could best be described as ‘the Minecraft of farming games’

Seems more like a demo for Unreal Engine and Quixel Bridge. The character builder is great. The tutorial sets you on a path to raise chickens but the economics of chickens is hopeless because they eat way too much to make a decent profit from selling eggs. They are also very time consuming to tend. 

The gameplay then pushes you toward hunting instead of farming. The deer run like the wind ... and wastes a large part of a short day to catch up with them  . 

The store interface is very basic and it does not give descriptions of items and their purpose until AFTER you buy them. 

The little ATV that you must use to accomplish any buying and selling is maddeningly difficult to steer as it weaves back and forth constantly. 

The entire game needs a LOT of polish. Needs a time scale adjuster to slow down play and lengthen the day. Why does it get so dark at 8pm every day ? Is it perpetually autumn ?  The game needs a pause button. 

The parking area at the hardware store is very awkward to access and wastes a lot of time in your short work day just to get in and out of the loading area. 

The lights you build to let you work at night (after 8pm) are too dim to be very helpful. 

The road traffic needs an option to turn it off.

A tutorial on greenshouses, bee hives, and making products for sale would be VERY helpful to set the player up for success.

It's tricky to say if I would recommend this game to others or not. There are some great aspects and there is definitely potential. Overall however I don't think I'd recommend it.

Let's start with the pros:
- I was pleasantly surprised with the character creation. Sure, it's a bit limited but there are a decent amount of options and I do very much appreciate that. More clothing would be fun, or even a clothing store.
- No matter how many times you crash your car and how many trees you hit, you don't get any damage and your car couldn't care any less. Nor could the other road users or animals you hit for that matter.
- The tutorial is not too long but it does give a decent overview on how to play the game and some money to start with.
- I like the way the game looks. The background with the mountains looks very relaxing and overall it looks solid.
- Quests are great. I so far found 2 places, an old guy next to the river and the hunter, both of which give quests. It's very nice to have the option of earning some extra money. I do miss seeing what the reward is beforehand, but could be I just didn't see it and it was there? Anyway, I think this is a great addition.

And then the cons...
- ROADS, this game is in desperate need of roads! Why is it I can apparently design a building, roof, foundation, walls, you name it... But I can't put down any paths or roads?
- Fences... I'm pretty sure the person who designed the fences in this game did it with the intent to drive people nuts. And it worked. You can only make fences snap on one side. So too bad if you want to build the other way. Want to build it straight? Yeah, good luck figuring out when it's straight. From this angle it sort of looks good... Oh but the other angle seems wrong... Let's just try again... Over and over and over. Do you have a mild case of OCD, this game is not it for you, keep on looking!
(On this topic btw, why not make it so that if you want something straight or want to turn 90 degrees, to make it so you can click a button or ctrl or shift or something to make it 'snap'.)
- Driving, oh good god the driving... There is only 1 word for this, horrible. I'm a person who likes to be careful, avoid hitting others, don't go too fast, take my time... Yeah, I gave up on that in this game. Just bash through, hope for the best and usually come to a complete standstill with my car flipped over because some teeny tiny tree was in the way. I read someone say the car feels like it's programmed to hit every single tree and it really does feel that way. And even if you want to stay on the road, the speed makes it pretty much impossible. Me driving around usually goes a bit like: 'okay slooowly, slow, slow, NO SLOW! Darn it, oh I'm so sorry, I hope I didn't break your car, oh watch out, WATCH OUT, where is the damn break when you need it, go backwards, NO, backwards! Oh... Well I guess I can fly over this fence, that works I suppose. Who am I to disagree....
- I'm a bit confused why I can't pick up things once I build them. Like, if I want to put my chicken coop somewhere else, too bad, nothing to do, only thing you can do is break it down. Even small stuff like fences. And even when I want to build something and put the blueprint down, can't change that either. Nope, have to go to demolition mode and then build it again.
- The game to me feels a bit tedious after a while. I'm not sure this is true, I've only played 6 hours so I could be wrong. It seems the focus is mainly on keeping animals (which makes sense ofc) but it just feels boring. I'd love to be able to name my animals. Have some more options in caring for them. So far it seems all you do is build an enclosure, buy animals, feed them and water them, hope they breed and rinse and repeat. But again, it could be there is more to this game, I'm sure I haven't fully seen all the options yet.
- The amount of things you can make feels very limited to me. I know that's not the main focus of this game, but considering there are so many options in house building, why not also give some more options in other things? For example, multiple different options for fences, maybe some flower patches, maybe a dog with a doghouse?
Also, I broke down the fences and entrance arch thing, only to discover that as far as I can tell there is no replacement for that. I tried putting fence gates instead, but since they don't snap in place and I can only attach fences to the right side it gets ridiculous.
- Hunting... I'm from Europe, and guns here are already not exactly a common thing. So when I have to try my hands on hunting in a game, I tend to just sort of, freak out. Not the game makers faults really, they said very clearly hunting is one of the things you do. I must've not read that though because I did not like the wolf that attacked me at all and by the time I figured out which button it was to get the gun out, I was already dead. Second time I didn't really fare any better, making me reconsider my attempts on making some extra money. Not my thing, I'll just stick to chickens. (although to be fair, when you grab a fertile egg, chicken mums go mental too and they pack a punch, so really, vicious game :P)
- Also, did I miss a health bar somewhere or doesn't it exist? Considering the many things out to kill you in this game, a health bar sounds like a must-have.

It could very well be that my expectations for this game just weren't on par with what the game actually is. I guess I was hoping for more farming and less hunting. And I will admit I come from having house flipper as my number 1 favorite game so I'm pretty spoiled when it comes to customization and building options. So maybe I'm just not the right public for this game :) Anyway, the game definitely has potential and some good starts. Right now I would not recommend it, but like I said, that might just be because it's not my taste.

Overall, especially considering the game is still in early access, Ranch Sim is a great game. It allows the player to build freely on their property, including blueprints for things like walls and windows in case you'd prefer to design your own buildings. You also have free range of the world to hunt and cut down trees for extra wood. The layout of the buildings in relation to the ranch is a bit confusing at first but grows on you over time, and eventually those hairpin turns become quirks of the trip instead of annoying directional distractions. The actual ranching aspect of the game is also nice. You can buy chickens, pigs, cows, and goats to raise and either slaughter or use to get produce. At stores you can buy products to help you along, such as meat grinders and milk buckets. The graphics are very nice, even if you have a slower computer and need to put them down (like me). The first and third person view options are also useful for driving in reverse versus doing things on the ranch. Now to get into some of the specifics:

Pros:
- beautiful graphics, even on low settings
- variety of animals to raise
- multiple ways to play (ranching, hunting, farming, etc.)
- free range on your ranch to build and design it how you like
- free car at the beginning, negating any unnecessary walking before grinding for a car
- good control mechanics, using mainly left click and E as interact buttons and WASD for movement (including driving)
- variety of products to buy from the stores to make your job easier as you get enough money to buy them
- gas is not ridiculously expensive like it often is in these types of games

Cons:
- sometimes the controls in first person mode can be difficult because the character sways from side to side as you move the mouse, often causing you to misclick items
- there are few directions on how to actually utilize the products from the stores and how to get your ranch going after the tutorial
- driving controls are very sensitive and sometimes cause you to run into trees
- metal is extremely expensive
- you cannot rebuild the arch at the entrance to your ranch if you remove it for any reason
- you cannot rebuild the garage if you remove it for any reason
- bears sometimes appear in store areas
- deer will literally change directions to make you run into them
- animals eat a lot of food compared to how expensive it is to buy it
- you cannot sell some items back to the stores

To go into a little more depth on the cons:

When you go into the build menu, which is very nicely put together by the way, there is no explanation on any of the builds. While this might seem unnecessary for stuff like houses, things like preserving bins would be nice if they had a little more detail in the descriptions (for raw or salami or cooked meat, etc.). It would also be nice if you could change your view to be wider once you have a blueprint selected, since a lot of the time you can't see the area around what you're placing (important for things like connecting fences).

Another serious problem I've found is the price of food. $30 a bag doesn't seem like much when you start with over a thousand dollars, but after you buy animals you'll quickly realize they eat a lot. Chickens' eggs sell for very little, and with hens only laying once a day, they're not a great method of making money. Pigs, being the next animal up in price, are much better. They can be bought and fed until they're big enough to be slaughtered for profit meat. The problem here comes with the feeding part. Two pigs (a male and a female) eat about one bag of food a day. If the female becomes pregnant and has 4ish babies, you're suddenly going through three bags a day. Add chickens into that (eggs increase the selling price of meat), and you're using up bags as quickly as you can buy them. Eventually you'll run out of money, be unable to buy more food, and lose half or more of your animals to starvation before they're ready to be slaughtered for profit. Either the price of food needs to be decreased, or animals need to eat less, because right now it's incredibly hard to get your ranch off the ground.

Speaking of that, there's no directions as to what to do after you complete the tutorial. Nowhere in the game can you easily get information like how eggs increase meat profit, boiling sausages on a stove increases profit, there's a drying room in a ranch house, animals die immediately once their food bar runs out (which can be within a day), you can't sell back concrete or metal, etc. It would be nice if you could complete some sort of notebook within the game that has these things written down so that not everything is so hard to learn.

The barn design is another thing that bothers me. The stall doors only open/close from the outside, so getting an animal to stay inside while you close the door is really hard. You cannot make the floor anything but grass, so eggs get lost and water piles up from the rain (even though you have a roof). The windows cannot be closed. Side doors only open in two separate pieces--you can't latch them together like in real barns and make it a single piece door, so opening and closing it can be a chore. The barn is peeling in paint and old-looking as soon as it's built, which would be fine except everything else the player builds looks brand new. It'd be nice if the barn reflected that too. Some animals are a little big for the barn stalls, so it'd be nice if you could expand the barn more than three times (which is already a small barn to begin with) and have bigger stalls.

Notes for the developers:
- make food less expensive or make animals eat less
- make it possible to sell back things like concrete and metal
- make it possible to sell unprocessed wood for quick cash
- make the barn stall doors able to be closed/opened from the inside
- make it possible to close the barn windows to prevent rain from coming inside
- add a flashlight (it gets pitch-black at night and you only have mounted lights and your car's headlights)
- make it take longer for animals to starve (like maybe more than a single day please?)
- make eggs more profitable or make chickens produce more so that they're actually worth having around
- add instructions on how the rest of the game works beyond the basic tutorial
- make the barn have an actual floor (and maybe add buyable bags of shavings for the animals)
- make the side barn doors able to be one piece instead of two
- fix the field of view in first person mode so that holding items (like bags of wheat, for example) and viewing blueprints doesn't block the view of what's in front of you/where you're trying to place it
- fix the weird swaying motion that makes it hard to click on things in first person mode
- PLEASE make built items moveable! I should be able to pick up and move a small table, like come on
- half of what you got from building something when you break it should be more like three quarters, especially if they're immovable once placed down
- I've also experience a lot of having to click items three or four times before it registers (which isn't my mouse or computer because I've never had that problem before) so maybe see about looking into that

Overall, I would recommend this game, especially in early access, because I think it has a lot of potential and is fun to play right now. You can easily sink six straight hours into this game. But be warned that there are a lot of little frustrating things that can be improved (and hopefully will be) as the game progresses in development.

Let me start off by saying -- I love the concept of this game, seriously, I really do love it. It is so much fun to build and play with friends. I can't wait to see in a year or two where this game ends up. It has the most amazing bare bones potential (like a much more fun, creative. and open world version of Farming sim). However, despite the amazing amount of potential, it currently sits as a very aggravating and difficult game to ignore the bad and just play for the fun. My reasons are as follows: 

1. Tedious (example: one hit chops down a whole tree, but you have to hold in a button to cut it up into pieces to carry, then you can only carry 1/8 pieces and then tediously arrange them in the back of your vehicle instead of just click and go, meaning it takes me 10-20 irl minutes to just arrange a couple of logs into the vehicle and a whole day cycle, forcing me to drive at night, then you get back to manually feed logs one at a time into the sawmill; 1 piece giving you only 2 planks. It would be so nice to have an option to move all the logs into a holder that can slow feed into the sawmill so you aren't wasting hours just trying to get enough planks to build growing beds, which take 18 planks even though the log holder which is much larger only takes 12 planks, make it make sense; and don't you dare hit the same button you've been using up to this point, it folds up the whole machine and you have to start over again)

2. Glitchy (example: the steering controls are absolutely garbage, I know it's one of the more difficult things in every game to get right, however, you feel like a teen learning to drive in a golf cart -- touching the gas thrusts you at 100mph in a direction and turning takes continually holding in the button hoping it will eventually start turning, but you don't, so you have to hit the brakes and slide for a bit before stopping then turn the wheel before hitting the gas again and starting the process over; pretty much you spend 8 minutes getting yourself unstuck and 1 minute of actually driving to the location. The NPC/other cars on the road don't have headlights, or any AI at all, they bounce/gyrate/flip/slam into each other for zero reason or just block up a whole road because they just randomly float into the air and flip upside down and never move again. You get to a point where you just decide to run everywhere, but you can only carry one single item back and forth)

3. Grinding for days just to afford anything (example: Everything in the game is so expensive to buy with little return in profits, for the sheer amount of work you have to do to make it start to work, you blow through your money just buying the bare essentials. In the 8 in-game days we played, the 2 chickens and 1 rooster plowed through about 4 bags of feed. This forced us to spend most of our time hunting bears, deer, and wolves to get enough money just to take care of the chickens, gas for the 1 vehicle, and gas for the sawmill to get the planks to continue doing ANYTHING bare essential in the game, but most things, even the 2 LAMP OPTIONS to have, y'know, light in the game, require Metal which is very expensive. Don't get me started on the expense and confusion of concrete being in kg but the blueprints just show a number, nothing about kg)

4. Confusing (example: The blueprints of chicken coops show how many chickens they can fit, but they didn't start with the bare minimum and work up, they were just tossed onto the page in random order. 2 of the coops did the same exact thing yet they didn't have the same amount of building materials, which caused me to look it up trying to figure why someone would go through the hassle just to build a more expensive coop that didn't do anything more. The well is useless, I thought it would let me refill the water faster or auto feed the water troughs, but no, none of these are it because the yellow water containers are endless, so I would leave the yellow water containers against the chicken coop and refill immediately. I still don't understand what the point was to build it in the first place other then to waste money and time. When I tried to use the well, it didn't work no matter how much I rotated my mouse causing this to feel like a combination of all the above issues. There is a huge lack of explanation in the building book or tutorial how anything actually works. Trying to sell items was aggravating because the NPC just said, "Selling is beside me" or some vague nonsense. It wasn't until later we realized it meant the pickup area for your goods was the same as drop off for selling. Why not use the same kiosk to sell since you buy through it as well? Or why not say, Selling is done in the loading/unloading area of the parking lot? Why won't it just load your bought items into your vehicle that you have to park in that designated area? It takes so much time to turn and twist items to fit in a huge bed of a truck. I know this game totes itself on realism and sandbox play, which is great, but focus on the FUN things we all want to do like farming/gardening/animal husbandry/de-forestation/destroying/building and less about, "Hold on, I have to pick up each seed packet and rotate it into the truck for 10 minutes before I get home and just rip it all out onto the ground so I don't have to waste another 10 minutes carrying one item at a time so I can enjoy gardening, building, or tending to the animals oh wait while I was talking its nighttime and I can't see because there are zero lights in this game, not on the buildings, not in the streets, not the other cars, just the sunbeam attached to your vehicle or the sunbeam attached to me that won't let me see any details of things in front of me like my building book or any objects which turn pure white in my sunbeam flashlight". Also, the chickens eggs, it is almost impossible for me to see any difference between the fertilized and unfertilized eggs, I have to check them on the useless Ovoscope and put them in the basket just so the basket could tell me which it was. Handling the eggs made me so nervous because I put so much money, time, and resources into protecting them and they can be broken just with an accidental click of the mouse or keyboard).

Nothing in this game is intuitive, you have to look up guides or reddit questions just to figure out how to use something or if it's even worth it. I'm sure this game will come out of this early access looking a lot better and hopefully leave a majority of these problems behind. I don't regret buying it (especially because it was on sale) and I will return to it someday. Until then, I'm leaving this review because it was my honest experience and I hope I can come back and fix it later. But as it stands right now, it's not a game worth playing.

I'm continuing to plug away at this game in the hope that it might be improved, however I don't really recommend buying this for more than maybe AU$20 and even then to go in with your eyes open on what you will actually get.

Certain things about this game suggest to me that this was made by a single developer or small team that is/are starting out in development. Animations are simple and game play is the kind of repetitive that you'd expect if you were playing something put together from a bunch of canned/premade modules. Also there doesn't appear to be any story beyond the introduction with the game seemingly a true open game (within limited bounds).

In saying this though, the game is OK as a time sink and as mentioned earlier, I think if you can nab it for around AU$20 then it's probably not a bad game that you can just chill out playing.

Do not waste your time or your money on this. The content is this - buy animal, breed animal, kill animal (with a pistol), "skin" the animal, put ALL the pieces of meat that fly everywhere into a cooler; that holds only 12 pieces of anything, tote cooler to wherever your storage is. Spend HOURS trying to line up a fencing system that NEVER meets corners at the end; unless you are into geometry and angles, that is what the fencing works off of. After hours of fence jiggering, you spend your time chasing the animals that walk through the fence, under the fence, over the fence and drag them all back to their respectful places. The saws take a hot a minute for one log to cut and trust when I tell you, in 28 hours of testing the game, I left the game with logs laying everywhere because they need handled way to many times to get to the end goal. It has potential, but it isn't anywhere near being even half a game yet.
