This game is a lot of fun and would totally convince people to buy this. I've already got over 80 hours in the game, at least 60 of that being in the last week. I do wish there was more to it though. It still feels like it is missing out on so much more. This game has a lot of potential. I think it is great that crops are being added and that more animals have been added. Would love to see cellars added to make wine. I wish there was more products/ recipes to make. I also think it would be cool to see neighboring ranches to do quests and sell for, maybe thats already in the game but I havent found it. I wish there was more buildings to build and more custom options. I also think fishing could be a cool option to include. Mostly want to see more cooking and creating implemented and I love that I can do everything myself, but wish there was options for more automation, because when I first started out I made the mistake of leaving all of my pigs together, therefore they kept reproducing. I had over 40 pigs and it kept me busy, but it was also extremely time consuming and I had to keep buying more and more coolers and processing it all into salami took forever even with the electric grinders, wish there was an option to load more than just one piece of meat at a time or maybe the option to build like some type of conveyor belt. I play mostly solo so when I have that much meat it takes a lot of time and can be overwhelming. Anyway these are just suggestions, hopefully the Devs see this and take it into consideration. Overall great game just wishing for more.

This is fast becoming one of my most favourite games ever :)  I love the freedom to chop down and build anywhere in such a wide, open-world setting.  The scenery is top-notch, the sunsets are beautiful, the storms are frightening - not to mention the threats from bear and wolf attacks!  The preparation for livestock, water supply, horse paddocks and greenhouses is fun, because the placements are completely up to our preferences.  Settling into the routine of feeding, chopping, watering, getting fuel, cutting planks, etc.  - all of it.  10/10 for me.  I just simply love it.  It is relaxing, fun, challenging and even more fun when you're involving friends or family in setting up your ranch.   Wonderful! :) I can highly recommend this game!

[u]My Favorite Simulator[/u]

Running a ranch without any training,
Building and painting while its still raining,
Chickens that can't fly even though they have wings,
These are a few of my favorite things!

Grinding up sausage and making some cheese,
Exploring the forest to find some more bees,
There aren't any seasons, it's always Spring,
These are a few of my favorite things!

Chopping down trees and stacking the wood,
Remembering to refill the animals food,
Keeping crops watered and cleaning drop-pings,
These are a few of my favorite things!

When the wolf bites,
When the bee stings,
When I'm feeling sad;
I simply remember that it's just a game,
and then I don't feel so bad!

I wish I could call this game a diamond in the rough, but it isn't. This game is objectively terrible in almost every way. It's buggy as hell, the collision is wonky, the driving is garbage, and we somehow glitched our car onto the surface of the fucking sun... But I still love it, and dammit if the jank isn't part of the charm.

Sure it's just a matter of time before you have more money than you know what to do with, and there's no end game or really even any objectives past "Build a bitchin ranch," but there's something to be says for sitting down with the boys, having a few beers, and just ranching the shit out of this place. Kinda captures the "just build shit" of old school Minecraft, and any game that manages to make grinding sausage fun is doing something right.

Dear Developers,

    This is my first ever review of any game, but I fell in love with Ranch Simulator. Are there things that could be worked on, absolutely, but the idea behind the game for all intents and purposes is absolutely amazing. For a new, small developer; excellent work!!!!! i would buy this game as is for damn near any price. I've logged almost 300 hrs on this one game. I'm not very fluent in some computer terms so please bare with me. I will list some changes that might improve game play and and just make it that much better. 

   The List 
 1. Building materials such as brick and steel would be a nice addition. having choices for foundation and and walls.
 2. Having household appliances to interact with and use. 
 3. Furniture that we can build or buy.
 4. Horse mechanics could use a overhaul. being able to rope and herd animals on a ranch is quite essential to the smooth running of said ranch. Example, Red Dead Redemption 2 by Rockstar has good horse mechanics.
 5. The rate at which time passes could be slowed down a little bit. you run out of time with still a load of work to do. That's for real close to simulation!!!!!
 6. A deep freeze for storing meat and a refrigeration unit to haul to sell point.
 7. Being able to buy food items needed for recipes if not raising that particular item ourselves.
8. Sawmill to haul logs to would be a welcome addition to the game as well.
 
    Overall, Ranch Simulator is the kind of game that I've longed to play for some time now. Excellent work you guys and keep up the good work!!!!

Being able to decide to use animal products for sale like cheese or milk or slaughtering the animals for sausage.  I like that farming is now a thing in the game. Two complaints are the lack of a pause feature in single player and lack of auto save.  I had to use the bathroom this morning while playing.  It wasn't a short bathroom break so I had to quit to the menu in order to go.  Also my computer crashed this morning after playing for an hour, no auto save and I only saved like 15 minutes in.  I save regularly cause I am an older gamer so it is habit but auto saves would still help.

Ranch Simulator is in the EA stages - it is growing and depending on the players to give input as to what works and what doesn't.  This input is after about 30 hours of game time.

Downside first:

Ranching is difficult & expensive.  Even if you inherit grandpa's old ranch, buildings need to be replaced or repaired, equipment needs to be purchased, livestock bought, etc.  Don't expect to make a profit for the first few years.  Therefore some startup funds are needed.  In RS, they are desperately needed.

In ranching, land is the most valuable asset.  Acres and acres of open grasslands for your animals to graze: cattle, goats, sheep or whatever, they need to graze and they need lots of space.  Livestock do not live in barns.

If you grow crops, they do not go from seed to harvested fruit in 1 -2 days.  If you plant cabbage in the early Spring, they are not ready to take to market the next day.  Same with honey ...  Crops/honey need several months to mature.

In Ranch Sim world it rains twice a day - like clockwork -  sure would be a good idea to use all that rain ...

The above items lead me to seriously wonder if the development team knows anything at all about farming/ranching.

Positive:

If you like to dress in western clothing, drive an atv or pickup through the woods, and have a shooting gallery full of animals - then, Ranch Simulator is your game.

As I said in the beginning, RS is an Early Access game.  There is plenty of opportunity to turn this dark comedy into a real Ranch Simulator - profitable for the company & enjoyable for the players.  Unfortunately, it has a long way to go before it can sit in the ranks of the other simulator games.

I've been playing this with a friend, which has brought a lot of laughs. It has a long way to go, but has a lot of potential. I can see myself spending a lot of time in this game.

A few notes:
- The way the characters stand and hold stuff/tools/chickens sooooo stiffly is hilarious, but I'm assuming this will be fixed later on. Right now they look like aliens pretending to be humans and failing miserably.
- The driving... lol. It's so hard with the camera not staying static in front of the vehicle. I laugh here because my friend crashing us into trees never gets old. I'm honestly torn between wanting this to be fixed or not. Thank god we have an option to right the vehicles if they tip over. 
- Yes, there's a LOT of rain, but what bugs me the most about it is that the plants aren't watered by the rain... Why do I have to water plants when it rains? (I put the planters outside, not in a greenhouse btw) 
- There's not a whole lot to do really (there IS but there isn't really). Found a few quests, but I'm assuming this will also evolve with time.
- I'm hoping they add more ways to get resources than having to buy them. It'd be nice if we could grow out own feed or even recycle part of the old buildings or garbage. Gathering things or fishing, something, anything... lol
- Some of the graphics are a little low quality, but for an early access, it's passable.
- There are a few glitches in multiplayer, where my friend will see something I don't. Not sure why. 

All in all, I do recommend this game, but obviously, keep in mind that there's a lot of work left to do in it.

I’ve always disliked Steam’s rating system with only 2 choices: thumbs up or thumbs down, especially when so many games have so many facets to a good, average or bad review. So, for the sake of this review, I’m giving it a “thumbs down” with conditions. If I were to give it a numerical rating, I’d say it’s 2.5 out of 5 stars. I can’t recommend it, but I can’t totally crap on the game either. I know how hard game developers work, especially if they’re independent and have minimal staff. The game was released March 4, 2021, and it’s still showing as “Early Release,” most likely because they are such a small studio and can only do so much as far as additions, updates, etc. Toxic Dog Games also has 2 other games, but neither one involves simulation/crafting/building. There’s a lot of things that need work and the game is far from complete, but I’m going to attempt to give a better explanation behind my review and let people decide for themselves.

What I’d add/change:
A repair option instead of just demolishing everything. I mean, your grandfather left you his dilapidated ranch, you should be able to repair the structures you want to keep for half the cost of building it new.

Ladder – so you can build/demolish taller structures like roofs, etc. I can't even finish my house because even building stairs to make an attic won't let me finish my roof

Additional storage buildings

Additional decorations for your house, barn, etc.

Additional blueprints, like another garage (especially one you can attach to your house)

Animal enrichment – toys/snacks for your animals so they don’t get totally bored. Providing salt licks for your goats is a great example and they would attract more deer for hunting purposes.

Adding other animals – yes, I realize this would be getting into Farming Simulator territory, but adding more animals, like sheep and horses would benefit any ranch

Planks: 2 planks for each log? Maybe you get more planks if you buy the upgraded table saw, but even Minecraft gives you 4 planks from a basic crafted log block. IRL, a standard log can produce over 100 board feet of lumber

Concrete: Concrete is way more expensive than planks, but the reality is that concrete is actually cheaper than wood in today’s economy, so perhaps reduce the cost of concrete.

I’m sure there’s more that will be added to this list, but for now, I’ll end it here by saying don’t buy the game at full price – wait for it to go on sale for about $10-$15 – the holidays are coming up in December!

Its hard to give this game a thumbs down. It is so much fun and so many things to add together and figure out in order to make more money. For an early access game, the features and play through is so relaxing it can be played for hours. Except for one thing...RAIN!!!!!! 

The rain literally drops my FPS from an average 100 to an average 10. It makes it almost unplayable when the rain starts. There is an option to "disable thunderstorms" that does absolutely nothing. It rains every day in-game and lasts for almost 30 minutes real time. I like the idea of the rain feature but the application is atrocious.

8/10 without the rain.
2/10 with rain.

There are a few things that I like and don't like about this game.

The good?  You can kill bears, wolves, deer, and livestock to sell the meat and get yourself feed for the rest of your livestock to produce more livestock because livestock.  You can build up the ranch to look how you want it to look (to a certain level) and just enjoy playing with other people.

The bad?  The driving mechanics are all over the place, cannot grow ANYTHING except for livestock (other farming sims exist that allows for both livestock and crops btw), you are starting off with almost nothing, you can almost get nothing based on which day of the week has a special for you.  You spend more time running back and forth to the gas station than actually building up anything, playing in single player does not allow for a revival (you have to wait for one of your friends who don't have the game to join you just to revive you) all the POI's are spread out way too far (why does it take an hour in game to go to a feed store, and there is no road to connect to the gate at the hardware store?) there is currently 0 mods to help this game expand and become more fun.

If you love to work for game play, then this game will have that covered for you, especially after a long day (or night) of working at your real job.  You will have the most fun just struggling to get that $30 bag of feed per day, and if you are starting out, then you are just simply screwed!

If you want to play another farming simulation game, I would suggest to not come to this one for the time being.  Maybe come back to the game once it is out of Early Access.

REVISE 1; So, I've managed to get further, animals die within 12 hours in game time if they are not fed, and the well is a HUGE WASTE of time!  You have to "manually" crank that by having your mouse rotate in BIG, SLOW circles.  Not many people have the space for that!  I have to use a pillow to even attempt that!  Also been trying to figure out how to use the grinder and (like everything else you buy) there is no guide in how to use the grinder.  You just feed it meat, and the meat falls to the ground.  Forever lost.  I may bump this up to a 1.5 star if there was a small tutorial or guide to use the items that you buy (minus the food since that is self-explanatory).  Still a fairly bad game, more so when you have such rediculous tasks like "CRANK THE WELL".  Just have me press WASD to crank the well wheel!  It would at least be a mini game in the game and hold some level of fun instead of friends fighting on who gets the water.

Welcome to Ram Ranch! If you like watching animals fuck and lay eggs, this is the game for you! If you also like to aimlessly drive around a developing town while causing quite the ruckus, enjoy! I personally enjoy the Broke Back Mountain vibe mixed with a little civil war gun-play as you kill your battle butty with a winchester or 6-shooter. Don't throw raw meat into a grinder unless you have the proper equipment to catch it, otherwise you splooge all over the floor. Also ol' MacDonald plays on the radio. 69/10.

Its a little bit "grindy" and a little bit boring if playing Single Player, but I've been enjoying the beautiful scenery. The development team is actively pushing out updates and taking their customer's feedback into consideration, which is a huge bonus. Its like hi def stardew valley set in what looks like Montana, but with less to do (keeping in mind this is Early Access, too).

Some of the bugs and graphics are just hilarious (picking up the chicken, for example). I wouldn't get it full price, but absolutely if its on sale. I'd say around the $15 mark is a fair price for this game in its current state.

[UPDATED]
I desperately want to give this game a positive review. The game itself has a lot of fun features. I was happy to see that farming animals is not the only way to make money. The quests have a lot of potential in the future, and to my surprise for an early access game it performed exceedingly well! 

However.. the advertised multiplayer which is built on Epic Online Services is atrocious. The game asks you to sign in every time you visit the main menu which is annoying but can be avoided. The biggest blocker for me is that my entire friend group including myself were not able to play together. The session based multiplayer is broken, and after following the FAQ guidelines, and discussing this with the support team in Discord there was no resolution. I told them I'm going to hang up the game for now until it's hopefully more developed down the line. Good luck to anyone else, this is a fun game and it has a bright future.

[UPDATE]
After having a handful of helpful conversations with the Ranch Sim team I was able to sort out my multiplayer issues. It seemed like the fix was a combination of walking through the provided FAQ and some tinkering on my own side.

TLDR; Solved issues with help from the Ranch Sim team, completely recommend this game even in it's current state. It's insanely fun, and the team pushes frequent updates.

Even then you still have to make a cow farm, a chicken farm and a goat farm. So there's really no way to get good fps if you want to make an actual farm.

3) If you want to play the beehive update, you best spend several days hunting for bees prior to buying animals for the ranch, or you will have to neglect the care of the ranch to hunt for the bees
4) To assist with the previous issue, it would be nice to hire some hands to help with the ranch
5) The ability to breed and sell horses instead of just training them which is tedious and boring

The other smaller issues I have can be worked around, such as having to reset everything each time you restart, such as honey barrels, crockpots, turning lights on......
Should the issues mentioned be addressed in the future, I would be willing to change my review and recommendation.

The game is a mess and shouldn't be sold in its current state.  Needs significantly more development time to fix major issues.  Labeling the game as "early access" is apparently an excuse to peddle barely-functional product.  Here's a short list of frustrating issues constantly encountered. 
-Unreliable multiplayer.  Half the players couldn't connect (some couldn't start game) due to multiple issues
-players falling through the world
-vehicles and tools lost because they randomly shoot into space or fall into the world, with no way to recover or reset them
-Animals just randomly die (even when fully fed/watered etc.)
-vehicle steering is hilariously bad and frustrating
-camera while driving will induce seizures if you decide to go down a hill
-gun play is extremely awkward.  Close range targets often result in the character shooting the ground or itself regardless of targeting.

At the $24.99 price tag, this has to be a hard pass.

It is improving, I just wish it was a little more focus on actual ranching, Ranch builder would probably be a better description for it. It is fun to build in this game, it's fun to hunt in this game, it's fun to have animals and have the money you make actually make sense, the pricing in this game is awesome they did a great job with that, visually it's a very beautiful game. I really want to love this game bc it's such a good concept, and im hoping by the time everything is finished it will be amazing. however things I think need to be improved upon as someone who grew up on a ranch;

There needs to be tack for the horses, that comes off and is stored in a horse trailer or a tack shed, hitching posts for horses, the ability to take off the saddle, the ability to take down the jumps in the round pen (ranching has really nothing to do with hunter jumper as that is an english designated riding style NOT a western one.), Roping practice, the Ability to start horses from the bottom when they have low stats, putting pack saddles on, lunging, grooming horses, ground work, using your horse to gather livestock, drag calves to branding etc. Ability to have more than one horse and breed them and sell babies and papered and non papered horses with different stats, The auction house should give you the ability to purchase different animals not just horses and get good prices for culls out of your herd, there should be a fall shipment, a semi comes and you load your calves and lambs on it for the fall and depending on the year get different money for them per head. I can't stand how small the cattle are, the herefords are tiny, in reality those are 1500 lb cows, I know bc we own them lol they are far from small. There is no chute to work cows, no cedirs to get them all on the same ovulation to put them out with the bull, etc, no vaccines, no cows that need calves pulled, you cant band male calves to make them steeers. also Herefords are not milk breeds, they are a meat only breed, Jersey's are milk breeds and can produce several gallons a day. The florida cracker that looks like it was based off a Holstein would be a better model for a dairy breed as theyre built like a dairy breed. 

Domestic pigs largely use farrowing crates to have babies other wise they kill them, either by eating them or smashing them, breeds like the Kune Kune which are hairy are breeds that can farrow in the field.

I'd love the addition of dogs, Livestock Guardian dogs that you train to stay with the animals and kill wolves and fox that could come onto your property and kill your animals. Cattle and sheep dog breeds for gathering animals with cues you can use to push them places like up to upper pastures, etc.

Ducks, quail, phesant, turkey would be welcomed but im not too bothered by just the chickens i think theyre done well and the fact they just lay eggs anywhere is so realistic, the roos get mean, etc. the only thing I would add is ask to add in a blue egger, you could use the brown chickens to lay blue eggs as Cream Legbars, then a simple egg genetics would be awesome, Blue + white = baby who lays blue, blue + tan = baby who lays green, white + tan = tan, etc blue is dominant in all eggs and that's true to real life, it would be a fun addition, but again doesn't break me. I would like the ability to sell chicks and hatching eggs per dozen for a different price, you could ship them out through mail or just at the general store. 

Fairs would be awesome. 

Crops which I know are coming, I just hope it wont be just wheat and corn bc you really need grass hays, Brome, Orchard, Timothy, and Alfalfa and the ability to do large and small bales, bale feeders, etc. 

The way you sit on the horse is so weird also, its incorrect posture and the horses run more like how dogs run.

I'd love to be able to cook also but that one really wouldnt bother me if it never came into the game.

I know that sounds like a lot but those are things that would launch this game into being more realistic and an actual competitor to Farm Simulator.

All in All, if I ignore all of that I can  usually sit and play this for a few days straight then hang it up, It's a pretty relaxed game with fun things like animals attacking you that makes it enjoyable. It's just not one I would play for long periods of time at a time.

Also needs a way to show the Gender of baby animals, i have over 100 Pigs because they give birth to groups between 2-6 and cant get to the males or females in time before they Breed. I only started off with 2 pigs.

320+ hours in...hooked.
I dont play multiplayer.
Yes it can be repetitive and a little glitchy, but it is what you make of it and the glitches can be funny. 
Don't know why i seem to be a deer magnet?! 
The only glitches i have is the inability to open and shut gates without pressing it twice, and i have a door that i can walk through without opening. (As i found out when Sausage the pig escaped) 
Love the fact its very hands on, you want to build a fence? Go cut down a tree, carry the log, cut the log, pick up the planks, carry the planks. I have completely rebuilt my ranch a number of times and its getting bigger and better. 
Only thing i dislike are the horses, and i'm a horsey person. The glowing yellow eyes, the fact you cant do anything with them but ride and whats with the tack on when not being ridden. Horses in fields running round with saddles on, urgh. 
At the moment (i hear its coming later this year) there are no crops, this is a milk/cheese, meat/sausage/meatballs and egg making game, although you don't have to do any of that you can just raise pigs for meat which i believe is the fastest way to make money.
Anyway, if you want a farm game where you can decide what to put where, and you want a world where you drive to shops to but things and also to sell produce this game is worth looking at.

There are some good elements and would probably be fun if you want a single player game, but if you want a coop game, then don't bother.  I bought it to play with friends and we had fun for a couple of hours... until someone fell through the world while driving our cart, which was 
 carrying a bunch of supplies we had just bought.  The player was able to log out and get back in, but the cart and supplies were gone.

Understanding it's early access, we tried to find a workaround, like console commands to regain the items, but found none.  There also seems to be only 1 save slot, so we can't go to an earlier save.   So we're stuck with a game where you're supposed to earn money and buy items... yet you can lose them to a glitch at any moment and have no way to get them back.  That makes it pointless to even play, and early access or not, that's not acceptable.

I would say check back later, except I see in the forums it's not an uncommon issue, and the response has usually just been to ask for the host's PC specs which doesn't give me confidence it will ever be fixed.

So I don't usually like to leave reviews until I've hit around the 150 hour mark, just so that I can say I gave something a shot, but I've went a little over 450 hours in this game and still go in and find things to do in it. Be it from revamping the layout or seeing how high I can make my cash stores, trying new tips and tricks on how to be more efficient as a single player with (often far too many animals because I forget to thin the herd) to actually produce things like sausage, meatballs, cheese. So while it's my cuppa because I like things I can just meander around on. There are pros and cons to everything.

Pros: 
* The devs are great about keeping to their road map and as a whole listening to the community and what they want from the game.
*Plenty of space- Grandpa left you a massive piece of land that actually goes back farther than you think for building.
*Variety of activities and animals with more constantly being developed!
*Solo playable - It's all about your managing the time and now with the feature to extend the day light hours and make the time tick by slower in game, you can achieve a lot more.
* If you like simulators or farming games then you will love this game, it has it all and the ability to make everything kinda custom to you building and vehicle wise between free build and colorization makes a world of difference. So if you are a builder or someone that loves animals ( Just remember you -do- have to kill some of them though) this is a good one for you. Side note if you are a horse lover and just like plodding along on a beautiful beastie, well that's another plus.

Cons:
*Sometimes there are bugs (As you know, early access and beta and new games usually have) Usually the bugs are small and easily patch fixed. The devs are good about staying on top of it. It's only a con because there -are- some bugs that appear. Most of the bugs are rather harmless though and more annoying than game breaking. 
*It is semi grindy. ONLY when it comes to 12 pieces of meat in a cooler x 4 million pigs and 22-26 pieces of meat per pig lol. So like most simulation or survival games, you will have to grind and in the very beginnings with the small amounts of money that you get? It can be a bit stressful, but I promise once you get past the first time it's a breeze and there are tons of tips and tricks  to make it seem less grindy.
*Rain for days. I only put this as a con because there is no way to limit the amount of rain storms you get. Seeing as they plan on implementing planting and harvesting etc, the rain being gone or turned off would be a bad thing, but limiting the amount of times a day you're getting drenched and/or the scenary is so  dark you have to mess with the gamma just to not use the headlamp would be amazing to see changed.

Other than that I would say, if you are looking for a game that kinda gives you an all around ranch experience that you are able to add your own twist on.. This is the one to try. Plus you can always join the discord and find ranch hands, I'm just selective when it comes to gaming with others. I hope this helps!

First, I would like to say this game was an alright attempt at being a simulator.

That being said, there are a LOT, and I mean,  A LOT of glitches that break the game.  Some of the glitches make it fun, others make this game unplayable.  Maybe in the future if they fix more of the problems I could recommend it, but right now I cannot, in my right mind, recommend this game.

Funnier glitches: Your car won't break...  That being said, you can literally drive a car up a cliff-side if you're talented enough.  That was hilariously fun.
Trailers in multiplayer for the person not hosting the game might flip around like crazy.
Cars in multiplayer have the chance of bucking around.
Cows (haven't seen other animals) have the chance at nighttime to float around with their eyes closed

Game breaking glitches that make the game unplayable:
Gate Doors meant for foundation houses don't work the way they are supposed to work.  One of them you can phase through, so can your animals.  Don't use the gate doors ever for a custom barn house.  (Seriously, unless you want to lose your cows/pigs/chickens because they phased through a door, DO NOT do it.)
Sometimes getting hit by a car in the game will shunt you 300-500 meters away from where you were hit.  This is bad.
The bullets are slow enough that if you run at the thing you are chasing, sometimes you can kill yourself BY COMPLETE ACCIDENT'.
You cannot reset a quest or abort a quest despite there being a button for it.
In multiplayer if you stand too close to a trailer or car that has a filled up back end, you start dealing with a 'yoyo effect' where you bounce off the vehicle over and over again.

----
Pros: Hilarious glitches.
If you're into that sort of thing, it's easy to earn money in the game.
The building system is easy and intuitive to use. You can even lay down your own blueprint.
The game is overall promising, it just needs more polishing.

Cons: With some of the glitches being as bad as they are, the game is not very playable for long.
You can earn money too fast, leaving you with nothing to do except grind more meat, dry it, and make more money.  This is boring.
You can't abort a quest with the current issues with the game.
You can repeat special quests over and over again and make more money than what you can feasibly spend it on.
(I can repeat the Ancient Treasures over and over again and make a solid 2.5k as often as I desire).

If they fix the glitches and make it harder to earn money, or even make it so things you buy have a higher value, then this game might be quite the gem.  Right now, I can only hope they address a lot of these bugs, in the meantime, I cannot recommend this game.

All in all its a great game, a game to relax to but also scratches that creativity itch you might have. Lets just say I haven't put it down for a week. 8/10

Absolutely love this game. A few things i would like to see or change.

Instead of only having that world available to the one person who invites everyone, once they join the game you should make that world available on their end as well. That way they can do everything you can. I.E. save the game, go to auction etc. just as you can. 
2. Breeding horses! I would love, love, love that. 
3. Being able to have a farm of some sort so you can make your own grains to feed animals/ cook with.  
4. GTFO with these deer man.... make them walk instead of just jumping everywhere. It can be fun to see sometimes but just not all the time.
5. Possibly making the vehicles easier to manage as well. Its either stop or go no in-between. 
6. Add more animals!! At the general store there are goats and sheep, but they're not available... Would love to see more animals for sure.

It's a fun game no doubt.  There are some bugs and some aspects of the game that could be changed, but the creators seem to be doing a great job about listening to the community and implementing the changes that the players want.

*Don't believe my hours as I typically play steam games offline.* That being said, this game is incredible. Short Version: buy this game as it recieves consistent updates and is already in a finished level of gameplay. Less bugs than most 1.0 games and quality game play. 

Now for TLDR version: this game is incredibly fun in it's current state. You start with little money and there is some grind involved (though not too bad and is fun to grind). You build up your Grandfather's dilapidated farm and make it your own. The devs have added free building to go with their very quality pre fabricated buildings. You can now build the ranch buildings of your dreams for the most part including houses and barns amongst others. The animal breeding is quite fun as watching your ranch grow from one hen and one rooster to 40 chickens and 27 pigs along with 18 cows is extremely rewarding. Also you earn the most of your money by using animal products to make milk, cheese, and meat products to sell. This is also an enjoyable process. They have also added a quest system that is fun and engaging. These are a good way to earn some money early game. I can't wait for the September update with agriculture too! Seriously, buy this as you won't be disappointed. For gameplay vids I recommend checking out GameEdged videos on YouTube. 

To surmise: very few to no bugs, fun gameplay loop, replayability is there, multiplayer capable (I haven't tried personally), easy 50+ hours playtime  though can definitely be into the hundreds of hours as they continue adding multiple things. I personally have 200+ hours as most is played offline. I rate games on a dollar per hour basis so 10/10.
Take care and enjoy this masterpiece!

Is this game worth it? Not right now.

However, I still recommend it. I really love the idea that they're putting out there and I know it's not a farming simulator, but I think it'd be cool to have crops still since there's unfortunately not too much that can be done. This could also just be due to it being in EA and that's fine too.

However, I think it's too early to be in EA. I spent 2.6 hours on this game and finished everything that could essentially be done. Added with what the other reviewers are saying-it's good bones but it's just that. Bones.

Additionally, I spent so much time gathering resources for a house and I can't even decorate the house? It comes fully furnished which was utterly depressing. I assumed I could build my house myself and/or if I bought blue prints for one, I could build my furniture and and paint it however I desired, etc. 

With completing everything that can be done within a few hours, including building my house that I-and I say this with so much bitterness-cannot decorate myself, I don't think it is worth it at this time.

This looks like an interesting game with a lot of mechanics but really it's just a boring grind fest;

One of the first 'quests' you do is to demolish a dilapidated house that was left for you however to demolish it you need to start from the roof and work down 3 storeys destroying Light fixture > Wall paper> Sheet panelling > Wall frame, 4 different clicks for one wall frame. It takes about 15-20 minutes to remove the full house.

Next the buildings require say *200* wooden planks, you have to pick each individual wooden plank up and put it in the right spot on the building, however you can't path through them once they're placed. 

Might be more fun with other players but as a solo player there's just very little reward. 

Camera and graphics are a bit janky to control as well, camera when driving will occasionally rotate around you and you'll be looking at the car going forward? As in unable to see anything infront of you as you're now looking behind you
I love this game

The content in this game is anemic. I don't understand why so many of the reviews are positive. Is it because you can glitch the physics engine and launch ATVs to the moon? If so a dev should build a game based off of that because clearly it garners interest.

Anyway, to sum this game up you spend an hour finishing the annoying tutorial and then building a pen to hold your pigs. Aaaand that's it, you're basically done, congrats. The game becomes a waiting simulator. 

Pigs are the most profitable thing to breed, and once you realize that it makes the rest of the light content useless.

Why build chickens when I can just put those resources into more pigs? Therefore all those chicken coop buildings? Yup don't need to touch any of those.

Same with cows. I mean I guess you could breed cows... and milk them... for fun... but money wise it's pigs pigs pigs. 

At the end of the day what this leaves you with is the choice of managing a progressively larger fence filled with pigs, or messing with chickens or cows for less pay than you'd get managing pigs. 

It's such a weird design choice. Where's the rest of the content? Why can't I grow crops to feed my animals with? And if I use higher quality crops that I did a good job growing, it bolsters the stats and value of my animals? Why are pigs an inherently more profitable animal than chickens or cows? Aren't all equally important and therefore valuable ultimately?

Why can't I show my animals at a weekly or monthly "showing" of the biggest cows or pigs or whatever in the neighborhood?

Why can't I skin animals and salt the skins and sell those? Where's the tannery mechanics?

Overall this game just needs more. It's so barebones. I don't understand the positive reviews at all.
Need more animals to be hunt for faster money!!

Lots of room for additional content, but yea, that's what it feels like to be taking care of two dozen chickens. =D

I think this might be the jankiest game I've ever played.

If you took all the jankiest elements from the current champions of jank - Gold Rush: The Game, The Infected, Subsistence, etc and cobbled them together, you'd have this game.

Some of the gameplay mechanics are just comically bad. Some examples (by no means exhaustive):

- To use the well you need to rotate your mouse about in huge circles to turn the crank instead of just pressing a key.
- When you're driving downhill the camera will inexplicably pan behind you.
- When you contain animals in a barn/pen as soon as you open a door they all bolt like you opened the door and threw in a flashbang.
- Driving a vehicle in general is farcical. It really has to be seen to be believed.
- The world is utterly empty, the only people you'll come across are 5 or so static NPCs sat in chairs.
- Animals to hunt are far too rare, and their spawn/respawn are unreliable and buggy.
- Chicken farming is utterly broken. Not only do they eat more food than pigs, their products are near worthless.
- Everything is a chore. Get in a car, press F to start it. Why not just have it auto start? I'm never going to just sit in the car to listen to the radio. Maybe realism lol? Ok then why does the generator on the table saw auto-start when I refuel it?
- Vehicles move like they're stuck in mud, forget gentle movements to slowly reverse to connect a trailer, it's all stop or all go.
- Parts of the UI are garbage. E.g. Picking up planks is the same button as dropping planks, and the same button as picking up the table saw. So unless you click precisely picking up planks will turn into a pick up/drop loop and picking up the table saw.
- Constructed elements can't be moved, only destroyed, and you get back maybe 15-20% of the resources.
- Saving your game is laughable, you can only save at "save points" in the world like a 90s super nintendo game.
- No ability to pause the game.
- Night is way too dark, car lights are way too bright.
- Your initial golf cart buggy can store more items than the large pickup truck as the wheel arches in the pickup prevent you placing stuff near them.
- Storing fuel cans on the roof rack of your pickup truck prevent you from transporting livestock in the back.

However, despite all this ultra jank it's still a kind of fun game, I think because the core game loop is engaging. It's kind of like how a really bad film might be entertaining, because it's funny bad.

This game is to PC gaming like Clayton Prince's "Black Ninja" is to movies.

The game is not what i thought it was! The title says Ranch but its more of dairy and pig farm then actual Ranch. However thats probably because Ranch and farm are the same in Wales and not the same in NA. So if you think you are going to actually be working a ranch, herding cattle and working them, using horse back and training horses to do more then jump a set of hurdles, well like me you will be sadly mistaken and feel misled by the title. You can buy beef cattle from a general store as opposed to a sale barn or auction which the game needs both. It has horse auction. The next update you can grow wheat and harvest that so again far more farm then ranch as the only crop would be hay really. However the game has a ton and mean a ton of potential. It offers the ability to build your own and not just use prefab so thats nice, Has some quest that are goofy but and a little fun. The hunting is a nice change and a welcomed one. You can have some fun with the game this far as i got on the sale and have gotten my moneys worth out of it by doing a little pvp with my friends and silly  stuff. If you are part of the working cowboy life then i wont recommend this to you as a ranch sim but a farm style game i will!! I cant at this time 100% recommend it as some one who has worked on ranches but as the game grows i can always change my view!!

This is my ultimate game! Raising chickens, cows, pigs and training horses while making products from what they give you, for some reason I have found my favorite genre of games. It's early access so I know some things still need to be polished, but so far I love it!

SO! I love this. Challenging and fun, but the learning curb isnt so steep its frustrating. Its off to an awesome start! Love the character customization, I wish they had more options for makeup, hairstyles and clothes, but I get that the look of your farmer isnt a priority. Other fun things they could add- I would love to be able to name my animals. I realize thats a farming thing, you dont name food, but I am very fond of my pigs and I call them Herb and Myrtle and it would be cool if I could enter that in. If you're looking for realistic, you should also add a Vet and vaccines and pregnancy checks and such. Guessing isnt as fun... Also, it would be nice if you actually incorperated actual breeds, instead of just "This is a pig. This is a cow. This is a chicken."  Maybe include a little information about each breed? I would love an option for sheep or milking goats. I would love to be able to choose my breed.  Variety is nice. Maybe an exotics option, such as game animals or the ability to cross breed. I would love a hobby farm option, maybe include rabbits and smaller breeds, such as a Kune Kune/Miniature horses?  You guys need to tweak the fence building so its more like building walls, the fences dont click right and its really frustrating.  Driving. Oh my gosh. That needs some fixing. The controls are too fine tuned until they glitch, any time you pick up speed you go off the road and crash into things, its very clunky and needs work. All in all? This game is awesome. Without all these things that could be improved, its hours of immersive game play and building and I really enjoy it so far. Not to a point where I think its worth 20 bucks...  It's certainly no Farming Simulator. I got it on sale for 15, otherwise I wouldnt have bought it. But its getting there.  I look forward to seeing how far they go with it.

All things considered, this is a great start to a game. I am enjoying it in it's early access stage even with minor glitches here and there. I'm actually surprised at how much there is to do already and I'm looking forward to the way this game evolves.

I'm always on the fence about leaving reviews for early access games, because I've played enough of them to know how much they can change in early access as new content/updates are rolled out (*cough* looking at you 7Days2Die).  But in this case I had to go ahead and leave a positive review because of the contact I had with the publishing team.  I encountered a small bug (item stuck in the back of the UTV) and shot the publishing team an email to let them know.  In less than 12 hours they had fixed the issue, sent back a corrected save file and were courteous and professional.  Again, I've played enough EA titles to know this is certainly not always the case; sometimes the team just doesn't have time to respond quickly and sometimes the dev/publishing team is just nearly hostile to the community.  So I really appreciate the attentiveness and interaction that this team has with it's growing community.

Regarding the game itself, I nabbed it on sale for around $16USD after the May 2022 content update and it's completely worth the price tag with the content available so far.  Some highlights of things I enjoy:
- The building mechanic and list of available parts (both prefabs and custom) were more extensive than I thought it would be and the snapping system works well.
- The graphics are lovely; from the animal models to your own character; the buildings, the landscape, etc.  Watching a sunset from the front porch of my farmhouse is so relaxing!
- Animal husbandry is rewarding; I love seeing chicks and piglets being born!  The feeding/watering mechanic is straight forward and not tedious.  I have gotten stuck a time or two milking my cows but it's easy enough to wiggle out of the barn wall, lol.  I've only just started getting into horses but that's been fun as well so far.
- Driving.  I hated driving at first since I felt like a hit a tree every 5 seconds.  But now that I've gotten used to the way the UTV handles and once I realized there was no penalty for hitting every other tree now I feel like my vehicle is a Skyrim horse, able to scale mountains and take me anywhere I want to go!  Need to get down the mountain from the hunter cabin quick?  Just gun the engines, jump a rock and soar your way majestically down in a physics defying tumble to land in front of the general store.  *chef's kiss*  Completely unrealistic but 100% fun.
- Questing: they aren't the most creative quests I've ever run in a video game, but it's nice to have a bit of extra cash flow in the early game and grabbing that rabbit by the scruff for the hunter is so cathartic for me, who fights to keep real rabbits out of my vegetable garden.  I wish nabbing them was that easy!

And since no game is perfect, I have some things I'd like to see changed/fixed/implemented:
- EDIT: I previously stated the hunting system was unbalanced in comparison to ranch products; I've reversed that statement now that I have a healthy amount of animals on the ranch (I experienced pig-splosion!).  The wild game is still a bit easy to shoot in my opinion though.
- If you save your game with bullets still loaded in your gun, you lose those rounds on a re-load.  Not a big deal since bullets are cheap but annoying enough to notice.  Also the reload speed is a tad slow.
- I'd love to see the option to actually pause on a single player game.  I have a 5 year old and when I have to go afk it's annoying to not be able to pause the game, especially with the disappearing bullet issue mentioned above.  Hopefully they add that down the line!


Overall if you like chill games that let you build, keep livestock, and explore beautiful landscapes pick up this title; I don't think you'll be disappointed.  Especially with the additional content they have on the roadmap!

I just bought this game and played 69 minutes (no joke), and it's just not worth the money at this time.  The character design option was very misleading, because once you start the game, it's as if you're going from high tech trailer mode into almost a 2D version of gameplay; your character sort of 'jogs' when walking, and sprints like a maniac when running.  The graphics are lacking and appear to be a very basic layout from a generic online generator.  The photos of the game are not in any way even close to what the actual game looks like (even on default settings), and night time is so dark that it's almost impossible to see anything, which I almost believe might be intentional so you have to literally wait 2 hours until daytime so you can continue, then you can't refund the game.  I should have read more of the negative reviews that say it's not worth even $10, and there's no updates or support, so I will most likely refund the game while I can.

Visually this is an unreal marketplace asset flip. Pretty much everything you see from characters to structures, textures to mechanics and menues etc is an asset from the marketplace. Lots of annoying little things like night too dark and lasting for too long making it very hard to see at night  and tedious mechanics like manually filling the gas tank, or manually having to demolish the entire house wall by wall, come on, other things can be polished besides this. Having said that, it is mildly entertaining as not much going is on and the town feels dead as with many other games of this type. This looks like a couple developers got together to create something quick lacking visual direction using assets from the unreal marketplace.

I don't recommend it for the price. If it was $5-10 I would recommend it in its current state.

Okay, so this game is pretty bad. Let me explain...

The whole game revolves around meat and cheese. There is little else to do. You can do limited building but is hindered by a lot that is wrong. The grind that you face leads you to reach an end game of a better home, chicken coop, or vehicle. That's it, and then you have this nice stuff but are now left in this hollow world. It has nice mountains, that's about it. There are barely any shops or NPCs at all for that matter. 

Pros
-Nice mountains
-Decent character creation

Cons
-Lack of content
-VERY SMALL MAP
-Animal AI is awful
-Weapon animation/sound is cheap
-Most of the UI and models feel like it's in a purchasable package (classic early access release and abandon feelings here)
-No story (not really a big deal but there is no depth in this game)
-No farming
-The mechanics are super janky when it comes to loading items
-bugs galore

If this is the kind of game you are looking into, I'd recommend farming simulator 22 or 19. If you just want a better hunting game, try theHunter: Call of the Wild.

I enjoy open world crafting games and in many ways prefer this one to the Farming Simulator series for the animal interaction and crafting.  There are some improvements that could be made though.  For example, the issue of electricity.  If I can have a television and there is a refrigerator in the house, why can I not use the refrigerator or purchase additional ones in which to store meat and dairy products? As it is, I'm working with 6 hand-held coolers to store my meat. A few things I'd like to see in future updates: more sound effects and music (the game is way too quiet), some ability to grow my own food including animal feed, additional and more unique farm animals such as alpacas, sheep, dogs, and better instructions.  I went through three table saws before I realized the orange status bar was not a wear/use measurement but was for gas. Yeah, there's a message that comes up when the gas runs out.  But I didn't want my table saw to cop out on me in the middle of a project so at first I wasn't letting it completely run down before selling it back to the shop. There also needs to be a place (like the sink) to fill up those loogli water coolers, or at least tell us somewhere that the water will run out.  My pig died because it ran out of water and I had to read a Forum to figure out why the water stopped refilling.

There are a lot of things that can be improved upon. I.e. driving mechanics, content within the game, etc. However, it is an early access game, and they are ALWAYS working on new updates. They have a discord dedicated to the players, where you can make suggestions, report bugs, etc. And it is the first game I have ever seen that actually listens to the players. Even though this game is still in early access, there is a lot of content to keep you busy, whether its tending to the animals, building, cleaning up your ranch, or just expanding, there is almost never a time to sit still. The added quests for when you are just standing around is an amazing bonus, as it gets extra money in your pocket, and you don't have to just stand there waiting for the cows to be ready to milk, or the chickens to produce eggs. 
I do believe that the map can be expanded by a lot though. It is quite small at the moment, but I will update this once the map update comes out. I hope they continue to grow the way they are, and continue listening to the players of the game (gamers know what they want in games, what can I say?)

This is definitely a game that's meant to be enjoyed with friends, as running a solo ranch is a long, laborious and difficult process. If you decide to play solo as I have, be prepared to scrape together funds by processing planks (raw logs cannot be sold), hunting deer (and if you're ballsy bear), and chicken eggs. There truly is a lot to this game, and it's way more in-depth than I expected for a sim. I haven't been able to manage getting a house built just yet, as resources are relatively expensive (at least for a lowly single player such as myself). 

When I started playing it was during the Winter/Christmas and everything was covered in snow, which was a nice touch. But the daily storms quickly got old as they reduced visibility drastically. Thankfully, it was something the devs ended after a period. 

While the content is limited (according to other reviews), I've not yet explored all of it, so it's possible there will be more added by the time I exhaust what's currently available. 

I just want to build the biggest house there is and run a chicken farm. Right now, I don't even have a chicken coop, because the one I can build is too small for them. So I let them free range during the day and chuck them into the dilapidated barn at night. If there were a creative mode, it would be fun to just build.

bad game

So ... 49hrs in and I'm still enjoying the interaction with chickens & pigs. No ... not like that you naughty sausage. Speaking of which, the fact I can rear, no not rear stop it, bring my animals up, visit the coop after 8pm when they're fast asleep to clean up the poo, feed & water the troughs & then steal the eggs to use my ovoscope to determine which eggs are fertilised, and which eggs to put into my sausage salami mix. Brilliant. Pigs get SO phat, all that extra meat all I'll need is some more tomato sauce in the kitchen. Building is very 'structured', simple but effective. If you've played farming simulator, but wanted to interact with your animals but couldn't, steal the eggs & listen to the hens crying and trying to peck at you through the wire mesh, as you chuckle and think 'ok well you're next for the meat grinder tomorrow'. Or something. But I digress. Want to build an abattoir and use stun guns, pistol or rifle to kill that big rooster that has served his purpose? That big phat hog that can barely walk anymore? Well, now you can. Hunt deer, wolves and bears? Yes you can. Now, a few negatives. Last night I collected 51 pieces of 'wild meat' from the aforementioned animals. I can sell it, yes. Why can't I cook it? Use it as feed for my pigs? They'll eat anything. Also, the constant storms. Way over the top, if I wanted to listen to rain, thunder & lightning all day and night I'd go to Blackpool. Or Wales. Maybe. One last gripe, there's so much to do, but I get 12 minutes of daylight per 'day'? Come now, this isn't GTA Online, this is Ranch SIMULATOR. Give me an option to turn off storms that works, the current option isn't an option. That works. Let me decide how fast or slow I want time to pass as I cut down trees, slaughter pigs and paint my house (not necessarily in that order). Overall? I love it, and you will too. If crouching by the chicken coop at 8pm waiting for them to go to sleep, so you can select which hen or rooster is tomorrow's sausage meat, and take them into your arms, as they dream of flying one day, soaring into the sky, and as they slowly open that one eye, looking at you, thinking 'where are we going' you chuckle and say "I did warn you, you're tomorrow's sausage salami". One last thing, please do not wipe my save game with future updates. I'm building a business here. Thank you.

Can we call this game 3D Stardew?
  
 First of I'm going to talk about the things I love in the game, and then I'm going to talk about things I don't like in the game.

- The game is very successful as a farm life simulator and as a construction game.
- It's not just a farm game, it has some missions, npcs and venues in it. And there are things like car and home customization in the game, as well as hunting mechanics. 
- Co-op gameplay is very enjoyable and there are no big bugs in the game.
- Game is  still evolving, and its producer is paying attention to the feedbacks. 

 So about the negative things 
- Co-op requires epic games account.
- Can be laggy sometimes.
- Animations are not very polished.
- The mechanics of driving might be better it's little bad. And you are immortal when you are driving a car. It's just feels weird.
- It's hard to manage the economy at the start of the game. The game gives you 2 options as you grind for meat or wait for the eggs, milk etc.

Despite the bugs and criticism, I still recommend this game because the developers have done a stellar job so far and I have loved seeing their involvement with their fans!

That said, I just came off of a Stardew Valley high and went hunting for something more realistic. I love Stardew, don't get me wrong, but I wanted something to expand upon that idea. I had looked into Medieval Dynasty and Farmer's Dynasty (which I hesitate to get either because I would want to create my own character), bought Farming Simulator 22 and promptly got it refunded because it wasn't what I was looking for, and tried replaying the lovely My Time at Portia. Something was still missing, and I found this gem of a game. It had an open world, livestock, stores, and so much potential.
And that's the key word, potential.

[b]The open world feels empty. [/b] Besides the 2-3 quest givers and the shop owners, this world feels almost post-apocalyptic. It doesn't feel particularly lived-in, and I'm a little sad I can't go have a burger at the burger shop. Who is the guy serving? Where are the customers? Can I have the two trays of food if no one else is coming in?
I like how this game approaches building by giving you a set number of objects to craft in order to make walls, fences, coops, etc, but [b]it feels so tedious chopping wood and buying metal/concrete[/b]. I spent quite a while trying to find an axe for mining, and a cement mixer or a furnace to make those objects before realizing I just had to buy them. Which, considering I'm in the early game, is impossible for me since I only have $45 now. It also takes me out of the immersion just slightly, but not enough to say it's jarring.
I haven't encountered any bugs other than some clipping errors when I go into the small farmhouse and when placing blueprints, but I consider those minor and they don't detract from the experience.
[b]The tutorial under-prepared me[/b]. I had no idea horses were even in the game until I looked into discussions, I didn't know what else to do after demolishing my house, and I still feel lost in the world

I want to praise the developers for the [b]stunning visuals and the little details[/b], like the radio, the gas station (just the entire gas station, I love individually filling my ATV and the jerrycan separately!), the little details in the houses, everything that lets you appreciate the game. The quests are fun even though I've only done two so far, and I hope to see more of them.

I will edit my review as more updates become available. If you're skeptical on buying it now, I'd wait for a sale or wait until an update comes where it introduces something you're excited for. If you love building a farm and taking care of animals in the wilderness, this is a great game!

This one is not an easy review, because I really wish there was a "maybe". There are some things that you should know before you buy this.

tl;dr -- It has annoying mechanics that won't fully manifest for hours, and once you get to them it becomes worse than a grind. It just sucks the fun right out of the game.

1.) The animals, once you get to that point, will run (I mean they bolt) for any open gate or door they can find. IT's like their entire purpose is to just run away as soon as they can. This is not representative of domestic animals, especially cows. They will tell you something about double gates or whatever, but the animals become incredibly difficult to deal with because you spend the entire day trying to get them to cooperate. Which leads me to the next problem...

2.) A second in real life is a minute in the game. That means for every 1 minute real time an hour in game passes. This makes a full 24 hour cycle, 24 real minutes. Which is too fast. You will spend most of that 24 minutes fighting your animals. I should be fair and note that if you want to slaughter them, it's a lot easier to do that, as you just enclose them, feed them, then shoot them No need to chase them down, dead animals don't run ... 

3.) The ability to slow down time and pause has been "high on their list" for _months_ and it is still not there. They continue to say it has something to do with multiplayer. Fair enough. A simple check to see if a person is connected to a server and if not, enable the ability to modify time or at the very least PAUSE. I know that pausing will not break a single player game because I use process explore to suspend the process .. and it causes zero issues for me. 

4.) The driving is ... absurd. You get kind of used to it, but the fact that they have an option to "flip vehicle" is because you will eventually lose control and flip the car over and then have to flip it back. 

5.) The flash light and headlights are way too bright. In fact the lighting in general is kind of off too dark for indoor lamps and too bright for headlights / flashlights

6.) I hope you like living in rain. Because it rains ALL THE TIME. Short of monsoon seasons I can't think of any place on earth that rains  every single day. Thurnderstorms, mind you. Again it's another one of those "it is on our list" but I can't imagine it would be too difficult to dial down the chances of a storm. 

7.) The devs are active in the forums, which is nice, but I have begun to get the impression that they really don't care what any of us think. They seem to like their game the way it is so they just say "it's high on our list" then follow it up with "whenever we get to it" ... uhm ... no. It's either high on the list which means they would have addressed it after 8 months or it's not really on their list. 

8.) The vehicles you can get used to, the rain is another thing that you get used to. The issue becomes simply the ability to manage the animals -- other than just shooting them and making sausages -- combined with everything else just becomes too much at a point for me. 

9.) There is no auto save option. You have to remember to do it and since you will spend so much time trying to move a cow to a milking area, it is very easy to forget and have a couple of hours real time go by and no save so if it crashes .... 

All of this, for me, just becomes too much soI decided to move on.

As this is an early access game, it is one of the best I've seen in a while personally. It reminds me a lot like farming simulator and goat simulator with the goofy jumping physics and bouncy wheels.

Pros: 
Concept is amazing, though with limited access to the game, there is still a decent amount of content.
Building is very basic and easy to get along with.
Raising chickens, pigs, cows, etc, is very satisfying, can be difficult at first but smooth once you have the rythm

Cons:
The money making system is a bit difficult and you may feel the need to be on a tight, consistent grind
Hunting/Combat is bland and boring. Stealth doesn't really exist especially when 80% of lined up shots miss. You go from stumbling upon an animal to chasing it through the woods like skyrim. (Add on) The new rifle is good but I have no idea where it is pointing while aiming

Overall opinion/review:
Very basic, fun game, but still needs polish. High hopes for this. I love this game so much for only being out for about a month of early access, I am excited for more and new content for this game and look forward to it's future.

Would you like to relax in the country and raise some animals, taking your time and living the slow country life in a simulator? If so, you have come to the wrong game!

This sim captures the atmosphere of the country and the never ending and ever-growing task list of country living perfectly. Those who think raising a bunch of animals is easy or peaceful likely haven't done it. And this game captures the stresses in a fantastic way.

From the tedious amounts of resources to build something most games treat as trivial to never having enough money and every animal's tendency to go where you least want them to go at the worst time. It is fantastic.

Then there is the addition of things like coolers for storing several meat products at once, it strikes a great balance between realism and simulation. 

Overall, fantastic game with a fantastic future, the feel of this sim is just so good.

The fact people are shitting on the graphics and animations of this game is really a shame.  This game isn't made to be taken as seriously as people seem to assume.  It's a fun, goofy game with that early-access charm.  My partner and I love working on our farm together.  The developers have a clear road-map and communicate with their community regularly about new features and updates.

Don't go into this game expecting a life-like farming experience.  Go into it seeking the charm of a home-brew game.  You'll have plenty of challenge making money to grow your farm and keep your animals alive (especially if you're working solo).

In short, I highly recommend this game if you're seeking something that scratches the ranching itch, but doesn't take itself seriously.

I bought this game a while ago and have just started playing. This is a resource gathering sim, as well as a ranching/hunting game. You can go out into the wilderness with your handgun and hunt wild game, you can raise and breed livestock for meat, milk and eggs, and you can build things like a farmhouse, barns, coops, and more. So far as I can tell, there's no growing crops, and you do have to buy a lot of the materials you need for buiilding. The only material you can get for free is wood, which you can obtain from trees on your property. If you like a pretty mellow game where you can simulate building a ranch from basically nothing, then you'll like this. It combines some realism that you'd find in games like farming simulator with some quality of life simplification (you don't have to do every single step every single time).

April Update:

June Update:
I'm playing on the unstable build at the minute and the update add a lot it is super fun! The ability to build your own house is such a fun idea (I haven't done it yet but I plan to), being able to build your buildings anywhere on your ranch is also a really good update, it's much more fun to play when you can put buildings where you want. March 2022 Update:

EDIT - Just additional comments this paragraph. Improvements, new animals, etc. have continued coming and more planned. I believe one planned update is some farming too so that you can grow your own feed. That would be awesome as the drive to get feed is too expensive and takes too long. On ranch I always had a feed store nearby which was nice even if we grew our own feed because it had the hardware supplies etc.too. My last ranch I was on was actually about 10% ranch and 90% farm in terms of area as we had 10,000 acres of farmland on the ranch but also over 30,000 acres of leased farmland around the county we farmed. Even 30 years ago the farming part made over $1M profit after taxes and subtracting the feed for our own few thousand cattle. Plus we had free honey since allowed a beekeeper to use a little land in exchange for a few hundred pounds of honey per year. This is a fantastic deal from a small developer. For those making videos, it would be nice if someone made video guide showing solo play. All of the best videos seem to be cooperative play and don't help a lot for a solo player although they are mostly good videos.

Ok so Yes I love this game but it crashes more than a smash up derby car! That could be my PC but I have yet to find a fix for it. Any way this game is hilarious. Edit: I do recommend this game to anyone who likes farm games! I now have 88 hours invested into this game! The game is still grate but with so many issues I wish they would focus on fixing them before adding more things that add more problems! Don't get me wrong it is still new and i love the game. I still recommend this game. Just know it has a lot of probables. they say to email them with concerns but I have done everything they recommended and still had the same probables. Me and some tech friends sat down and did what we do best and found a fix for almost every problem fixed in to one thing!!!!! Always play as administrator! You cant just click play! You have to close out of Steam Power app, Right click on it, and go to RUN AS ADMINISTRATOR. Or right click on the game itself and go to RUN AS ADMINISTRATOR. That fixed every CRASH, ERROR CODE, AND GRAPHICAL issues i have had!!

Overall not a bad game with some real potential. I enjoy the time building and milling. Money is  slow coming, but given enough time I'm sure I'll have more than I can spend. My only real complaints are about the poor lighting design, lack of bank features, and a few glitches.. There's no indoor lighting in any of the buildings. The house you build has electricity to work the TV, but no indoor lights. It makes zero sense. Store buildings are pitch black when it gets dark. There's no ability to build outdoor light around your ranch so that you can see to get back to your house or even keep working. Being able to actually use the Bank for a loan wouldn't hurt either. Selling 6 eggs a day isn't paying the bills. The only glitchy thing I've come across so far is that logs randomly disappear right after chopping a tree down or meat disappearing after processing an animal. I look forward to the progress that can be made and features that they'll add.

***Edit:
I have discovered the lights within the home buildings, there are light switches. The store buildings still need lighting, but not a huge issue. And I have finally created a steady source of income utilizing animals and food processing. Things are looking up.

The game has a baseline level of fun. It truly does. But there is so, SO little to do in the game right now. Repetitively chop and slice wood half with slow machines (the best one is still slow, and you have to do each and EVERY SINGLE LOG, time after time) or "tend" to chickens (press e every 2 or so in-game days). Train Horses, or feed and kill cows (you can milk them too) and pigs. 

A LOT of potential, but so goddamn boring as-is. It needs a lot of work, and I hope they can be honest to themselves with that fact, and keep this in development for a long while still. 18-24 months is not going to cut it at all the way things are going. Nearly a year in Early Access and... This? This is it? I don't even know how to get the damned rifle they tease, instead shooting the "massive" 3 types of game with a revolver. They don't tell you how to get better, of course. 

There is a short tutorial that count as 11 quests. Takes all-in-all maybe 15-20 minutes. Then boom. No more quests. At all. Just your flavor of tedium. I've had more fun shoveling IRL shit than playing this game. Most of my playtime by far is just waiting for some stupid fucking wooden planks to saw in half. Good God just work on the game. This is worth maybe $5, and it's $25 goddamn dollars?! Check out how many tested, true fantastic games you can get for $25 on here. What a rip-off. 

You can build in this game, requiring planks, metal and concrete. Metal is a fortune and can only be bought, concrete is cheaper, can only be bought. You can make planks but it is so tedious that it is hardly worth it. Some items require 100s of planks IIRC and you get 2 at a time sawing a log that you have to manually drag into the machine. Then you wait 10 excruciating seconds in the fastest machine to get them. The slower one is more like an honest-to-God real-life minute for 2 lousy planks. 

I'm keeping this in my library, because I do believe it will be good - one day - but with how it is currently, by the end of development, this better be Oblivion-tier gaming, or else it was a rip-off indeed.

Immediate Edit: Update for Rifle and some more quests coming on the 24th (of March?!) rifle is advertised, yet not in the damn game yet, taking a year for a rifle. Whoopee.
Fun to play, and fun to manage. Hopefully there will be more content soon like maps, new animals to manage, and stuff to use, too.

So I like this game. But there isn't much to it. I do recommend this game to anyone who doesn't know much about sandbox games and wants to get into it. This game has so much potential. It does have bugs. Things that are frustrating. But I looked passed a lot of the bugs and glitching from having to many animals and more things. Found that I had a really good few days. I want to see this game grow. I want to see more added into this game... Oh but for the love of God, fix the store parking areas for selling. Mostly the burger shop. When you pull around back to sell, it seems there should be some kind of path, like a drive-way? or any kind of road? lol. I get stuck on the rocks, and hills in the pathway.

First of all the nature in this game is frickn beautiful. They've really managed to emulate the vastness and peace of living deep in the country, right down to the eerie quiet at night. Bravo. Seriously. Also, I love the fact that I can hop into my little car, crank the radio and mario kart my a$$ into town and barely burn a drop of gas. Driving in this game is just straight up fun. And, thank you, thank you, THANK YOU for not putting horns on the girl cows.  The amount of farming games that make characters "milk" a cow with horns is astounding. And I'm like "that's not milk. you shouldn't drink that". 

Now for the stuff I'm not super fond of.
At the time of this review, there is no controller support. I play on a gaming laptop while laying on my livingroom couch and half watching old Markiplier videos (don't judge, it's how I unwind). Mouse and wasd is kinda awkward.
The dynamic weather is a little too dynamic. Maybe it's just a bug, but it always rains at night, and rains or snows at least once a day.
When you destroy a thing, you don't get back any of the materials you used to build it.

All in all, super solid game that scratches nearly all of the sim itches.

Highly recommended and addicting. Pros: Very realistic, money is tight, keep at it - eggs and deer meat, slaughter the whole zone if you can!! Forces you to learn time management (day/night) like a real rancher would. Killing deer and bear is fun and makes you money - it's not CoD but who cares? Storms..OMG...so realistic and will scare the crap out of you (lightning/thunder/rain changes soft and hard rains). I like how the prices change for selling your stuff at the burger joint. You can make some good money, almost twice what the general store offers. Sooo much easier on you when you get the windmill (refills all water bins) and granary built btw (refills all food troughs). Cons: hard to generate money in beginning for metal which is desperately needed (make lights so you can work at night, curing bins for meat/cheese etc.). 

Excited to see what the future holds for this game!!!

This game is my latest favorite. It still has a lot of potention waiting to be released. I enjoy it the way it is now spending all my time milking my lovely cows and making cheese. But when I found out with the latest announcement that they're developing fishing and plant growing I got excited. I mean if it stayed like this it would be boring at some point but the good thing is the developers really care about player comments and make regular changes.

I saw it had good reviews and wanted to give it a try. The tutorial was nice and simple, but problems become obvious very quickly. The controls are very clunky, the vehicles don't have any weight to them, the map is empty and feels like it was drawn on a top down display. I like the game as it's come along so far.  It's certainly a step-up from the initial release and the devs are routinely upgrading and improving the game so it's not abandon-ware!

There are criticisms (Feb., 12th, 2022 review date) though:  

The game has fair amount of 'asset flip' in it, many of which I recognize from other games I play!  Hopefully those will be replaced in the future w/o breaking the game.
The game play loop is fun, but you really can't fail as there are no costs beyond asset purchases to it just takes time to 'win' as it were.  The economy & risk is, essentially, non-existent. 
The vehicles really steer poorly.  

It's definitely not any where near the complexity of 'Farming Simulator.'

In short, it's lightweight fun.  If you're looking to run your complex, multi-million dollar farming complex...  This ain't it.  If you're looking to have some fun and play an enjoyable, albeit lightweight, ranching simulator at a fair price, you can't go wrong with this game.
Once you sit down, shoot some deer, get some pigs and just keep on grinding this game is a fun experience.
