I want to start with, This Is a fun game for what it is at this time!    
  I may change this review in the future, but this game might be TOO early access tbo.
      I am giving this game 7/10 in my eyes it has a lot of Cons atm.
           "Very Small edits after July update"
   A few pros are that this game has multiplayer, It feels stable only had like one disconnect, Movement is good, The placement of houses etc is good we can build a few prefab buildings or in the style of "ark or the forest" you can build your own buildings not.. much to fill it with except the 3 animals.. and a table... but I have high hopes for this, and can not wait for this to be extended in the future. The animals are cute and when you get baby's they are adorable. When i look at the Discussion page they try to answer and help people with real problems i LOVE that...

That being said sadly here are some cons with the game "still at this time". There is some issues with the driving it can feel like you are needing to turn harder so you hold the button longer and then BAM it accelerates the turn so you almost do a 360. The carrying one log at a time and ONLY getting 2 planks makes building.. VERY grindy.. yes you can stack the logs on the vehicles ok but.. still with that being almost all the game offers atm it takes hours to build a non-prefab house alone... " new July patch added being able to carry 8 planks " It is also a shame that you can not seem to replace trees AND with that being said there is no way for us to grow our own wheat or something to feed our animals ..........
**with a game that has the word ranch and FARM in its description on the store page.... how about a small amount of farming or green house???**
  So every day "at the beginning" you are almost forced to kill some deer, wolves or bear "bear and wolves are great because they run to you" to get wild meat and sell it to a store just to be able to afford gas and feed and more bullets, A big con is animals can "still" stave to death when they plop to the ground at 2100 "9PM" so when i would like to use the night time to hunt or something i am forced to sleep because they are to stupid to wake up and eat or drink and the Status bars do not stop...  another BIG flaw is they can get stuck on the water troughs and feed troughs and then die that way do, you can not rely on the " automation " the game offers like the wind mill and silo " silo may be broken at this time anyway"
And maybe the biggest one!!!
 THIS GAME NEEDS AUTO SAVES!!!!

   THIS GAME NEEDS AUTO SAVES!!!

OK so the graphics are decent "not like RTX ON lol" but good enough for this game, I have seen a few floating plants in this new map they have in the beta, a lot of the map feels the same and the landscape does not offer much in respect to different tree types or rock types.

Sound
Thunderstorms are  too long and constantly happening. Animals make a little sound but not much hope to see this change in the future 

Overall
7/10  AT THIS TIME IN "Early access" !!!!
 EVEN with all the flaws "ATM"  i would still recommend this game but.. maybe when it is further out of Early access..

What is wrong with this game, i lost my saved games. Started game today and no option to continue...

Yes, this is in Early Access but it's terrible. You can overlook that movement is a bit clunky but there is stuff that is extremely badly thought out. The Devs say they are trying to give their user base what they want. Really....?

You start off getting a worn ranch and need to run around fining stuff and repairing your vehicle. Tedious. When you get into the vehicle you have to then start the vehicle and then drive. Do the users want this or do they just want to get in and drive. Yes, this is a simulation but how far do you want to go? Opening tins, cooking, eating and then washing and drying up afterwards?

You then need to drive your erratic vehicle to fill with petrol. You pull up, get your jerry-can and fill it before using it to fill your car. Any chance I could just fill the car directly from the pump? Nope. So I now have a half empty\empty jerry-can and probably a half empty car.

Next we go to buy a radio. Other than to show you the basics it's again a bit pointless. The best is yet to come. You drive to get some tools. You go to the computer and it starts a Monty Python sketch. "Excuse me, I've just bought some tools and some chickens, Where are they?" "Yes Sir, we've thrown them into the car park." "What?" "Yes, we've scattered them all over he car park." Perhaps it's a good job I didn't buy eggs. You go to look for them and some are difficult to highlight and grab. Annoying.

So 24 minutes in I got a refund. This should have been good but the "ideas" are so poorly thought out and ludicrous. I rarely write bad reviews for early access but I can't understand why this is "very popular". That was the reason I bought the game. To me this is extremely misleading. Here's another view to consider before buying.

a nice game for those who love farming

Hunt until you can make cheese and meat products, continue to make said cheese and meat products until you can get a new house, new car, continue this until you've finished the game; anything else is an accessory of being able to make more cheese and meat. 
       The name "Ranch Sim" is indicating of it being a ranch simulator, where you can raise livestock and have actual choice in where you go as far as ranch content; Do you want to farm, raise livestock, cook? well you can't farm, and all you can do is make meat and cheese.  
       Driving around is cool, but that's all it is. Call it driving around the country simulation. Hunting was fun until it did nothing for you except waste gas; When you needed the money in the beginning, once you killed a few deer none would spawn, but there would be situations of 3 bears in the same area at any random time.
      I understand that this is early release; I wanted to love this game so much. I can't; For the fact they claim it to be what it falls so far from being; a ranch simulation.. Also, Having joined the discord and try to ask questions about the games direction, it seems to have little plans as far as furthering the simulation aspect. Though they're adding a new trailer and horses, but this will only inevitably help you make more meat and cheese products. This is a meat and cheese production simulation.
      While this game can be fun; I don't see it going anywhere currently with how the developers seem to be handling it. And disclaimer; it is not a Ranch simulation... it's grind incessantly until all you can think about is meat and cheese and multipliers, and lack of functionality of any store or immersive experience.
       This is a drive around and hunt for awhile until meat and cheese is your life sim. There is nothing else to the game. It seems as if they're going to further the meat and cheese production with free placement soon. The title is misleading.

EDIT: I feel honoured, thanks you guys. I was honestly a little angry with the game when I wrote this so I will say for the people who are looking to get this game:
This game is bottom line okay, for the price don't waste your money. 

They call it "Ranch Sim," when they have no plan of furthering that aspect of the game in terms of living. It's more of a money making simulation, and you get a farm. 

 Having a slightly functional farm simulation, 

a realistic gas simulation, 

a beautiful scenery simulation,

a hunting simulation,

 a making cheese and meat and that's the only reason you farm simulation

 because there's not a lot of ways to make money and the game doesn't go much deeper than that simulation, 

or just take simulation out of the name and call it The Ranch.. 

Look; yes it's early released and there is work to be done, but the devs are misleading, and the game is way too overpriced for what they have Put into it, and the name. Please lord the name. I don't know if it's clear but it actually upsets me that they have not put any work into the actual playable simulation aspect; even the tutorial from the beginning misleading you into thinking there's more of a simulation aspect; when there isn't.

A sandbox where you can drive and shoot things, with gaming mechanics that are SO basic, no story / VERY LITTLE SATISFYING GAME PLAY. I had so much hope for a game of this genre, but this.. It couldn't even be a tycoon it has such a lack of immersion; but it doesn't fit the simulation genre in the way they try and place it.  When I said no plans of furthering the simulation aspect, that was no joke. They're adding everything else but anything you really want. THIS IS AN AWFUL STRATEGY/MONEY-MAKING GAME. Though they made it look very pretty.

 They are not going to further the simulation aspect in terms of living, though the game style is "technically" simulation, this game does not fit it. It doesn't match it's name.

Until things change. either the game or it's name, my review will stay negative; either way they are not going to change the game for one unhappy person when they're still profiting, poor execution. Hopefully things will get better.

I tried to restart, demolished the house (which was painful after all the time I wasted building it) and built another one, only to have that happen again.  I started an entirely new game, same result.  After spending an evening wasting time trying to complete one quest line, I gave up.  I'll try it again once it's had a bit more time to percolate but if you are looking for a game that is playable, this probably isn't the one for you.

You've heard of SlavJank... now try CountryJank.  Create a character that is one of four versions of Brad Paisley and relive the heady 2008 days of SecondLife, minus the bird-headed BDSM enthusiast who wants to talk about pizza.  There's nothing to do, but you can do it with up to 4 people (one for each version of Brad Paisley).

I have quite a few hours invested in this game.  There are many glitches and things that just plain don't work.  I know it's early release, but making money is damn near impossible and the game gets very boring after a while.  
1.  Why give us an ovoscope?  You can't take the egg from the chicken to go check it without getting attacked. So you already know it's fertizlied and now have to find a place to put it back.  The ovoscope is a waste of money.  You also can't put the egg back in the drawer of the large chicken coop which makes NO sense.

2.  I paid the $300 to build the grain silo but it does NOT keep the feeders full in the barn or coop.  So I'm still schlepping bags of feed and several of my animals went without food for quite some time until I had enough money to buy more bags of feed when I found out the silo wasn't filling the feeders.  Dead chickens and one dead pig.  What a waste of money.

3.  Why does the vehicle you first get use so much gas?  I don't know if they are all like this, but that one sucks the gas down quicker than I can make money to fill it up.  NOT realistic AT ALL.  A vehicle like that actually gets very good gas mileage and would rarely need filling up.  

4.  The windmill which is supposed to keep the water troughs full does NOT.  I am still schlepping water from the poorly engineered well.  The spinning handle is a joke.  Why not a pump of some sort?

5.  I've had a few cows which I had to WALK home (really stupid because who can afford the huge truck) and have only been able to milk one of them. The rest won't attach to the bucket when you press E.

6.  There is no way to tell when the pigs are ready for slaughter.  I usually just slaughter them when they look really big, but I'd like to see a less ridiculous way to know for sure.

7.  The sausage making stuff is a waste of money.  It would not allow me to make sausage.  The only thing I could ever get to work was making ground chicken or pork which is worth less than whole chunks of meat so it's a waste of time. And it won't let you grind or make sausage with wild game, so what good is it?  Very annoying.

8.  Why are there no other people to interact with?  No cars.. No nothing.  The map is just a tiny, desolate joke.  I have been hunting the same two bears (sleep and they respawn) for the whole game.  

There are a lot more issues with the game but I'll stop now.  I hope the July update fixes some of these issues and more.  I see them advertisting that you'll be able to build anywhere but who cares when you can't even make money, or get ahead in the game.  It COULD be a really cool game but as of now, i'm done.

This game has a neat premise, but the content and execution are still so lacking.  Even on sale, it's not worth paying for a game that should still be in closed alpha, calling it early access is lazy and disingenuous.

Being able to only carry one item at a time seems like an interesting mechanic until you realize that includes resources you have to grind out to sell to shops to be able to afford new tools and materials for your ranch.  Also, zero description or UI to let you know what any of that stuff is for.

Oh hey, the game gives you a cart so you can load it with items rather than carry them, well, some items, not all of them fit, and there's a very small limit to what can be laid down in the bed of the cart.  Also, your cart handles like a fat kid greased up and let loose inside a bouncy castle.  The vehicles control so badly, there's actually a command just to try and unstuck them.

It isn't added difficulty that you can't see your co-op partners, or vehicles, or friendly waypoints, on a minimap or the built in HUD-compass, it's just poor design.  


The character customization was pretty good, but that's probably just a basic plug-in for unity games at this point.

As of now, I have to second some of the other negative reviews. I might update accordingly as the game is changing. 

Yes, the game - or better yet - the setting and the whole idea has a lot of potential. Potential that in it's current state is simply not met, which is actually fine. I fully understand that it's in Early Access and everyone seems to do it differently and everyone seems to understand the concept of Early Access differently, so I'm not gonna dwell on that. So this review will be about the game as it is at the time of writing, regardless of pricing or release model. 

The greatest negative aspect of this game that calls itself a simulator is the overall emptiness and lifelessness. It's not a small and not an ugly world. The map even looks a lot better now, after the June/July-Update. It's just plain empty. There's an occasional deer or wolf crossing your path, but that's about it. Shopkeepers are stiff and lifeless. There's an overall lack of sound and animations. Imagine the nicest weather being a thunder storm, which has a lot of atmosphere, nice lighting and sounds (although maybe a little on the loud side). A bright sunny day? Feels painfully dead, there's barely any sound. No breeze in the trees, no birds chirping or random critter noises, just awfully quiet. 

Also many interactions just happen without any sound or animations. You either click on things or press the interaction key and things appear or disappear. Though all this might likely be addressed later in some polishing passes. At least that's what I hope for. 

They did already improve the demolition part of the game by adding animations and physics to destructible parts. This was not the case in the previous time limited demo, which is a big plus for me, so at least you can see that things are being addressed. There is still a lot missing, in my opinion, but again, that might be added later as, understandably, this is not a priority.

The building mechanic has gotten a much needed update since June/July. Predefined plots are no more and it's a true blessing. You only ever start to value these things when they are actually missing. But the developers heard our crying and now there's quite a bit of stuff you can build just wherever you like. This already makes the game feel a whole lot better than before. 
Especially the beginning is a lot less tedious, as you can now place your table saw wherever you want, so you won't have to haul planks from one end of the ranch to the other just to build a chicken coop. 

With meat and deary processing there's also quite a bit more to do in the game. It just takes a little time to get there, as you don't have much money to begin with, so acquiring the necessary tools and livestock can take a while. At least now you're no longer forced to buy a house during the introductory quest, so you don't end up with most of your money already gone. Instead you can already start investing more in chicken and sleep on a mattress in the garage until you've got your business running.

What's already in place for how you do things is still promising. Like having to get gas for your vehicles, visit shops to buy and sell things, cutting trees and sawing logs to get building material, tending to your animals by providing food and water as well as cleaning after them. Also at least carrying items in your hands is animated. All these things that are actually 'simulating' life on a ranch. Again, it does have potential.

Seeing how the most critical things are being addressed in the latest updates, I think the game is on a good way, so I will recommend it from now on.

I decided to wait a few updates to post this review, not because it was bad without the updates, but because of how much was planned for the first few months (and how many small-team early access games don't meat targets at all, I wanted to see the trajectory as well)

This game, is just...I have no words to really describe it simply. It's a Unity engine title, so the textures and models may be common with other titles that also use Unity, but it's done something very different with them. This is like if you took Stardew or Harvest Moon, removed the dating and crop mechanics, and focused on  the animals. They started with just three: Cows, Chickens and Pigs. The latest update (still only available in the unstable branch atm) added breeding for pigs as well as a full overhaul of the map and building mechanics. I'm glad I waited for this review, because if I made it day 1, I'd have been talking about a completely different game.

When it launched, Ranch Simulator had a very large map, with tons of empty space to chase down wildlife between caring for your animals. Now, however, the map is condensed and streamlined where there's an abundance of terrain changes, nothing is too far from another thing, and almost every square inch has something useful now that building actually requires wood for EVERYTHING (and it's actually a really good change).

The building mechanics have always been fun, before the latest update people got creative with boards and logs to make fences and other buildings, but now we can do that with something akin to many survival game base building kits, and I LOVE it. 

The radio in-game, though somewhat generic, is also copyright free, so don't worry too hard about copyright strikes or DMCA if you are using the in-game music for bgm. It is also set up to get louder/quieter based on the distance to the source of the sound, which is a plus.

The team, though small, has met and/or exceeded their goals for new content and quality-of-life upgrades based on suggestions. I say this, after the dev team pushed the much-awaited update to July 15th for full rollout (it's in the unstable branch atm). This is, of course, because of just how much new content and changes were made to the mechanics since the meat update in April. 

I can only wait with anticipation for the upcoming updates. as they've got a pretty stable roadmap ahead (and with them meeting it with few delays till now, you can definitely expect this team to crank out new content regularly for the next 6-12 months as they gear up for the final 1.0 release!). They have images for soon-to-come content like Horses, Goats, Sheep, other breeds of cattle, and the new pig breeding shows how these will all be great additions. The sausage/meat update also put so much more into the game for ways to make money from your ranch by making cheese and sausages.

The game can be a bit rough around the edges, as with the small team some bugs escape their testing before it goes onto the players, but everything spotted has been fixed quickly, if it was a major issue. The team is committed to a great experience for us, as players, and I really enjoy watching content from others in the discord and seeing just what kind of crazy stuff we can do!

If you like sim games like Farm Simulator and House Flipper, this is a game for you. If not, maybe you should look up a few Let's Play vids on Youtube before you make your decision. IMHO, though, if you think you'd enjoy it, I'd snatch it while it's hot. The multiplayer sounds like a blast, and the discord is always active and ready to roll whenever.

8/10, would make sausage again.

Beautiful game for being early access. Only took me a few minutes to be charmed by it's current features. The character customization surprised me with how many more options were available than what I was expecting. The 'tutorial' actually felt fun to play through before the game set me off on my way to freely develop my ranch. I love how the game works: getting to do a lot of work by hand, being allowed to take part in constructing my buildings, having the vehicles (even the UTV you're given) be really useful, the function of actually stacking my items to load the cargo area of my vehicle by myself. The looks fantastic already, and feels great to play. I do hope that with the money I paid to try this game out, that more good things are yet to come as the game gets worked on.

I'm hoping that in the future, you have to do more to construct your buildings: tearing down the old stuff piece by piece was fun, but only putting up the frame of my house (for example) and then the house completes itself was a little disappointing. Redecoration would be a huge plus, unless I haven't unlocked that yet. I do love having a selection of different houses to choose from, for what I want to build for myself.

The map looks great, and has a great ambience. However, I'd love to see small birds and critters... it'd be nice to see a squirrel scampering by while I'm doing my stuff, or hear some birds chirping and see them flying tree to tree.

Vehicles feel pretty good so far, though I'd say some suspension retuning could help. Make the vehicle less rigid and absorb shocks better so the ride is smoother to a degree. How you load the vehicle doesn't seem to have a consequence from what I can tell, maybe a change could be made in the future to add more realism.

Is there any form of gardening / crop planting? I'm not looking to turn this into Farming Simulator, but I'd love to make a small patch / field that I can grow some veggies or other good stuff from. Or have these neat planter boxes set out, similar to Subsistence, for growing instead.

Maybe, as an option in the future, it could be set up so that you can design the house and other buildings yourself... have so that you can decide to use the blueprints like what's available now, or choose to freely put it together yourself within the building zone's limits. Then you could pick 'building blocks' from foundations, floors, wall, ceilings, and anything else needed to construct the building yourself, and have it look however you want!

This is nice game, and it feels pleasant to play! I'd recommend trying it out now and enjoy it yourself or with a couple friends. Again, I hope to see more good things come to this game as they continue to work on it.

I really like the premise of the game but alas, I can't recommend it for the time being. It's pretty barebones right now. A big part of the game is not where it should be at and it's not clear whether this will improve during early access. It could turn around and become amazing or it could release in a few months without much of a compelling gameplay loop. Remains to be seen.

Things I liked:
[list]
    [*]The realistic visuals of the storms
    [*]character look seemed realistic
    [*]the Placing feature, especially with the vehicles
    [*]the mixture between building, managing, hunting
    [*]well optimized ( had constantly over 120 frames)
[/list]

Things I didn't like:
[list]
    [*]way not enough hairstyles, beards, clothes
    [*]graphics are okay, but it suffers from typical things that some other UE4 games suffer from, too. Namely visible dithering,pixelated mush when not close by objects, some absolutely horrendous looking details/ objects as soon as you are not using TAA(characters hair i.e.)
    [*]for a simulator, there is not a lot of detail or simulating going on. I expected it to offer a deeper experience than usual fare, not less
    [*]there are not a lot of interesting or intricate mechanics. It's mostly just click and done. Building, Logging, Sawing, Destroying seem to all just involve braindead click and done. Not really any thought, choices, strategy or process involved.
    [*]whole gameplay loop seems to revolve around amount of dollars. Seems not very compelling. It lacks diversity in it's activites that games like Stardew Valley, Harvest Moon, My Time at Portia, Wurm, Runescape, Valheim, Satisfactory etc. offer.
    [*]map is small and lacks details or any lived-in feel
[/list]

Yeah, it is not a polished game yet, but it got potential. The full price is not worth it, even if it helps the devs making it. This is a 8$ game until it gets to BETA version.

Some minors improvements that I could suggest: 
-UTV engine sound in full speed sounds too rusty, needs some improvements
- Railway passings gets your cars flipped everytime you get some speed, so they need some adjustments.
- The mission with the water barrel and the bucket needs clearer understandings as there are a lot of people who doesnt know where to place the bucket
- A country road path leading to the ranch should be there, similar to the country road which leads to the General Store

Besides all of these, I really enjoy the game and I expect to become better and better!

As is, this game is lacking quite a few features.  At the beginning I spend most of my time waiting for time to pass until I can gather eggs again.  I would like to see more things to do, like fishing, gathering, FARMING to become self reliant.  I would also like to see fill gauges on the feed and water for animals to know how low they are getting.  I was also saddened by the lack of customizability in the buildings.  I was hoping to be able to make my own ranch with the cut lumber.  I LOVE the concept and am very hopeful this will turn into my fav game!
